festinus: <entryFree id="n18035" type="main" key="festi_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">festīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype> (ante-class. form of the <sense id="n18035.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">acc. sing.</hi> festinem in the verse: nunc haec res me facit festinem, Titin. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 482, 33</bibl>; cf. Comic. Lat. ed. R<bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> p. 127</bibl>), <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>festino</etym>, <hi rend="ital">hasty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hastening</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in haste</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quick</hi>, <hi rend="ital">speedy</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: celer, rapidus, velox, etc.): cursu festinus anhelo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:347" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 347</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">veste tegens, tibi quam noctes festina diesque Urgebam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:488" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 488</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">taedia vitae,</quote> <trans><tr>early</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:325" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 6, 325</bibl></cit>; cf.: cruda festinaque <pb n="743" /> <cb n="FEST" /> virtus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:9:716" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 9, 716</bibl>: celeritas, Cod. Th. 16, 5, 53 al. (but in Enn. ap. Char. p. 251 P. the right read. is Vestina, v. Vahl. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0043,001:v. 280" default="NO"><author>Enn.</author> Ann. v. 280</bibl>).—</sense><sense id="n18035.1" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">laudum festinus et audax Ingenii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:5:3:135" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 5, 3, 135</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">voti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:6:75" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Th. 6, 75</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">festīnē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">hastily</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 3, 40</bibl> (so Codd. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:14:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 14, 2</bibl>, where edd. festive).</sense></entryFree>
festive: <entryFree id="n18036" type="main" key="festi_ve_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">festīvē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. festivus <sense id="n18036.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
festivitas: <entryFree id="n18037" type="main" key="festi_vi^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">festīvĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>festivus</etym>, <sense id="n18037.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">festive gayety</hi>, <hi rend="ital">festivity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mirth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">merriment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">joy.</hi> * </sense><sense id="n18037.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">jocum, festivitatem, ferias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 4, 1, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18037.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n18037.3" n="A" level="2"> As a word of endearment (Plautinian): <cit><quote lang="la">mi animule, Mea vita, mea festivitas (for which, shortly after: voluptas mea, meus festus dies),</quote> <trans><tr>my joy</tr>, <tr>my delight</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:1:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 1, 47</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 3, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:176" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 176</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n18037.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A pleasant</hi> or <hi rend="ital">kind demeanor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">kindness</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mei patris festivitas et facilitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:9:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 9, 18</bibl></cit>; cf. festivus, II. A.—</sense><sense id="n18037.5" n="C" level="2"> Of speech, <hi rend="ital">humor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pleasantry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">jocoseness</hi> (Ciceron.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: facetiae, lepor, sal): cum in illo genere perpetuae festivitatis ars non desideretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:54:219" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 54, 219</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">festivitate et facetiis C. Julius omnibus praestitit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:48:177" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 48, 177</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec umquam fuit oratio lepore et festivitate conditior (shortly before: faceta et urbana),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:56:227" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 56, 227</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">summa festivitate et venustate,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 57, 243</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:18:25" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 1, 18, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">imago antiquae et vernaculae festivitatis (corresp. to facetiae and lepores),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:15:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 15, 2</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">Gorgias his festivitatibus insolentius abutitur,</quote> <trans><tr>play of words</tr>, <tr>witticism</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:52:176" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 52, 176</bibl></cit>; Gell. praef. § 4.— </sense><sense id="n18037.6" n="D" level="2"> Post-class., <hi rend="ital">a festival</hi>, <hi rend="ital">feast</hi>: festivitas in cunctis oppidis celebranda, Cod. Th. 15, 5, 3; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Alex. Sev. 63</bibl>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">sollennes, Cod. Th. 6, 8, 1: natalium principis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 6, 4, 30</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
festiviter: <entryFree id="n18038" type="main" key="festi_vi^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">festīvĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. festivus <sense id="n18038.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
festivo: <entryFree id="n18039" type="gloss" key="festi_vo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">festīvo</orth>, <foreign lang="greek">e(orta/zw</foreign>, Gloss. Labb.</entryFree>
festivus: <entryFree id="n18040" type="main" key="festi_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">festīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. festus; lit., feast-like, belonging to a feast; hence</etym>, <sense id="n18040.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">lively</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gay</hi>, <hi rend="ital">festive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">joyous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gladsome</hi>, <hi rend="ital">merry</hi> (syn.: lepidus, urbanus, salsus, facetus). </sense><sense id="n18040.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (ante- and post-class.): festivum festinant diem, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 9, 401</bibl> (Trag. v. 434 ed. Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">ludi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:4:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 4, 1, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">alea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:18:13:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 18, 13, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">locus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2, 1, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 5, 1, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">facinus lepidum et festivum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 2, 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hospitium in lepido loco,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 3, 82</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">festivissimum convivium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:8" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 38, 8 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—* </sense><sense id="n18040.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">festīvum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">festive jollity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">festivity</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in vindemiarum festivo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Heliog. 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18040.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n18040.4" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">agreeable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pleasing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">handsome</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pretty</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">luculenta atque festiva femina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 1, 12</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:5:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 5, 1, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nonne igitur sunt ista festiva?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:5:2:38" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Par. 5, 2, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aedes festivissimae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:1:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 1, 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">area parvula sed festiva,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:17:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 17, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">copia librorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 6, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:6:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 6, 108</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n18040.5" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n18040.6" n="1" level="3"> Of behavior, character, etc., <hi rend="ital">jovial</hi>, <hi rend="ital">jocose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">agreeable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dear</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod te isti facilem et festivum putant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:9:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 9, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puer,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 12 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus (pueris) nihil potest esse festivius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 6, 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">filius,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 36, 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 5, 5, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:68:277" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 68, 277</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n18040.7" n="2" level="3"> As a term of endearment: <cit><quote lang="la">o mi pater festivissime!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:9:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 9, 26</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">festivum caput!</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18040.8" n="3" level="3"> Of speech, <hi rend="ital">humorous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pleasant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">witty</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dulcis et facetus festivique sermonis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:30:108" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 30, 108</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">poëma facit ita festivum, ita concinnum, ita elegans, nihil ut fieri possit argutius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:29:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 29, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:25:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 25, 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acroama,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:22:section=49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 22, § 49</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:39" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 39</bibl>.— <itype>Hence</itype>, <pos>adv.</pos>, in two forms, <orth extent="full" lang="la">festīve</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">class.</orth>) and <orth extent="full" lang="la">festīvĭter</orth> (ante- and post-class.). * </sense><sense id="n18040.9" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Joyously</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gayly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cheerfully</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">loco in festivo sumus festive accepti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:5:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 5, 1, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18040.10" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> * </sense><sense id="n18040.11" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Agreeably</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pleasantly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">delightfully</hi>: o domus parata pulchrae familiae festiviter! Naev. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 510, 16</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n18040.12" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Humorously</hi>, <hi rend="ital">facetiously</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wittily.</hi> </sense><sense id="n18040.13" n="(a)" level="5"> Form festive: <cit><quote lang="la">agere fabellam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:16:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 16, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crimen contexere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:6:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Deiot. 6, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dissolvere argumentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:15:35" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 15, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid odorari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:14:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 4, 14, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tradere elementa loquendi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 28, 92</bibl></cit>. As a particle of assent: <cit><quote lang="la">quare bene et praeclare quamvis nobis saepe dicatur: belle et festive nimium saepe nolo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:26:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 26, 101</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18040.14" n="(b)" level="5"> Form festiviter: Epictetus severe simul ac festiviter sejunxit a vero Stoico, <cb n="FETE" /> qui esset <foreign lang="greek">a)kw/lutos</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:2:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 2, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">respondere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:22:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 22, 6</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: decorare festum festivissime, Poët. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> 2, p. 180</bibl> P. (R<bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> Fragm. Trag. Inc. 223</bibl>).</sense></entryFree>
festra: <entryFree id="n18041" type="main" key="festra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">festra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, v. fenestra.</entryFree>
festuca: <entryFree id="n18042" type="main" key="festu_ca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">festūca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n18042.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a stalk</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stem</hi>, <hi rend="ital">straw.</hi> </sense><sense id="n18042.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n18042.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">qui homo in pratis per fenisecta festucas corradit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=136" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 136</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:15:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 15, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 41, 57, § 116</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:254" default="NO" valid="yes">18, 27, 67, § 254</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n18042.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A rod with which slaves were touched in the ceremony of manumission</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui vindicabat festucam tenebat ... et homini imponebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 4:16" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 4, 16</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vindicta, A.: quid? ea ingenuan' an festuca facta e serva libera'st?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 1, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:5:175" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 5, 175</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n18042.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a straw-like weed which grows among barley</hi>, <hi rend="ital">also called</hi> aegilops, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:155" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 17, 44, § 155</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n18042.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A trifle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">particle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mote</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in oculo fratris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 7, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:6:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Luc. 6, 41</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
festucarius: <entryFree id="n18043" type="hapax" key="festu_ca_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">festūcārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>festuca</etym>, <sense id="n18043.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pertaining to manumission</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:20:10:10" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 20, 10, 10</bibl></cit> (v. the passage in connection).</sense></entryFree>
festucula: <entryFree id="n18044" type="hapax" key="festu_cu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">festūcŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n18044.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little stalk</hi> or <hi rend="ital">straw</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 5, 8, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
festus: <entryFree id="n18045" type="main" key="festus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">festus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>Sanscr. bhas, shine; lengthened from bha-; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">fa-, fai/nw</foreign>, v. for; cf. feriae (fes-iae)</etym>, orig., <sense id="n18045.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the holidays</hi> (in opp. to the working-days), <hi rend="ital">solemn</hi>, <hi rend="ital">festive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">festal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">joyful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">merry.</hi> </sense><sense id="n18045.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n18045.2" n="A" level="2"> <pos>Adj.</pos> (syn.: sollennis, fastus). </sense><sense id="n18045.3" n="1" level="3"> With expressions of time: <cit><quote lang="la">festo die si quid prodegeris, profesto egere liceat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:8:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 8, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">die festo celebri nobilique,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 3, 5, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui (dies) quasi deorum immortalium festi atque sollennes, apud omnes sunt celebrati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:22:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 22, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Syracusani festos dies anniversarios agunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:48:section=107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 48, § 107</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 1, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dies festus ludorum celeberrimus et sanctissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:67:section=151" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 67, § 151</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:24:70" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 24, 70</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lux,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:5:42" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 5, 42</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:6:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 6, 42</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 140</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:15:38" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 15, 38</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">observare festa sabbata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:159" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 159</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n18045.4" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of everything relating to holidays: <cit><quote lang="la">chori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:12:8" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 12, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clamores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:17:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 17, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corona,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:598" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 598</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">fronde,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:459" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 459</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dapes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:9:1" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 9, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mensae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:198" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 7, 198</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:159" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 159</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lusus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pagus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:18:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 18, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbs,</quote> <trans><tr>gay</tr>, <tr>merry</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:11:272" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 11, 272</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:12:752" default="NO">12, 752</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">theatra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 111</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lares,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:58:23" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 58, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">licentiae,</quote> <trans><tr>of the holidays</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:17" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pax,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:795" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 795</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 1, 1, § 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">plebs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domus ornatu,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ritus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 5, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 5, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cespes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:12:2" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 12, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">janua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:12:91" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 91</bibl></cit>.—As a term of endearment: <cit><quote lang="la">mi animule, mea vita, mea festivitas, meus dies festus, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>my holiday</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:1:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 1, 49</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18045.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">festum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a holiday</hi>, <hi rend="ital">festival; a festal banquet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">feast</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and late Lat. for dies festus): <cit><quote lang="la">cur igitur Veneris festum Vinalia dicant, Quaeritis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:877" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 877</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 190</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:390" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 4, 390</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">forte Jovi festum Phoebus sollenne parabat,</quote> <trans><tr>feast</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:247" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 2, 247</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum dii omnes ad festum magnae matris convenissent,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 21, 25</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">Idaeae festa parentis erunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:182" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 182</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">festa venatione absumi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 22, 24, § 91</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 33</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">10, 431</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:2:59" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 2, 59</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 197</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:23:14 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 23, 14 al.</bibl>; Greg. Mag. Homil. in Evang. 2, 26, 10; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 22, 24</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n18045.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">public</hi>, <hi rend="ital">solemn</hi>, <hi rend="ital">festal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">festive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">joyous</hi> (post-Aug. and rare): <cit><quote lang="la">dolor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:2:7:134" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 2, 7, 134</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">festior annus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> III. Cons. Hon. 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">festissimi dies,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Tac. 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aures,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>gladdened</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> B. G. 206</bibl></cit> (but in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:2:7:90" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 2, 7, 90</bibl> the right read. is fata).</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n18046" type="main" key="Festus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Festus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n18046.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman surname.</hi> </sense><sense id="n18046.1" n="I" level="1"> Sex. Pompeius Festus, <hi rend="ital">a Roman grammarian of the fourth century A. D.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">author of a lexicographical work</hi>, De verborum significatione, <hi rend="ital">in twenty books</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of which only the last nine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in a very imperfect form</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remain to us; with an abstract of the whole compiled by Paulus Diaconus in the eighth century.</hi> (Edited by Ottfr. Müller.)—</sense><sense id="n18046.2" n="II" level="1"> Portius Festus, Governor of the Roman Province of Judea, <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Acts, 25, 32 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
fesulae: <entryFree id="n18047" type="main" key="Fe_su^lae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Fēsŭlae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Fēsŭlānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Faes-.</entryFree>
fetalia: <entryFree id="n18048" type="main" key="fe_ta_li^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fētālĭa</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>fetus</etym>, <sense id="n18048.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a birth-day</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>August.</author> Serm. 193</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
feteo: <entryFree id="n18049" type="main" key="fe_te^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fētĕo</orth> (less correctly <orth extent="full" lang="la">foetĕo</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">faetĕo</orth>), <itype>ēre</itype>, no <sense id="n18049.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>Sanscr. dhū-, dhūmas, smoke; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">qu=ma, qu/os</foreign>; Lat. fumus; fetere (or foet-), for fovitere; cf. also foedus</etym>. <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <cb n="FETU" /> <hi rend="ital">to have an ill smell</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to stink</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">an fetet anima uxori tuae?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:5:2:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 5, 2, 44</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">78</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fetere multo Myrtale solet vino,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:4:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 5, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">abstineat a fetentibus acrimoniis allii vel caeparum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:14:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 14, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18049.1" n="II" level="1"> Fig.: <cit><quote lang="la">fi! fi! fetet Tuus mihi sermo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:3:6:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 3, 6, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes civitates lupanaribus fetent,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Salv.</author> Gub. D. 7, 23</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fetesco: <entryFree id="n18050" type="main" key="fe_tesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fētesco</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">faet-, foet-</orth>, no <sense id="n18050.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi> nor <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi>), 3, <hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [feteo], <hi rend="ital">to become stinking</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">fetescit vetusta (aqua),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 20, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fetiales: <entryFree id="n18051" type="main" key="fe_ti^a_les"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fētĭāles</orth> (not fecial-. With Gr. letters <foreign lang="greek">fhtial</foreign>-; v. <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 1, p. 392</bibl>), <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>cf.: for, fari; prop., the speakers, i. e. the ambassadors</etym>, <sense id="n18051.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman college of priests</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who sanctioned treaties when concluded</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and demanded satisfaction from the enemy before a formal declaration of war</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=86" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 86</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:9:21" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 9, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:32:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 32, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:30:14" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 30, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:6:7" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 6, 7</bibl>; 7, 9, 2; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2272 sq.</bibl>; cf. Dict. of Antiq. s. v.</sense></entryFree>
fetialis: <entryFree id="n18052" type="main" key="fe_ti^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fētĭālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>fetiales</etym>, <sense id="n18052.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the</hi> fetiales, <hi rend="ital">fetial</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">jus, quo bella indicerentur, quod, per se justissime inventum sanxit fetiali religione, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:17" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:11:36" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 11, 36</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 29, 108</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ceremoniae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:11:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 11, 8</bibl></cit>: legatus, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the fetial priest</hi>, fetialis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:ib" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl> § 11.</sense></entryFree>
fetidus: <entryFree id="n18053" type="main" key="fe_ti^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fētĭdus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">faet-, foet-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>feteo</etym>. <sense id="n18053.0" n="I" level="1"> Prop., <hi rend="ital">that has an ill smell</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stinking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fetid</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">anima fetida,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:3:3:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 3, 3, 13</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum isto ore fetido teterrimam nobis popinam inhalasses,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 6, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:51" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pisces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:2:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 4, 2, 33</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dejectiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18053.1" n="II" level="1"> Fig., <hi rend="ital">foul</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disgusting</hi>: libido, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 2, 245.—Of heresy (<hi rend="ital">sup.</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">fetidissimus fons,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Hist. Eccl. 7, 11 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
fetifer: <entryFree id="n18054" type="hapax" key="fe_ti^fer"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fētĭfer</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">foet-</orth>), <itype>ĕra, ĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. fetus + fero</etym>, <sense id="n18054.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">causing fruitfulness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fertilizing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Nilus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 3, 3, § 33</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fetifico: <entryFree id="n18055" type="main" key="fe_ti^fi^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fētĭfĭco</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">foet-</orth>), <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>2. fetus + facio</etym>, <sense id="n18055.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to bring forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">breed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hatch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spawn</hi> (postAug.): <cit><quote lang="la">accipitres humi fetificant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 8, 9, § 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">columbarum pulli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:159" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 58, 79, § 159</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">thunni,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 22 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
fetificus: <entryFree id="n18056" type="main" key="fe_ti^fi^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fētĭfĭcus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">foet-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n18056.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fructifying</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">humor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:161" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 51, 74, § 161</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
feto: <entryFree id="n18057" type="main" key="fe_to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fēto</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">foet-</orth>), <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n18057.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [2. fetus] (post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n18057.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to bring forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">breed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hatch</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in quibus (paludibus) plerumque fetant (anates),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:15:7" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 15, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">silvestres gallinae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:8:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 8, 12</bibl></cit>: cf. ib. § 8.—</sense><sense id="n18057.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to make fruitful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fructify</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impregnate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">feminas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:de Cons. Evang. 1:25" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> de Cons. Evang. 1, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">armenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Civ. D. 5:7 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Civ. D. 5, 7 al.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
fetor: <entryFree id="n18058" type="main" key="fe_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fētor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">faet-, foet-</orth>), <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>feteo</etym>. <sense id="n18058.0" n="I" level="1"> Prop., <hi rend="ital">an offensive smell</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a stench</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">jacebat in suorum Graecorum fetore atque vino,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:10:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 10, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:18:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 18, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fetores oris emendare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 8, 27, § 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec fetet fetor amanti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Carm. 18, 348</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18058.1" n="II" level="1"> Fig., <hi rend="ital">foulness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">noisomeness</hi>: reconditorum verborum fetores, Aug. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:86" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 86</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fetorem haereticae pestis evomuit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Hist. Eccl. 5, 47</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fetosus: <entryFree id="n18059" type="main" key="fe_to_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fētōsus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">foet-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. fetus</etym>, <sense id="n18059.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">prolific</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">oves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:143:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 143, 13</bibl></cit>. —Also <orth extent="full" lang="la">fētŭōsus</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, um: <cit><quote lang="la">Lea,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> adv. Jovin. 1, 19</bibl></cit> (al. fetosa); <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Galat. 4, 27</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
fetulentus: <entryFree id="n18060" type="main" key="fe_tu^lentus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fētŭlentus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">faet-, foet-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>feteo</etym>, <sense id="n18060.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">stinking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fetulent</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 277</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">viscera,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 7, 225</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fetura: <entryFree id="n18061" type="main" key="fe_tu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fētūra</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">foet-</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>2. fetus</etym>, <sense id="n18061.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a bringing forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bearing</hi> or <hi rend="ital">dropping</hi> of young, <hi rend="ital">a breeding</hi> (rare but class.). </sense><sense id="n18061.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">secunda pars est de fetura. Nunc appello feturam a conceptu ad partum ... Altera pars est in fetura, quae sint observanda, quod alia alio tempore parere soleat, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:1:18 sq" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 1, 18 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">humana pastorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. 2:10:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 10, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aetas (bovis) feturae habilis,</quote> <trans><tr>fit for breeding</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si fetura gregem suppleverit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:7:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> E. 7, 36</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18061.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n18061.3" n="1" level="3"> Concr., <hi rend="ital">young</hi>, <hi rend="ital">offspring</hi>, <hi rend="ital">brood</hi>: alios dies ad ubertatem lactis feturaeque servanto, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:8:20" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 8, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">minor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:827" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 827</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">optima gallinarum ante vernum aequinoctium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:150" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 53, 74, § 150</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n18061.4" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of <hi rend="ital">young vines</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut omnis fetura sub eo exeat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:179" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 22, 35, § 179</bibl></cit>.— * </sense><sense id="n18061.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the production</hi> of a literary work: libri nati apud me proximā feturā, Plin. H. N. praef. § 1.</sense></entryFree>
feturatus: <entryFree id="n18062" type="main" key="fe_tu_ra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fētūrātus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">foet-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>fetura</etym>, <sense id="n18062.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">made into a fetus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">semen feturatum in corpore,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Val. 25</bibl></cit>. <pb n="744" /> <cb n="FI" /></sense></entryFree>
fetus: <entryFree id="n18063" type="main" key="fe_tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fētus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">foet-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym><mood>Part.</mood>, from ‡ FEO, whence also: fecundus, femina, fenus, felix</etym>, that is or was filled with young (syn.: gravidus, praegnans). <sense id="n18063.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Pregnant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">breeding</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>). </sense><sense id="n18063.1" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">lenta salix feto pecori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:3:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 3, 83</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 50</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vulpes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:27:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 27, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18063.2" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n18063.3" n="a" level="4"> Of land, <hi rend="ital">fruitful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">productive</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(terra) feta parit nitidas fruges, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:994" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 994</bibl></cit>; cf.: terra feta frugibus et vario leguminum genere, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:62:156" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 62, 156</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">loca palustribus ulvis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regio nec pomo nec uvis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:7:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 1, 7, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:662" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 1, 662</bibl>.—Also of plants: <cit><quote lang="la">palmites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:21:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 21, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18063.4" n="b" level="4"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">filled</hi> with any thing, <hi rend="ital">full</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">machina armis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:238" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 238</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">loca furentibus austris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">colla serpentis veneno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:17:448" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 17, 448</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18063.5" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">full of.</hi>—With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">feta furore Megaera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:13:592" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 13, 592</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praecordia bello,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:17:380" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 17, 380</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praecordia irā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:11:203" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 203</bibl></cit>. —With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fetas novales Martis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Bell. Get. 25</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and in a Gr. construction: fetus Gradivo mentem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 14</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18063.6" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">That has brought forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">newly delivered</hi>: veniebant fetam amicae gratulatum, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 312, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">agiles et fetae (opp. tardiores et gravidae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ursa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:803" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 803</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lupa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:630" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 630</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ovis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:1:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> E. 1, 50</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:413" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 413</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">qua feta jacebat uxor et infantes ludebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:167" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 167</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">insueta gravis temptabunt pabula fetas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:1:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 1, 49</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n18064" type="main" key="fe_tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fētus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">foet-</orth>), <itype>ūs</itype> (<sense id="n18064.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">heteroclit. abl. plur.</hi>: fetis, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 489, 6</bibl>, <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">in the foll.</ref></xr>), <gen>m.</gen> <etym>‡ feo, <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">the preced.</ref></xr> art.</etym>.. </sense><sense id="n18064.1" n="I" level="1"> Abstr., <hi rend="ital">a bringing forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bearing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dropping</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hatching</hi> of young (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">pater (Juppiter) curavit, uno ut fetu fieret,</quote> <trans><tr>at one birth</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 2, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quarum (bestiarum) in fetu et in educatione laborem cum cernimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:19:63" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 19, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cornix inauspicatissima fetus tempore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 12, 14, § 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">secundi fetus pecudes signari oportet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:38" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2, 38</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18064.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of plants, <hi rend="ital">a bearing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">producing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae frugibus atque bacis terrae fetu profunduntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:8:25" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 8, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">periti rerum adseverant, non ferre (Arabiam) tantum annuo fetu (casiae), quantum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 18, 41, § 83</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n18064.3" n="II" level="1"> Concr., <hi rend="ital">young</hi>, <hi rend="ital">offspring</hi>, <hi rend="ital">progeny</hi>, <hi rend="ital">brood</hi> (the predom. signif. of the word, in <number>sing.</number> and <number>plur.</number>; esp. freq. in poets; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">catulus, pullus, hinnus, hinnuleus): quae (bestiae) multiplices fetus procreant, ut sues, ut canes, his mammarum data est multitudo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:51:128" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 51, 128</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facile illa (piscium ova) aqua et sustinentur et fetum fundunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fetus ventri exsecti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:217" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 55, 81, § 217</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cervae lactens fetus,</quote> <trans><tr>a fawn</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:637" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 637</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">melliferarum apium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:15:382" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 382</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex die emptionis, et fetus pecorum et ancillarum partus ad emptorem pertinent,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 2, 17, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis (paveat), Germania quos horrida parturit Fetus?</quote> <trans><tr>the German brood</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:5:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 5, 27</bibl></cit>.—So very rarely of human beings: <cit><quote lang="la">si vitium factum esset, ut (mulier) concipere fetus non posset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:2:10" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 2, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18064.4" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of plants, <hi rend="ital">fruit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">produce</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager novatus et iteratus, quo meliores fetus possit et grandiores edere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:30:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 30, 131</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nutriant fetus et aquae salubres Et Jovis aurae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Carm. Sec. 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(arbores) crescunt ipsae fetuque gravantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:253" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 253</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:351" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 351</bibl>: Cithaeron frondet viridantibus fetis, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 489, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">arborei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mutatis requiescunt fetibus arva,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 82</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">4, 231: silvae dant alios aliae fetus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 442</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">triticei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:693" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 693</bibl></cit>: gravidi (<hi rend="ital">of grapes</hi>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:294" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 8, 294</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nucis, i. e. surculus, auricomi,</quote> <trans><tr>the golden-bough</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:6:141" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 6, 141</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 69</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnis fetus repressus exustusque flos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:4:16" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 4, 16</bibl></cit>.—Of veins of metals: <cit><quote lang="la">atros fetus chalybis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:1:230" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 1, 230</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n18064.5" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec ulla aetate uberior oratorum fetus fuit,</quote> <trans><tr>progeny</tr>, <tr>growth</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:49:182" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 49, 182</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animi,</quote> <trans><tr>production</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:24:68" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 24, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dulces Musarum expromere fetus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:65:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 65, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fetutina: <entryFree id="n18065" type="main" key="fe_tu_ti_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fētūtīna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>feteo</etym>, <sense id="n18065.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a stinking place</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dirty puddle</hi> (post-class.). </sense><sense id="n18065.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">moletrina a molendo, quod pistrinum dicimus, ut feratrina, ut fetutina,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 63, 26</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18065.2" n="II" level="1"> Fig.: <cit><quote lang="la">lingua mendaciorum praeministra semper in fetutinis et olenticetis suis jaceat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 278</bibl></cit>: fetutinas grammaticas spectare, Val. Prob. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:20:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 20, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
fex: <entryFree id="n18066" type="main" key="fe_x"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fēx</orth>, <itype>fēcis</itype>, v. faex.</entryFree>
fi: <entryFree id="n18067" type="main" key="fi_1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fī</orth>, <pos>interj.</pos>, <sense id="n18067.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pah! foh!</hi> an expression <cb n="FIBU" /> of disgust at a bad smell: <cit><quote lang="la">Fi, fi, fetet!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:3:6:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 3, 6, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n18068" type="main" key="fi_2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fī</orth>, <sense id="n18068.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">imper.</hi>, from fio, <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref targOrder="U">facio</ref></xr> <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
fiber: <entryFree id="n18069" type="main" key="fi^ber" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fĭber</orth>, fibri[ī], <gen>m.</gen>, = castor, late Lat. beber [whence Germ. Biber; Eng. <sense id="n18069.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">beaver</hi>], <hi rend="ital">a beaver</hi>, Pontici, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 30, 47, § 109</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:28" default="NO" valid="yes">32, 3, 13, § 28</bibl>; Plaut. Fragm. ap. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=90" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 90</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:15:490" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 15, 490</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=79" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 79</bibl> Müll.</sense><sense id="n18069.1" n="2" level="3"> ‡ <orth extent="full" lang="la">fiber</orth>, <itype>extremus</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=79" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 79</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
fibla: <entryFree id="n18070" type="main" key="fibla"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fibla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. fibula <sense id="n18070.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
fibra: <entryFree id="n18071" type="main" key="fi_^bra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fī^bra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>acc. to Doed. Syn. 3, p. 22, kindr. with filum (cf. the Eng. string in both senses)</etym>, <sense id="n18071.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fibre</hi>, <hi rend="ital">filament</hi>, in a plant, in a part of an animal's body, etc. (cf. nervus). </sense><sense id="n18071.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">viriditas herbescens, nixa fibris stirpium, sensim adolescit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Sen. 15, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes radicum fibras evellere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:6:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 6, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">recurvae radicis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:633" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 633</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alliorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> M. 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tubera undique terra circumdata nullisque fibris nixa aut saltem capillamentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 2, 11, § 33</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:9" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:3:21" default="NO">11, 3, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pulmo in duas fibras ungulae bubulae modo dividitur. .jecur in quatuor fibras dividitur,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>parts</tr>, <tr>divisions</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 4, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perlucentes numerare in pectore fibras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:391" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 391</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid fissum in extis, quid fibra valeat, accipio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:10:16" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 10, 16</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">pericula praemonent, non fibris modo extisque, sed alia quadam significatione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 28, 42, § 102</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">altera fibra (jecoris),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:196" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 11, 37, 76, § 196</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:60" default="NO" valid="yes">32, 6, 21, § 60</bibl>: fibrae cincinnorum madentes, Cic. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. G. 1, 120</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n18071.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">entrails</hi> in gen. (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">tura focis, vinumque dedit fibrasque bidentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:935" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 935</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">caesorumque boum fibris de more crematis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:637" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 13, 637</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Promethea,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the liver devoured by the vulture</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:7:355" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 7, 355</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:600" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 600</bibl>: conscia deorum (as giving prognostics; <cit><quote lang="la">v. above I.),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:8:3" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 8, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sibi commissos fibra locuta deos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 1, 104: <cit><quote lang="la">fibraeque repente Conticuere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:1:138" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 1, 138</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque mihi cornea fibra est,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>I am not so callous</tr>, <tr>insensible</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:1:47" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 1, 47</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18071.3" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, like our word <hi rend="ital">bowels</hi>, of the interior of the earth: <cit><quote lang="la">persequimur omnes ejus (terrae) fibras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33 praef" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33 praef.</bibl></cit> § 1.</sense></entryFree>
fibratus: <entryFree id="n18072" type="hapax" key="fi_^bra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fī^brātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>fibra</etym>, <sense id="n18072.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fibrous</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">allium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Priap.</author> 52, 22</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fibrenus: <entryFree id="n18073" type="main" key="Fi_bre_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Fībrēnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n18073.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small river in Latium</hi>, <hi rend="ital">near Arpinum</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that flowed around a country seat of Cicero</hi>, still called <hi rend="ital">Fibreno</hi> or <hi rend="ital">Fiume della Posta</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:1:1" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 3, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:401" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 401</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
fibrinus: <entryFree id="n18074" type="main" key="fibri_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fibrīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. fiber; cf. bebrinus</etym>, <sense id="n18074.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of the beaver</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beaver-</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pelles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 9, 36, § 110</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 19, 22, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 10, 42, § 124</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
fibula: <entryFree id="n18075" type="main" key="fi_bu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fībŭla</orth> (post-class. contr. fibla, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:8:7" default="NO"><author>Apic.</author> 8, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2952</bibl>; <sense id="n18075.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">plur. heterocl.</hi>: <itype>fibula, ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Hadr. 10, 5</bibl>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>contr. from figibula, from figo</etym>, <hi rend="ital">that which serves to fasten two things together</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a clasp</hi>, <hi rend="ital">buckle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">latchet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">brace.</hi> </sense><sense id="n18075.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n18075.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi fibula vestem, Vitta coercuerat neglectos alba capillos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:412" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 412</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so on clothes (frequently set with gold and precious stones, and given as a mark of honor to deserving soldiers),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 139</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 313</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 274</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:19:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 19, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:31:18" default="NO" valid="yes">39, 31, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fibula crinem Auro internectat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:815" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 815</bibl></cit>: trabes binis utrimque fibulis ab extrema parte distinebantur, <hi rend="ital">braces</hi>, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:17:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 17, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 1, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">iligneae, ulmeae, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>bands</tr>, <tr>fillets for making baskets</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 31, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18075.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">P. Blessus Junium hominem nigrum, et macrum, et pandum, fibulam ferream dixit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:58" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 58</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">sententia clavi aliquā vel fibulā terminanda est,</quote> <trans><tr>connection</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1248,001:Laud. Fun. 1" default="NO"><author>Fronto</author> Laud. Fun. 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laxare fibulam delictis voluntariis,</quote> <trans><tr>bonds</tr>, <tr>fetters</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Cor. Mil. 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18075.4" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n18075.5" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A surgical instrument for drawing together the lips of a wound</hi>, Gr. <foreign lang="greek">a)gkth/r</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:26:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 26, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n18075.6" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A stitching-needle drawn through the prepuce</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:25:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 25, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:82:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 7, 82, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:75:8" default="NO">11, 75, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:73" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 73</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:379" default="NO">379</bibl>; Sen. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 16</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Cor. Mil. 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Pudic. 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
fibulatio: <entryFree id="n18076" type="hapax" key="fi_bu^la_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fībŭlātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>fibulo</etym>, <sense id="n18076.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a brace</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bolt that fastens together</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
fibulatorius: <entryFree id="n18077" type="hapax" key="fi_bu^la_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fībŭlātōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>fibula</etym>, <sense id="n18077.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">provided with clasps</hi> or <hi rend="ital">buckles</hi>: saga, Claud. Imp. ap. Treb. XXX. Tyrann. 10; cf. fibulo. <cb n="FICT" /></sense></entryFree>
fibulo: <entryFree id="n18078" type="main" key="fi_bu^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fībŭlo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>fibula</etym>. * <sense id="n18078.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To bind</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fasten together</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:6:13" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 6, 13</bibl>.— * </sense><sense id="n18078.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To fit with clasps</hi> or <hi rend="ital">buckles</hi>: pallia fibulata, Valerian. Imp. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Prob. 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ficana: <entryFree id="n18079" type="main" key="Fica_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ficāna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n18079.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small town of Latium</hi>, <hi rend="ital">near Rome</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the road to Ostia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:33:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 33, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 9, § 68</bibl>; Fest. s. v. ‡ PVILIA, p. 250, 33 Müll.</sense></entryFree>
ficarius: <entryFree id="n18080" type="main" key="fi_ca_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fīcārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>ficus</etym>, <sense id="n18080.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to figs</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fig-</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">crates,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 48, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">culices,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 35, 41, § 118</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vasa, Paul. ex Fest. s. v. ‡ ORCA, p. 180 Müll.: Fauni (perh. so called on account of their rank luxuriance),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Iesai. 5, 13, 21</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18080.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">fīcārĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a fig plantation</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 4, 10, 28</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n18080.2" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">An island near Sardinia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 7, 13, § 34</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ficatum: <entryFree id="n18081" type="main" key="fi_ca_tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fīcātum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (sc. jecur) [id.], <sense id="n18081.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the liver of an animal fattened on figs</hi>, i. q. <foreign lang="greek">sukwto/n</foreign>, Ital. fégato, v. sycotum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:7:3" default="NO"><author>Apic.</author> 7, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Marc. Emp.</author> 22 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:5:114" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 5, 114</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:8:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 8, 88</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 22, 27, § 52</bibl> (dub.; Jan. fartilibus); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:6:71" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 6, 71</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:58" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 13, 58</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex jecore, hoc est ficato, sanguis proicitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Signif. Diaet. Pass. 93" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Signif. Diaet. Pass. 93</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ficedula: <entryFree id="n18082" type="main" key="fi_ce_^du^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fīcē^dŭla</orth> (also written <orth extent="full" lang="la">ficetula</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">ficecula</orth>; cf. Lachm. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:page=205" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> p. 205</bibl>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n18082.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small bird</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the fig-pecker</hi>, <hi rend="ital">becafico</hi>, Motacilla ficedula, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=76" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 76</bibl> Müll.; id. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 48, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0043,001:ib. p. 274:11" default="NO"><author>Lucil.</author> ib. p. 274, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 29, 44, § 86</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:49" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 13, 49</bibl> <hi rend="ital">in lemm.;</hi> 13, 5; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:9" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:18:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 18, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ficedulenses: <entryFree id="n18083" type="main" key="Fi_ce_^du^lenses"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Fīcē^dŭlenses</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>ficedula</etym>, <sense id="n18083.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sellers of small birds</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a comic name of a sort of soldiers</hi>, along with Placentini and Turdetani: <cit><quote lang="la">opus est Ficedulensibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:1:2:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 1, 2, 60</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ficeliae: <entryFree id="n18084" type="main" key="Fi_ce^li^ae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Fīcĕlĭae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n18084.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a place on the Quirinal hill</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:6:27:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 6, 27, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ficetum: <entryFree id="n18085" type="main" key="fi_ce_tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fīcētum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>ficus</etym>. <sense id="n18085.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A fig-plantation</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:41:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 41, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n18085.1" n="II" level="1"> With allusion to ficus, II. B., <hi rend="ital">the piles</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:33:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 33, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ficitas: <entryFree id="n18086" type="hapax" key="fi_ci^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fīcĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n18086.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">abundance of figs</hi>, Nov. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 109, 22</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ficitor: <entryFree id="n18087" type="hapax" key="fi_ci^tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fīcĭtor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n18087.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fig-planter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cultivator of figs</hi>, Nov. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 109, 21</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ficolea: <entryFree id="n18088" type="gloss" key="ficolea"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ficolea</orth>, <itype>palus ficulneus</itype>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=93:8" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 93, 8</bibl> Müll.</entryFree>
ficolenses: <entryFree id="n18089" type="main" key="Fi_co^lenses"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Fīcŏlenses</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, v. Ficulea, II. A.</entryFree>
ficosus: <entryFree id="n18090" type="main" key="fi_co_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fīcōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>ficus, II. B.</etym>, <sense id="n18090.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">suffering with</hi>, <hi rend="ital">piles</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">uxor, maritus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:71:1 sq" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 7, 71, 1 sq.</bibl></cit>—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ficosissimus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Priap.</author> 42</bibl></cit> (Bip. 41, 4): <cit><quote lang="la">ficosissima,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 51</bibl></cit> (Bip. 50, 2)</sense></entryFree>
ficte: <entryFree id="n18091" type="main" key="ficte_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fictē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. fingo, <sense id="n18091.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
ficticius: <entryFree id="n18092" type="main" key="ficti_ci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fictīcĭus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-tĭus</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>fictus, from fingo</etym>, <sense id="n18092.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">artificial</hi>, <hi rend="ital">counterfeit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not genuine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fictitious</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">gemmae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:199 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 13, 76, § 199 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 14, 16, 18, § 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oleum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 15, 7, 7, § 24</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18092.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Feigned</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pretended</hi>: actiones, Ulp. Regul. tit. 28, 12. —<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">fictīcĭe</orth>, <hi rend="ital">in pretence</hi>: justi (Hilar.), Anon. ap. Job, 1, 15.</sense></entryFree>
fictiliarius: <entryFree id="n18093" type="gloss" key="ficti^li^a_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fictĭlĭārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>fictilis</etym>, <sense id="n18093.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a potter</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4189</bibl>; cf. <foreign lang="greek">*)ostrakopoio/s</foreign>, fictiliarius, Gloss. Gr. Lat.</sense></entryFree>
