fictilis: <entryFree id="n18094" type="main" key="ficti^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fictĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>fictus, from fingo</etym>, <sense id="n18094.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">made of clay</hi>, <hi rend="ital">earthen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fictile.</hi> </sense><sense id="n18094.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si id in ceris fingeretur aut fictilibus figuris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:26:71" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 26, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Summanus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:10:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 10, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vasa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 6, 1, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pocula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:1:39" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 1, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dolia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:158" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 12, 46, § 158</bibl></cit>: olla rudis fictilis, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 223</bibl>.—Jestingly applied to labelled wine-bottles: <cit><quote lang="la">ibi tu videas litteratas fictiles epistolas, Pice signatas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:4:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 4, 2, 14</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18094.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">fic-tĭle</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, and more freq. in <number>plur.</number>, <orth extent="full" lang="la">fictĭlĭa</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> </sense><sense id="n18094.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">An earthen vessel</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">balsamum novo fictili conditur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 25, 54, § 116</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:134" default="NO" valid="yes">29, 6, 39, § 134</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia fictilibus (ponuntur),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:670" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 670</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:168" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 168</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:26" default="NO">10, 26</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n18094.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Earthen figures</hi> of deities: <cit><quote lang="la">antefixa fictilia deorum Romanorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 4, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 7, 16, § 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:157" default="NO" valid="yes">35, 12, 45, § 157</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
fictio: <entryFree id="n18095" type="main" key="ficti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fictĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>fingo</etym> (post-Aug.; esp. freq. in Quint.). <sense id="n18095.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A making</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fashioning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">forming</hi>, <hi rend="ital">formation</hi> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">confictio, figmentum): (animalis) fictio a capite sumit exordium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> Opif. D. 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hominis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>creation</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nominum fictio adjectis, detractis, mutatis litteris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:53" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 53</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:19" default="NO">8, 3, 19</bibl>; <foreign lang="greek">*)onomatopoii=/a</foreign>, id est fictio nominis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:31" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 6, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:1:5" default="NO">9, 1, 5</bibl>: Furium, veterem poëtam, dedecorasse linguam Latinam hujuscemodi <pb n="745" /> <cb n="FICU" /> vocum fictionibus, quae, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:18:11:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 18, 11, 2</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n18095.1" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n18095.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A feigning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">counterfeiting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disguising</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in figura totius voluntatis fictio est, apparens magis quam confessa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:46" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">poëtarum,</quote> <trans><tr>fictions</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 21 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: fictiones personarum, quae <foreign lang="greek">proswpopoii=/ai</foreign> dicuntur, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:29" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 29</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">personae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:89" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 3, 89</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:39" default="NO">11, 1, 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,033:7:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Sap. 7, 13</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n18095.3" n="B" level="2"> Rhet. t. t., <hi rend="ital">an assumed</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fictitious case</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a supposition</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fiction</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">adhuc est subtilior illa ex simili translatio, cum, quod in alia re fieri solet, in aliam mutuantur. Ea dicatur sane fictio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:61" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 61</bibl></cit>; cf.: duci argumenta non a confessis tantum, sed etiam a fictione, quod Graeci <foreign lang="greek">kaq) u(po/qesin</foreign> vocant, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:95" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 10, 95</bibl> Spald.: <cit><quote lang="la">est et illa ex ironia fictio, qua usus est C. Caesar, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:91" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 3, 91</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18095.4" n="C" level="2"> Jurid. t. t.: <cit><quote lang="la">fictio legis,</quote> <trans><tr>a fictitious assumption in a case</tr>, <tr>a fiction</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 3:56" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 3, 56</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:35:2:1:section=1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 35, 2, 1, § 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:18" default="NO">18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:41:3:15" default="NO">41, 3, 15</bibl>. For an account of the fictions in use in the formulas of the Roman law, v. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 4:32" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 4, 32</bibl>-38; cf. Savigny, Du Droit Romain, 5, pp. 76-84.</sense></entryFree>
fictitius: <entryFree id="n18096" type="main" key="ficti_ti^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fictītĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. ficticius.</entryFree>
fictor: <entryFree id="n18097" type="main" key="fictor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fictor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>fingo</etym>, <sense id="n18097.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who makes images of clay</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wood</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wax</hi>, etc., <hi rend="ital">an imagemaker</hi>, <hi rend="ital">statuary.</hi> </sense><sense id="n18097.1" n="I" level="1"> (Syn.: pictor, scalptor, sculptor, plastes, statuarius.) <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n18097.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">deos ea facie novimus, qua pictores fictoresque voluerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:29:81" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 29, 81</bibl></cit>; id. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 2, 8, p. 120</bibl> Bip.— </sense><sense id="n18097.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic. in relig. lang., <hi rend="ital">a baker of offering-cakes</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">apud Ennium: Libaque, fictores, Argeos et tutulatos ... Fictores dicti a fingendis libis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=44" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 44</bibl></cit> Müll. (cf. Ann. v. 124 ed. Vahl.); so <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 934</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2281</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2458</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:54:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Dom. 54, 139</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n18097.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A maker</hi>, <hi rend="ital">creator</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:29:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Isa. 29, 16</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">45, 9</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n18097.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n18097.6" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a maker</hi>, <hi rend="ital">former</hi> (Plautin.): <cit><quote lang="la">(fortunae) ... vitae agundae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:2:85 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 2, 85 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnium Legum atque jurium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:3:4:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 3, 4, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">somniorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,005:13:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Deut. 13, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18097.7" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">a feigner</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fandi fictor Ulixes,</quote> <trans><tr>a master of deceit</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:602" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 602</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fictrix: <entryFree id="n18098" type="main" key="fictrix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fictrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n18098.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she that forms</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fashions</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ejus universae materiae fictrix et moderatrix divina est providentia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:39:92" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 39, 92</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Resurr. Carn. 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
fictura: <entryFree id="n18099" type="main" key="fictu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fictūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n18099.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a forming</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fashioning</hi> (ante- and post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">fortunae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:2:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 2, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">satis placet fictura,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>disguise</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:4:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 4, 4, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">avarus ab uno solum verbo inclinatum, quod est aveo eademque fictura, qua est amarus,</quote> <trans><tr>formation</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:5:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 5, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fictus: <entryFree id="n18100" type="main" key="fictus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fictus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from fingo.</entryFree>
ficula: <entryFree id="n18101" type="hapax" key="fi_cu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fīcŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>ficus</etym>, <sense id="n18101.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little fig</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:5:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 5, 4, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ficulea: <entryFree id="n18102" type="main" key="Fi_cu^le^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Fīcŭlĕa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n18102.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small but very ancient town of the Sabines</hi>, <hi rend="ital">situated on the</hi> Via Nomentana, <hi rend="ital">near Fidenae</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:38:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 38, 4</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n18102.1" n="II" level="1"> Derivv. </sense><sense id="n18102.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Fīcŭlensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Ficulea</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Ficulean</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">REGIO,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 111</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Via Nomentana, cui tum Ficulensi nomen fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:52:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 52, 3</bibl></cit> (this is the correct read., inst. of Ficulnensi).— <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Ficulensi,</quote> <trans><tr>at an estate near Ficulea</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:34:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 34, 1</bibl></cit>.—In the orthogr.: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Fīcŏlenses</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">inhabitants of Ficulea</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 9, § 64</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3364</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n18102.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Fīcŭlĕātes</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">inhabitants of Ficulea</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Ficuleans</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=18" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 18</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
ficulneus: <entryFree id="n18103" type="main" key="Fi_culne^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Fīculnĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>ficula</etym>, <sense id="n18103.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of the fig-tree</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ligna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:16:37" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 16, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">folia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:3:7" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 3, 7</bibl></cit>.—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">fīculnĕa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a fig-tree</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Osee, 9, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:13:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Luc. 13, 7</bibl>.— In the form <orth extent="full" lang="la">ficulnus</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, um: <cit><quote lang="la">truncus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 8, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ficus: <entryFree id="n18104" type="main" key="fi_cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fīcus</orth>, <itype>i and ūs</itype> (<sense id="n18104.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">dat. sing.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>, <case>dat.</case>, and <hi rend="ital">abl. plur.</hi>, always of second decl.; in other cases of second or fourth; v. Neue, Formenl. 1, 532 sq.—<hi rend="ital">Masc.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:65:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 65, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:71:6" default="NO">7, 71, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 2, 16</bibl>. The declension and gender were disputed even among the ancients; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 9:section=80" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 9, § 80</bibl> Müll.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 103</bibl> P.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 713</bibl> ib.), <gen>f.</gen> <etym>etym. dub.; cf. <foreign lang="greek">su=kon, svukon</foreign></etym>, <hi rend="ital">a fig-tree.</hi> </sense><sense id="n18104.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">cortex levis fico,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 31, 55, § 126</bibl></cit> sqq.: <cit><quote lang="la">fici, quarum radices longissimae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 16, 31, 56, § 130</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exceptā fico,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 16, 26, 49, § 113</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ficos mariscas in loco cretoso serito,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 8, 1</bibl></cit>, v. marisca: <cit><quote lang="la">homini Phrygi, qui arborem fici numquam vidisset, fiscinam ficorum objecisti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 17, 41</bibl></cit>: Ruminalis and Rumina, v. 1. Rumina, II. A. and <cb n="FIDE" /> B.: <cit><quote lang="la">quod diceret, uxorem suam suspendisse se de ficu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:69:278" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 69, 278</bibl></cit> (for which Quintilian, in making the same statement: <cit><quote lang="la">quod uxor sua e fico se suspendisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:88" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 88</bibl></cit>): <cit><quote lang="la">sub una ficu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 2, 2, § 21</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">pepedi diffissa nate ficus, i. e. ut ficus (cuius lignum magnopere fissile),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:8:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 8, 47</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18104.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n18104.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The fruit of the fig-tree</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a fig</hi>: fici dulciferae, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 103</bibl> P. (Ann. v. 71 ed. Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">ficis victitamus aridis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:4:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 3, 4, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Zacyntho ficos fieri non malas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:5:2:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 5, 2, 102</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per ficos, quas edimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:41:5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 41, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex fici tantulo grano,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Sen. 15, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suamque pulla ficus ornat arborem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:16:46" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 16, 46</bibl></cit>: dum ficus prima calorque, etc., <hi rend="ital">the first ripe figs</hi> (denoting the beginning of autumn), <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 7, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pinguibus ficis pastum jecur anseris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:8:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 8, 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nux ornabat mensas cum duplice ficu,</quote> <trans><tr>a split fig</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 122</bibl></cit>, v. also in the foll.—Ante- and post-class. in <hi rend="ital">masc.</hi>: sicuti cum primos ficus propola recentes Protulit, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 154, 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">grossi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 2, 16</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18104.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The piles</hi> (from their shape): <cit><quote lang="la">cum dixi ficus, rides quasi barbara verba, Et dici ficos, Caeciliane, jubes. Dicemus ficus, quas scimus in arbore nasci: Dicemus ficos, Caeciliane, tuas (al. tuos, v. the commentators, ad loc.),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:65:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 65, 4</bibl></cit> (cf. the same sort of pun in another place, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:71" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 7, 71</bibl>).—Hence <usg type="style">poet.</usg> transf., of <hi rend="ital">one who has the piles</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:52:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 52, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
fidamen: <entryFree id="n18105" type="main" key="fi_da_men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fīdāmen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>fido</etym>, <sense id="n18105.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">trust</hi>, <hi rend="ital">confidence</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">corrige delictum fidamine,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Carm. ad Senat. 83</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fide: <entryFree id="n18106" type="main" key="fi_de_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fīdē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <sense id="n18106.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">faithfully</hi>, v. fidus <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
fidedictor: <entryFree id="n18107" type="hapax" key="fi^de^dictor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fĭdĕdictor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>1. fides-dico</etym>, <sense id="n18107.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a surety</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bail</hi>: fidejussor, Bonifac. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 23" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 23</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
fideicommissarius: <entryFree id="n18108" type="main" key="fi^de^i^commissa_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fĭdĕĭcommissārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>fidei-committo</etym>, <sense id="n18108.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a</hi> fideicommissum or <hi rend="ital">feoffment in trust.</hi> </sense><sense id="n18108.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hereditas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:Inst. 2:23" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> Inst. 2, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:31:1:77:section=24" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 31, 1, 77, § 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">libertas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:40:5" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 40, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:26:2:32" default="NO">26, 2, 32</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 7, 4, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">epistola,</quote> <trans><tr>in which a fideicommissum is created</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:32:1:37:section=3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 32, 1, 37, § 3</bibl></cit>: praetor, <hi rend="ital">that takes cognizance of such feoffments</hi>, Ulp. Regul. tit. 25.—</sense><sense id="n18108.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">fideicommis-sarius</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (sc. heres), <hi rend="ital">one who receives an inheritance through a fideicommissum</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a feoffee in trust</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:32:1:11" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 32, 1, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
fideicommissum: <entryFree id="n18109" type="main" key="fi^de^i^commissum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fĭdĕĭcommissum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. fideicommitto <sense id="n18109.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
fideicommitto: <entryFree id="n18110" type="main" key="fi^de^i^committo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fĭdĕĭ-committo</orth> (also separately <orth extent="full" lang="la">fidei committo</orth>), <itype>mīsi, missum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n18110.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [fides; lit., to intrust a thing to a person's good faith; hence], jurid. t. t., <hi rend="ital">to leave</hi> any thing <hi rend="ital">by last will and testament to be delivered to a third party</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to bequeath in trust</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pater filium praedia alienare prohibuerat, sed conservare liberis et ceteris cognatis fideicommiserat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:32:1:38" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 32, 1, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">avia nepotibus heredibus institutis fideicommisit, ut solida legata fratribus solverent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:35:2:14" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 35, 2, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:30:1:114" default="NO">30, 1, 114</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001::section=3" default="NO">§ 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui intestato decedit et scit bona sua ad fiscum perventura vacantia, fidei fisci committere potest, ib. § 2: fideicommissa libertas,</quote> <trans><tr>given by fideicommissum</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 2:267" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 2, 267</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:40:5:1 sq" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 40, 5, 1 sq.</bibl>—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">fĭdĕĭcommissum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a bequest given for the benefit of a third person</hi>, <hi rend="ital">by way of request</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not of command; and held to be equitably due out of respect to the wish of the testator</hi> (cf. legatum): <cit><quote lang="la">fideicommissum est quod non civilibus verbis, sed precative relinquitur, nec ex rigore juris civilis proficiscitur, sed ex voluntate datur relinquentis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ulp.</author> Fragm. 25, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">De fideicommissis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:30" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 30</bibl></cit>-32; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 2:246" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 2, 246</bibl>-289; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 6, 42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:23" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:70" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 6, 70</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:74" default="NO">9, 2, 74</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
fidejubeo: <entryFree id="n18111" type="main" key="fi^de^ju^be^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fĭdĕ-jŭbĕo</orth> (also separately <orth extent="full" lang="la">fide ju-beo</orth>), <itype>jussi, jussum, 2</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>fides</etym>, jurid. t. t., <sense id="n18111.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to be surety</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bail</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to give</hi> or <hi rend="ital">go bail for</hi> any one: <cit><quote lang="la">filiusfamilias pro patre poterit fidejubere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:46:1:10" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 46, 1, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">servus inscio domino pro quodam fidejusserat et eo nomine pecuniam solverat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:19" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> de Tob. 12, 59</bibl>.—Separate: <cit><quote lang="la">fidejussores et ita interrogantur: ID FIDE TVA ESSE IVBES?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:45:1:75:section=6" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 45, 1, 75, § 6</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 3:115" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 3, 115</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quare scias, quodcumque ab ea ex hac causa stipulatus fueris, id me mea fide jussisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:17:1:60" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 17, 1, 60</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass. impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro quibus fidejussum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:46:1:2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 46, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui fidejusserit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:46:3:38" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 46, 3, 38 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
fidejussio: <entryFree id="n18112" type="main" key="fi^de^jussi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fĭdĕjussĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>fidejubeo</etym>, jurid. <cb n="FIDE" /> t. t., <sense id="n18112.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a giving</hi> or <hi rend="ital">being surety; suretyship</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bail</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">servus fidejussionis nomine obligari non potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:46:1:20" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 46, 1, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:10:2" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 10, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
fidejussor: <entryFree id="n18113" type="main" key="fi^de^jussor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fĭdĕjussor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>fidejubeo</etym>, jurid. t. t., <sense id="n18113.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who gives security</hi> for any one, <hi rend="ital">a bail</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a surety</hi> under the most binding form known to the Roman law, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 3:115" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 3, 115</bibl>-127: <cit><quote lang="la">De fidejussoribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:Inst. 3:20" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> Inst. 3, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:27:7" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 27, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:46:1" default="NO">46, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 5, 57</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">8, 41</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> de Tob. 12, 89</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,029:20:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Prov. 20, 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
fidejussorius: <entryFree id="n18114" type="main" key="fi^de^jusso_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fĭdĕjussōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>fidejussor</etym>, <sense id="n18114.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">relating to surety</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bail</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">causa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:46:3:38" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 46, 3, 38 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> al.</sense></entryFree>
fidele: <entryFree id="n18115" type="main" key="fi^de_le_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fĭdēlē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <sense id="n18115.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">faithfully</hi>, v. fidelis <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
fidelia: <entryFree id="n18116" type="main" key="fi^de_li^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fĭdēlĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n18116.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an earthen vessel</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pot.</hi> </sense><sense id="n18116.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:58:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 58, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:13:2" default="NO">12, 13, 2</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">for wine: tumet alba fidelia vino,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:3:22" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 3, 22</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">in paronomasia with Fides: O Fides, mulsi plenam faciam tibi fideliam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:Aul. 4:2:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aul. 4, 2, 15</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18116.2" n="II" level="1"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">a pail of whitewash.</hi>— Prov.: de eadem fidelia duos parietes dealbare, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to kill two birds with one stone</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to reach two ends by one action</hi>, Cur. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 29 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
fidelis: <entryFree id="n18117" type="main" key="fi^de_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fĭdēlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. fides</etym>, <sense id="n18117.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that may be trusted</hi> or <hi rend="ital">relied upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">trusty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">faithful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sincere</hi>, <hi rend="ital">true</hi> (class.; syn. fidus). </sense><sense id="n18117.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop. </sense><sense id="n18117.2" n="A" level="2"> <pos>Adj.</pos>, constr. <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>, with <case>dat.</case>, or with <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <case>acc.</case> </sense><sense id="n18117.3" n="(a)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum et civis mihi bonus et firmus amicus ac fidelis videretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 6, 14</bibl></cit>: doctus, fidelis, Suavis homo, etc., Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:12:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 12, 4</bibl> (Ann. v. 249 ed. Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">boni fidelesque socii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:37:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 37, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 2, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes">29, 7, 2</bibl>; 22, 37, 4 Drak. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.;</hi> cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sociis multo fidelioribus utimur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:18:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 18, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">est urbs Massilia fortissimorum fidelissimorumque sociorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Font. 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fidelissima conjux,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">medicus multum celer atque fidelis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 147</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">minister,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 4, 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">seu visa est catulis cerva fidelibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 1, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multorum opes praepotentium excludunt amicitias fideles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:15:54" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 15, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consilium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:31:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 31, 85</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">opera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:5:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 5, 14</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">operā Commii fideli atque utili,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:76:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 76, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:1:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 1, 104</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">silentium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 2, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">desideria (patriae),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 5, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacrimae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>true</tr>, <tr>genuine</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:14:127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 14, 127</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18117.4" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui (Cn. Pompeius) unum Deiotarum fidelem populo Romano judicavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:13:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 11, 13, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cave tu illi fidelis potius fueris quam mihi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 4, 2, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illi fuisti quam mihi fidelior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:5:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 3, 5, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">habere aliquem fidelem sibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:3:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 3, 3, 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem sibi fidelem arbitrabatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:21:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 21, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:2:42" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 2, 42</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n18117.5" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam fideli animo et benigno in illam fui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:5:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 3, 5, 22</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:10:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 10, 29</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in amicos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 9, 2</bibl></cit> (others read: in amicis, v. Kritz. ad h. 1.).—</sense><sense id="n18117.6" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">fĭdēlis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a trusty person</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a confidant</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quem tuorum fidelium voles, ad me mittas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 1, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n18117.7" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., of things, <hi rend="ital">to be depended upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">safe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">strong</hi>, <hi rend="ital">firm</hi>, durable (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">nam et doctrina et domus, et ars et ager etiam fidelis dici potest: ut sit, quomodo Theophrasto placet, verecunda tralatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:17:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 16, 17, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in nave tuta ac fideli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:41:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 41, 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lorica,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:707" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 707</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">portus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:5:5" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 4, 5, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">materies terebinthi ad vetustatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 6, 12, § 54</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">structura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Aquaed. 123" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Aquaed. 123</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rimis explendis fidelior pice,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:158" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 36, 64, § 158</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fidelissimum glutinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:236" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 17, 71, § 236</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>, in two forms: <orth extent="full" lang="la">fĭdē-lĭter</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">class.</orth>) and <orth extent="full" lang="la">fĭdēle</orth> (ante- and postclass.). </sense><sense id="n18117.8" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Faithfully</hi>, <hi rend="ital">trustily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">certainly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">surely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">honestly.</hi> </sense><sense id="n18117.9" n="(a)" level="5"> Form fideliter: <cit><quote lang="la">constanter et fideliter in amicitia alicujus permanere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:35:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 35, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vivere simpliciter, fideliter vitaeque hominum amice,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:26:92" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 26, 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obtestatur per sua antea fideliter acta, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 71 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid fideliter curare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:20:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 15, 20, 4</bibl></cit>: valetudini inservire, Tiro ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:17:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 16, 17, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">colere amicos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:31:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 31, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">discere artes ingenuas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:9:47" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 2, 9, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">retinent commissa (aures),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 70</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ejus (memoriae) duplex virtus, facile percipere et fideliter continere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:3:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exstincta parum fideliter incendia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:5" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 5 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n18117.10" n="(b)" level="5"> Form fidele: <cit><quote lang="la">fac fidele sis fidelis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:3:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2, 3, 79</bibl></cit>: militare, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">steg</foreign>. 10, 428. —</sense><sense id="n18117.11" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo propior quisque est servitque fidelius aegro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:563" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 563</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:24:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 24, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n18117.12" n="c" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: ut is optime te laudasse<pb n="746" /> <cb n="FIDE" />  videatur, qui narraverit fidelissime, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:56:2" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 56, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n18117.13" n="2" level="3"> (Acc. to II.) <hi rend="ital">Surely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">strongly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">firmly</hi>: per quorum loca fideliter mihi pateret iter, Planc. in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:23:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 23, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratoris futuri fundamenta fideliter jacere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:4:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 4, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod fideliter firmum est, a primis statim actionibus arripere optimum est,</quote> <trans><tr>firmly grounded</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:4:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 4, 14</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:2:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 2, 6</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui quartanum passus convaluerit, fidelius constantiusque postea valiturum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:12:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 12, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">memoriae inhaerere fidelius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:6:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 6, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:3:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 3, 2</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortunae inaurato fidelissime simulacro,</quote> <trans><tr>very solidly</tr>, <tr>durably</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 3, 19, § 61</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fidelitas: <entryFree id="n18118" type="main" key="fi^de_li^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fĭdēlĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>fidelis</etym>, <sense id="n18118.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">faithfulness</hi> (as shown in one's acts), <hi rend="ital">trustiness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">firm adherence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fidelity</hi> (class.; <cit><quote lang="la">most freq. in Cic.): simplicem praeterea et communem et consentientem ... eligi par est: quae omnia pertinent ad fidelitatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:18:65" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 18, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quantum studio et fidelitate consequi potuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:16:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 13, 16, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maxime operam et fidelitatem desideravi tuam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 16, 12, 6</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in hac fortuna perutilis ejus et opera et fidelitas esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 9, 17 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amicorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:12:9:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 12, 9, 22</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:29:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 29, 71 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">with benevolentia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 13, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fidelitas atque auxilia provinciae illius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:46" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 46 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fides fidelitasque amicum erga,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:5:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 5, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: erga patriam fidelitas, Planc. in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:17:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 17, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
fideliter: <entryFree id="n18119" type="main" key="fi^de_li^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fĭdēlĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. fidelis <sense id="n18119.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
fidenae: <entryFree id="n18120" type="main" key="Fi_de_nae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Fīdēnae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype> (<number>sing.</number> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Fīdēna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:15:91" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 15, 91</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 62</bibl>. Fĭdēna with the <sense id="n18120.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">i</hi> short, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:773" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 773</bibl>), <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a very ancient town of Latium</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the left bank of the Tiber</hi>, <hi rend="ital">five miles from Rome</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Castel Giubileo</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:19" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:17" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 17</bibl>; 22; 33 sq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:35:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 35, 96</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:9:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 9, 1, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:40" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:31" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 79</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl> (5), 1, 36; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 11, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:57 al" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 57 al.</bibl>; cf. Bormann, Alt-Latin. Chorographie, p. 239 sq.—</sense><sense id="n18120.1" n="II" level="1"> Deriv.: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Fīdēnas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Fidenae</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 9, § 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 15</bibl></cit>.—As <hi rend="ital">a surname</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">L. Sergius Fidenas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25" default="NO" valid="yes">25</bibl>.—In <hi rend="ital">plur. subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Fīdēnātes</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Fidenae</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Fidenates</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:17" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 17</bibl> sq.</sense></entryFree>
fidens: <entryFree id="n18121" type="main" key="fi_dens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fīdens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from fido.</entryFree>
fidenter: <entryFree id="n18122" type="main" key="fi_denter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fīdenter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <sense id="n18122.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">confidently</hi>, <hi rend="ital">boldly;</hi> v. fido, <hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
fidentia: <entryFree id="n18123" type="main" key="fi_denti^a1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fīdentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>fidens, from fido</etym>, <sense id="n18123.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">confidence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">self-confidence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">boldness</hi> (a philosophical word of Cicero): <cit><quote lang="la">ejus (fortitudinis) partes sunt magnificentia, fidentia, patientia, perseverantia ... fidentia est, per quam magnis et honestis in rebus multum ipse animus in se fiduciae certa cum spe collocavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:54:163" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 54, 163</bibl></cit>: fidentiae contrarium est diffidentia, et ea re vitium est; <cit><quote lang="la">audacia non contrarium sed oppositum est ac propinquum, et tamen vitium est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit> § <cit><quote lang="la">165: si fidentia, id est firma animi confisio, scientia quaedam est et opinio gravis non temere assentientis, metus quoque est diffidentia exspectati et impendentis mali,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:37:80" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 4, 37, 80</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n18124" type="main" key="Fi_denti^a2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Fīdentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n18124.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small town in</hi> Gallia Cisalpina, <hi rend="ital">between Parma and Placentia</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Borgo S. Donnino</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:28" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:Epit. 88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> Epit. 88</bibl>. <hi rend="ital">Its inhabitants</hi> are called <orth extent="full" lang="la">Fīdentīni</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 15, 20, § 116</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:54" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 54</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
fidepromissor: <entryFree id="n18125" type="main" key="fi^de^pro_missor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fĭdĕprōmissor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>fidepromitto</etym>, jurid. t. t., <sense id="n18125.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a surety</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bail</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro eo, qui promittit, solent alii obligari: quorum alios sponsores, alios fidepromissores, alios fidejussores appellamus. Sponsor ita interrogatur: IDEM DARE SPONDES? fidepro missor: IDEM FIDEPROMITTIS? fidejussor ita: IDEM FIDE TVA ESSE JVBES? etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 3:section=115" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 3, § 115</bibl></cit>:—In another orthogr.: fidei promissor, <foreign lang="greek">pistikeleusths</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
fidepromitto: <entryFree id="n18126" type="main" key="fi^de^pro_mitto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fĭdĕ-prōmitto</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>1. fides</etym>, jurid. t. t., <sense id="n18126.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to be surety</hi>, <hi rend="ital">go bail</hi> for a person, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 3:115" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 3, 115</bibl>, <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">the preced.</ref></xr> art.</sense></entryFree>
fides: <entryFree id="n18127" type="main" key="fi^des1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fĭdes</orth>, <itype>ĕi</itype> (<sense id="n18127.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. sing.</hi> scanned fĭdēï, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Sen. 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 102</bibl>.— Ante-class. and <usg type="style">poet.</usg> form of the <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> fide, like die, facie, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 4, 6, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:4:2:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 4, 2, 68</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:341" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 341</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 506</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 728</bibl>; 737; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 7, 4</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 781</bibl> P.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 53</bibl> ib.; Ritschl, Proleg. p. 90.— <hi rend="ital">Dat.</hi> fide, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:2:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 1, 2, 80</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">91</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">105</bibl>; Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 112, 1</bibl>, or Ann. v. 111 ed. Vahl.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 95</bibl>), <gen>f.</gen> <etym>fido</etym>, <hi rend="ital">trust</hi> in <cb n="FIDE" /> a person or thing, <hi rend="ital">faith</hi>, <hi rend="ital">confidence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reliance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">credence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">belief</hi> (syn.: fidelitas, fiducia, confidentia). </sense><sense id="n18127.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n18127.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">si sciat noster senex, fidem non esse huic habitam,</quote> <trans><tr>that he has not been trusted</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:4:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 4, 52</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">fides ut habeatur, duabus rebus effici potest ... iis fidem habemus, quos plus intelligere quam nos arbitramur ... bonis viris ita fides habetur, ut nulla sit in iis fraudis injuriaeque suspicio ... prudentia sine justitia nihil valeat ad faciendam fidem, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>to give confidence</tr>, <tr>produce confidence</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:9:33" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 9, 33</bibl></cit>; see in the foll.: neque pauci, neque leves sunt, qui se duo soles vidisse dicant; <cit><quote lang="la">ut non tam fides non habenda, quam ratio quaerenda sit,</quote> <trans><tr>to give credence</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 10</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quod si insanorum visis fides non est habenda, quia falsa sunt, cur credatur somniantium visis, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:59:122" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 59, 122</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si ita posset defendere, tamen fides huic defensioni non haberetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:57:section=148" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 57, § 148</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me miseram! forsitan hic mihi parvam habeat fidem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:2:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 1, 2, 117</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum jam minor fabulis haberetur fides,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(fidem) majorem tibi habui quam paene ipsi mihi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:20:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 20, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 18, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex aliis ei maximam fidem habebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:41:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 41, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui maximam fidem suarum rerum habeat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:53:section=131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 53, § 131</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cui summam omnium rerum fidem habebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:19:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 19, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fidem commenticiis rebus adjungere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:55:113" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 55, 113</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">testimonio fidem tribuere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 3, 10</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Cratippus iisdem rebus fidem tribuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:3:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et auctoritatem orationi affert et fidem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:34:120" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 34, 120</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si tota oratio nostra omnem sibi fidem sensibus confirmat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:21:71" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 21, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">constituere fidem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,038:9:31" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Part. Or. 9, 31</bibl></cit>: fidem facit oratio, <hi rend="ital">awakens</hi> or <hi rend="ital">produces belief</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:50:187" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 50, 187</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quoniam auribus vestris ... minorem fidem faceret oratio mea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 3, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquamdiu fides fieri non poterat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:37:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 37, 1</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so with dare (rare): res ipsa fidem sermoni meo dabit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 4, p. 146, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hercules cui ea res immortalitatis fidem dedit,</quote> <trans><tr>assured of</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:24:4:4" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 24, 4, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:74:3" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 74, 3</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">object-clauses</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fac fidem, te nihil nisi populi utilitatem et fructum quaerere,</quote> <trans><tr>evince</tr>, <tr>show</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:8:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 8, 22</bibl></cit>: tibi fidem faciemus, nos ea suadere, quae, etc., <hi rend="ital">will convince</hi>, Balb. et Opp. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 8</bibl>, A. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi fides apud hunc est, nihil me istius facturum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 3, 3, 10</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum vix fides esset, rem ullo modo successuram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:7" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">male fidem servando illis quoque abrogant fidem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:3:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 3, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quorum rebus gestis, fidem et auctoritatem in testimonio inimicitiarum suspicio derogavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:7:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Font. 7, 13</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui abrogare fidem juris jurandi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:15:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Com. 15, 44</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">omnibus abrogatur fides,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 11, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae res fidem abrogat orationi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 1, 10, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imminuit et oratoris auctoritatem et orationis fidem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:37:156" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 37, 156</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multa fidem promissa levant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 10</bibl></cit>: fidem addere, <hi rend="ital">to give credence</hi> (opp. fidem demere): <cit><quote lang="la">ex ingenio suo quisque demat vel addat fidem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>— </sense><sense id="n18127.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic., in mercant. lang., <hi rend="ital">credit</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum fides totā Italiā esset angustior, neque creditae pecuniae solverentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 1, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">scimus, Romae solutione impedita fidem concidisse,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Imp. Pomp. 7, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fides de foro sublata erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">labefacta jam fide,</quote> <trans><tr>credit being impaired</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:4" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecunia suā aut amicorum fide sumpta mutua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 24:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 24, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non contentus agrariis legibus fidem moliri coepit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:11:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 11, 8</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">fidem abrogare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:41:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 41, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fidemque remque, perdere,</quote> <trans><tr>credit and means</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:2:2:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 36</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">res eos jampridem, fides deficere nuper coepit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 2, 5, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nisi fide staret res publica, opibus non staturam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:48:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 48, 9</bibl></cit> Drak.; freq.: res fidesque, for <hi rend="ital">fame and fortune</hi>, <hi rend="ital">property and credit</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">entire resources</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:4:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 4, 2, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:1:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 1, 1, 24</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:2:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 1, 2, 64</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 73:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 73, 6</bibl> Cort.—</sense><sense id="n18127.4" n="2" level="3"> Beyond the mercant. sphere (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">segetis certa fides meae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>return</tr>, <tr>yield</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:16:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 16, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">at tibi ... Persolvat nullā semina certa fide,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:3:62" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 3, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fallax fides unius anni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:32:4" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 32, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quia hanc ejus terrae fidem Menander eludit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:25" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 25</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n18127.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">that which produces confidence</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belief.</hi> </sense><sense id="n18127.6" n="A" level="2"> The quality that produces<cb n="FIDE" />  confidence in a person, <hi rend="ital">trustworthiness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">faithfulness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conscientiousness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">credibility</hi>, <hi rend="ital">honesty;</hi> in things, <hi rend="ital">credibility</hi>, <hi rend="ital">truth</hi>, etc. </sense><sense id="n18127.7" n="1" level="3"> In gen. (erroneously regarded by Cicero as the primary signif. of the word; wherefore he derived it from fio; <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">the foll.</ref></xr> passages): <cit><quote lang="la">fundamentum justitiae est fides, id est dictorum conventorumque constantia et veritas. Ex quo, audeamus imitari Stoicos, credamusque, quia fiat, quod dictum est, appellatam fidem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:7:23" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 7, 23</bibl></cit> Beier; cf. id. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 24, 17</bibl> (Rep. 4, 7, p. 428 ed. Mos.); <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fam. 16, 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">justitia creditis in rebus fides nominatur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Part. Or. 22, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">meo periculo hujus ego experiar fidem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:2:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2, 2, 99</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">fides fidelitasque amicum erga,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:5:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 5, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo antiqua virtute ac fide,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:3:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 3, 3, 88</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">exemplum antiquae probitatis et fidei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:5" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">esse summa probitate ac fide,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vir aequissimus, singulari fide,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quorum fides est laudata,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus facillime justitia et fides convalescit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unde justitia, fides, aequitas?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus virtuti, fidei, felicitati (Gallia) commendata est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:14:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Prov. Cons. 14, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aequitas et fides,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:35" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 35</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">si pudor quaeritur, si probitas, si fides,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 18</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quanta fide, quanta religione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Font. 6, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hinc fides, illinc fraudatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:11:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 2, 11, 25</bibl></cit>: ille vir haud magna cum re sed plenu' fidei, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Sen. 1, 1</bibl> (Ann. v. 342 ed. Vahl.): ubi societas? ubi fides majorum? Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:3:17" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 3, 17</bibl>: nulla sancta societas, nec fides regni est, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:8:26" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 8, 26</bibl> (Trag. v. 412 ed. Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">mea eraga te fides et benevolentia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro vetere ac perpetua erga populum Romanum fide,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:54:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 54, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in fide atque amicitia civitatis Aeduae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 14, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in fide manere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 4, 5</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sincera fide in pace Ligures esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:34:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 34, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si tibi optima fide sua omnia concessit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:49:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 49, 144</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praestare fidem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:37:79" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 37, 79</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:10:42" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Top. 10, 42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 16, 7, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:7:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 7, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">te oro per tuam fidem, ne, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:5:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 5, 55</bibl></cit>: <hi rend="ital">Eu.</hi> Dic bona fide: tu id aurum non surripuisti? <hi rend="ital">Ly.</hi> Bona. <hi rend="ital">Eu.</hi> Neque scis, quis abstulerit? <hi rend="ital">Ly.</hi> Istuc quoque bona, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:10:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 10, 42</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">de pace cum fide agere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:33:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 33, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jussas cum fide poenas luam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:17:37" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 17, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haecne marita fides?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 3, 11: <cit><quote lang="la">Aeacidae dederat pacis pignusque fidemque,</quote> <trans><tr>faithful bail</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:365" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 365</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perjura patris fides,</quote> <trans><tr>perjured faith</tr>, <tr>dishonesty</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:24:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 24, 59</bibl></cit> et saep.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">fides ut anima, unde abiit, eo numquam redit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0622,001:181" default="NO"><author>Pub. Syr.</author> 181</bibl></cit> (Rib.): <cit><quote lang="la">fidem qui perdit, quo se servet relicuo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0622,001:166" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 166</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18127.8" n="b" level="4"> Of inanim. and abstr. things: <cit><quote lang="la">nam cum Gabinii levitas ... omnem tabularum fidem resignasset, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>trustworthiness</tr>, <tr>credibility</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:5:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Arch. 5, 9</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc vero quam habere auctoritatem et quam fidem possunt (litterae)?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 9, 21</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">visa, quae fidem nullam habebunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 18, 58 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">qui non speciem expositionis sed fidem quaerit,</quote> <trans><tr>truth</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:32" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliter oraculorum, aliter haruspicum fides confirmari aut refelli potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:7:36" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 7, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">probationum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4 praef" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4 praef.</bibl></cit> § <cit><quote lang="la">6: liber spectatae fidei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:7:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 7, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paulum distare ab eo (lapide) in unguentorum fide multi existimant Lygdinos, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>in faithful preservation</tr>, <tr>keeping in good condition</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 8, 13, § 62</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18127.9" n="c" level="4"> In poets several times, <hi rend="ital">faithful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">true fulfilment of a promise</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicta fides sequitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:527" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 527</bibl></cit> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">res dicta secuta est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:550" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 550</bibl></cit>): <cit><quote lang="la">vota fides sequitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:8:713" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 713</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">promissa exhibuere fidem,</quote> <trans><tr>were fulfilled</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:7:323" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 323</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">en haec promissa fides est?</quote> <trans><tr>is this the fulfilment of the oracle?</tr></trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:346" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 346</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18127.10" n="2" level="3"> In partic., in jurid. lang., bona fides, <hi rend="ital">good faith</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sincerity;</hi> hence, EX FIDE BONA or BONA FIDE, <hi rend="ital">in good faith</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sincerely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">honestly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conscientiously</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbitrum illum adegit, QVICQVID SIBI DARE FACERE OPORTERET EX FIDE BONA,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:16:66" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 16, 66</bibl></cit>; cf.: quanti verba illa: VTI NE PROPTER TE FIDEMVE TVAM CAPTVS FRAVDATVSVE SIEM, etc.... Q. quidem Scaevola, pontifex maximus, summam vim esse dicebat in omnibus iis arbitriis, in quibus adderetur EX FIDE BONA; <cit><quote lang="la">fideique bonae, nomen existimabat manare latissime, idque versari in tutelis societatibus, fiduciis mandatis, rebus emptis venditis, conductis locatis, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 17, 70</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 6, 1, 15</bibl>: praetor ait: QVI <pb n="747" /> <cb n="FIDE" /> BONA FIDE EMIT, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:6:2:7:section=11 sq" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 6, 2, 7, § 11 sq.</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">bonae fidei emptori subrepta re quam emerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:Inst. 4:1:15" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> Inst. 4, 1, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi lex inhibet usucapionem, bona fides possidenti nihil prodest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:41:3:24" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 41, 3, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tot judicia de fide mala, quae ex empto aut vendito aut conducto aut locato contra fidem fiunt, etc.,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>deception</tr>, <tr>dishonesty</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:30:74" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N.
