D. 3, 30, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bonā fide = certissime,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:7:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 7, 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:10:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 4, 10, 42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:2:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 4, 2, 110</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">mala fide,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:41:2:1:section=6" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 41, 2, 1, § 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18127.11" n="B" level="2"> An assurance that produces confidence, <hi rend="ital">a promise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">engagement</hi>, <hi rend="ital">word</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assurance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">confirmation.</hi> </sense><sense id="n18127.12" n="1" level="3"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">fide data, credamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:2:2:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 2, 2, 61</bibl></cit>: accipe daque fidem, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 1</bibl> (Ann. v. 33 ed. Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">atque etiam, si quid singuli temporibus adducti hosti promiserunt, est in eo ipso fides conservanda: ut primo Punico bello Regulus ... ad supplicium redire maluit, quam fidem hosti datam fallere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:13:39" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 13, 39</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:20:65" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 20, 65</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fidem dare, violare, in fide non stare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,012:10:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Perd. 10, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pompei fides, quam de me Caesari dederat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:9:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 9, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter se fidem et jusjurandum dare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obligare fidem alicui,</quote> <trans><tr>to plight one's faith</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:18:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 5, 18, 51</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">fidem reliquis interponere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fide mea spondeo, futurum ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:14:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 14, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diffidens, de numero dierum Caesarem fidem servaturum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:36:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 36, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si fidem mecum servas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:2:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 2, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tecum servavi fidem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:5:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 5, 1, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:3:1:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 3, 1, 33</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fides juris jurandi cum hoste servanda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:29:107" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 29, 107</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fidem erga imperatorem conservare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:84:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 84, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fidem erga populum Romanum servare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 4, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">servata erga Galbam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in regem suum servata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:5:2" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut fidem vobis praestaremus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:39:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 39, 2</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">fidem alicui praestare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:4:9" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 4, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:15:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 15, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 5:21:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 5, 21, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non servata fides deditis est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 1, 10</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Sen. 20, 75</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 71:17" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 71, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fidem suam liberare,</quote> <trans><tr>to perform his promise</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 20, 47</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">fidem alicujus liberare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 12, 7, 2</bibl></cit>: so, <cit><quote lang="la">fidem exsolvere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:19:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 19, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:23:8" default="NO" valid="yes">22, 23, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:16:12" default="NO" valid="yes">24, 16, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:12:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 12, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:98 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 98 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fidem frangere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:6:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Com. 6, 16</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which violare, v. above,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,012:10:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Perd. 10, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fidem amittere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Eum. 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">istius fide ac potius perfidiā decepti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:38:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 38, 110</bibl></cit>: quantum mea fides studii mihi afferat, <hi rend="ital">my plighted word</hi> (to defend the king), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Deiot. 1, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">contioni deinde edicto addidit fidem,</quote> <trans><tr>confirmed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:24:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 24, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18127.13" n="2" level="3"> Pregn., <hi rend="ital">a given promise of protection</hi> or <hi rend="ital">security</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a guaranty;</hi> hence, in gen., <hi rend="ital">protection</hi>, <hi rend="ital">guardian care</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">introduxi Vulturcium sine Gallis: fidem ei publicam jussu senatus dedi,</quote> <trans><tr>promised him protection</tr>, <tr>security</tr>, <tr>in the name of the public</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 3, 4, 8</bibl></cit>; cf.: Vulturcius interrogatus ... primo fingere alia; <cit><quote lang="la">post, ubi fide publica dicere jussus est, omnia uti gesta erant aperit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 47:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 47, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum se diceret indicaturum de conjuratione, si fides publica data esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 48:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 48, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uti L. Cassius ad Jugurtham mitteretur, eumque interposita fide publica Romam duceret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 32:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> J. 32, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">privatim praeterea fidem suam interponit, quam ille non minoris quam publicam ducebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui Romam fide publica venerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 35:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 35, 7</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">too, simply fides: Lusitani contra interpositam fidem interfecti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:23:89" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 23, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fide accepta ab legatis, vim abfuturam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:33:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 33, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Thais patri se commendavit in clientelam et fidem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:9:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 9, 9</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">se in Chrysogoni fidem et clientelam contulerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:37:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 37, 106</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaere in cujus fide sint et clientela,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 33, 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid in fidem alicujus tradere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:31:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 31, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frugi hominem, plenum religionis videtis positum in vestra fide ac potestate: atque ita, ut commissus sit fidei, permissus potestati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:14:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Font. 14, 30</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">se suaque omnia in fidem atque potestatem populi Romani permittere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in alicujus fidem ac potestatem venire,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 13, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in fide alicujus esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:41:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 41, 97</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:65:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 13, 65, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea (jura) fidei suae commissa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:34:124" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 34, 124</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">civitas in Catonis fide locata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 6, 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">recipere aliquid in fidem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 14, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem in fidem necessitudinemque suam recipere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:19:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 13, 19, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">recipere aliquem in fidem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:15:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 15, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 22, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hortatur, ut populi Romani fidem sequantur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 21, 8</bibl></cit>: <cb n="FIDI" /> jura fidemque supplicis erubuit (Achilles), <hi rend="ital">the protection due to a suppliant</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:541" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 541</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">di, obsecro vostram fidem!</quote> <trans><tr>your protection</tr>, <tr>assistance</tr>, <tr>help</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:4:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 4, 1, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:5:1:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 5, 1, 78</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:1:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 1, 1, 74</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 2, 97</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">fidem vestram oro atque obsecro, judices,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:40:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 40, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deum atque hominum fidem implorabis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:9:section=25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 9, § 25</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so in colloq. lang. frequently elliptic. as an exclamation: Di vostram fidem!</quote> <trans><tr>by the protection of the gods! for heaven's sake!</tr></trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:3:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2, 3, 58</bibl></cit>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:2:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 5, 2, 119</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:4:78 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 4, 78 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 3, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 4, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:1:28 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 3, 1, 28 al.</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tuam fidem, Venus!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:3:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 3, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro deum atque hominum fidem!</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 3, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:4:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 4, 2, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1</bibl>. 5, 2; 1, 5, 11; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:1:9 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 1, 1, 9 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 20:10 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 20, 10 al.</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which: pro deorum atque hominum fidem!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:16:48" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 16, 48</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and in a different order: pro deorum fidem atque hominum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:15:52" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 15, 52</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">also simply pro deum fidem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:67:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 67, 7</bibl></cit> Drak. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.;</hi> and: <cit><quote lang="la">per fidem!</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 100, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 35</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 6, p. 175</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n18127.14" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The faith</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Christian religion</hi> as a system of belief (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">domicilium fidei,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 4, 30 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,027:14:12 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Apoc. 14, 12 al.</bibl></sense><sense id="n18127.15" n="III" level="1"> Fides, personified as <hi rend="ital">a goddess</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeclare Ennius: O Fides alma, apta pinnis, et jus jurandum Jovis! Qui jus igitur jurandum violat, is Fidem violat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:29:104" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 29, 104</bibl></cit> (<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0043,005:v. 410" default="NO"><author>Enn.</author> Trag. v. 410</bibl> ed. Vahl.); cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=74" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 74</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:18:47" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 18, 47</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 23, 61</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">31, 79</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:8:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 8, 19</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:prol. 2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. prol. 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:6:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 3, 6, 46</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">50</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 2, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:292" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 292</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:35:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 35, 21</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 5, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,002:57" default="NO"><author>id.</author> C. S. 57</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n18128" type="main" key="fi^des2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fĭdes</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <number>plur.</number>, or fides, is, <number>sing.</number>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>= <foreign lang="greek">sfi/dh</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n18128.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a stringed instrument</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lyre</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lute</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cithern.</hi> </sense><sense id="n18128.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n18128.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n18128.3" n="(a)" level="5"> In <number>plur.</number> (only so in classic prose): Fides genus citharae, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=89:16" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 89, 16</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">(hominis) omnis vultus omnesque voces, ut nervi in fidibus, ita sonant, ut a motu animi quoque sunt pulsae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:57:216" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 57, 216</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so different from nervi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:14:33" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 14, 33</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:15:39" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 15, 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:54:199" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 54, 199</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:27:75" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 4, 27, 75</bibl> (v. Madv. ad h. l., p. 601 sq.): <cit><quote lang="la">ut in fidibus aut tibiis, atque in cantu ipso ac vocibus concentus est quidam tenendus ex distinctis sonis, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:42" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 42</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:27:75" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 4, 27, 75</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:51:197" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 51, 197</bibl>: <hi rend="ital">Fi.</hi> Fides non reddis? <hi rend="ital">Pe.</hi> Neque fides neque tibias, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:3:4:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 3, 4, 77</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">with tibiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:14" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 10, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:20" default="NO">20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:59" default="NO">11, 3, 59</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Orpheus, Threïciā fretus citharā fidibusque canoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 120</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fidibus cantare alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:3:4:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 3, 4, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fidibus canere praeclare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:2:4" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 2, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:59:122" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 59, 122</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">uti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:39:113" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 39, 113</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicere longum melos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 4, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">placare deos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 36, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">discere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Sen. 8, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">docere aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:22:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 22, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:2:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 1, 2, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vivunt commissi calores Aeoliae fidibus puellae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:9:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 9, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fidibusne Latinis Thebanos aptare modos studet,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to imitate Pindaric odes in Latin poetry</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 3, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18128.4" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">sume fidem et pharetram: fies manifestus Apollo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:15:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 15, 23</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">Teïa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:17:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 17, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cyllenea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:13:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 13, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quodsi blandius Orpheo moderere fidem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:24:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 1, 24, 14</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18128.5" n="2" level="3"> Prov.: vetus adagium est: Nihil cum fidibus graculo, i. e. <hi rend="ital">ignoramuses have nothing to do with poetry</hi>, Gell. N. A. praef. § 19.—</sense><sense id="n18128.6" n="B" level="2"> Esp., <itype>Fides, is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a constellation</hi>, i. q. Lyra, <hi rend="ital">the Lyre</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cedit clara Fides Cyllenia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,060:chapter=381" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Arat. 381</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:5:12" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 5, 12</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">in the form Fidis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:14" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:40" default="NO">40</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 16, 5</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n18128.7" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in <number>sing.</number>, i. q. nervus, chorda, <hi rend="ital">a string</hi> of a musical instrument: <cit><quote lang="la">quae tuba quaeve lyra Flatibus incluta vel fidibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Cath. 3, 81</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fidicen: <entryFree id="n18129" type="main" key="fi^di^cen"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fĭdĭcen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>2. fides-cano</etym>, <sense id="n18129.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a luteplayer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lyrist</hi>, <hi rend="ital">minstrel</hi>, <hi rend="ital">harper</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Socratem fidibus docuit nobilis fidicen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:22:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 22, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:9:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 9, 23</bibl> (with tibicen); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:3:6:4" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 3, 6, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 3, § 296</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg> transf., <hi rend="ital">a lyric poet</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Latinus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 19, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Romanae lyrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:3:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 4, 3, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lyrae Pindaricae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4</bibl></cit>. 16, 28; <cit><quote lang="la">and in apposition: doctor Argivae fidicen Thaliae (Apollo),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:6:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 6, 25</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fidicina: <entryFree id="n18130" type="main" key="fi^di^ci^na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fĭdĭcĭna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>fidicen</etym>, <sense id="n18130.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a female luteplayer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lyrist</hi>, <hi rend="ital">harpist</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:1:1:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 45</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">82</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 2, 48</bibl>; 2, 2, 7 sq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:4:2:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 4, 2, 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 2, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:2:59 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 1, 2, 59 al.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 3, § 296</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
fidicinarius: <entryFree id="n18131" type="gloss" key="fi^di^ci^na_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fĭdĭcĭnārĭus</orth>, <foreign lang="greek">luristh/s</foreign>, Gloss. Phil. <cb n="FIDO" /></entryFree>
fidicino: <entryFree id="n18132" type="main" key="fi^di^ci^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fĭdĭcĭno</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>fidicen</etym>, <sense id="n18132.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to play on the lute</hi> or <hi rend="ital">lyre</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 9, § 298</bibl>; cf. FIDICINO, <foreign lang="greek">luri/zw</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
fidicinus: <entryFree id="n18133" type="hapax" key="fi^di^ci^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fĭdĭcĭnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n18133.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">for playing on stringed instruments</hi>, <hi rend="ital">for luteplaying</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ludus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:prol. 43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. prol. 43</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fidiculae: <entryFree id="n18134" type="main" key="fi^di^cu^lae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fĭdĭcŭlae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, and rarely <orth extent="full" lang="la">fidicula</orth>, <itype>ae</itype> (syncop. fidicla, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 10, 481; 550), <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>2. fides</etym>, <sense id="n18134.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small stringed instrument</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a small lute</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cithern.</hi> </sense><sense id="n18134.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n18134.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">quid si platani fidiculas ferrent numerose sonantes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:8:22" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 8, 22</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n18134.3" n="B" level="2"> Esp., Fidicula, <hi rend="ital">a constellation</hi>, i. q. Fides or Lyra, <hi rend="ital">the Lyre</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:37" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2, 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:222" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 26, 59, § 222</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n18134.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a cord</hi>, <hi rend="ital">line</hi>, a sort of instrument of torture (postAug.): apparatus illi reddendus est suus eculei et fidiculae et ergastula et cruces, Sen. de Ira, 3, 3; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:62" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 62</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:33" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 33</bibl>; Cod. Th. 9, 35, 1.</sense></entryFree>
fidiculanius: <entryFree id="n18135" type="main" key="Fi^di^cu^la_ni^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Fĭdĭcŭlānĭus</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, <sense id="n18135.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a Roman</hi> gens, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:37:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 37, 103</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:10:28 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 10, 28 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
fidicularius: <entryFree id="n18136" type="hapax" key="fi^di^cu^la_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fĭdĭcŭlārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>fidicula, II.</etym>, <sense id="n18136.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">like a cord</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">twisted;</hi> trop.: verba contorta et fidicularia, i. e. <hi rend="ital">entangling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">delusive</hi>, Fronto de Eloq. p. 229 ed. Mai.</sense></entryFree>
fidis: <entryFree id="n18137" type="main" key="fi^dis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fĭdis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, v. 2. fides, I. <sense id="n18137.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
fidius: <entryFree id="n18138" type="main" key="Fi^di^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Fĭdĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>1. fides</etym>, <sense id="n18138.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a surname of Jupiter</hi>, in Dionys. Halic. called <foreign lang="greek">*zeu\s *pi/stios</foreign>, identical with the Sabine Sancus: <cit><quote lang="la">Nonas Sanco Fidione referrem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:213" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 213</bibl></cit>; more usually connected with deus (dius) or medius (i. e. dius or deus, with the demonstr. part. me), and also joined into one word, mediusfidius, as an asseveration, qs. <hi rend="ital">by the god of truth! as true as heaven! most certainly!</hi> itaque domi rituis nostri, qui per deum Fidium jurare vult, prodire solet in compluvium, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 494, 30</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> L. L. 5, § 66</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">per deum Fidium quaeris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 1, 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unum medius fidius tecum diem libentius posuerim, quam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:21:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 21, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam mediusfidius veram licet cognoscas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 35:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 35, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non mediusfidius ipsas Athenas (loqui) tam Atticas dixerim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 3, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:12:17 al" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 12, 17 al.</bibl>; cf. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=147:8" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 147, 8</bibl> Müll.—</sense><sense id="n18138.1" n="B" level="2"> Of <hi rend="ital">Hercules</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Idol. 20</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 4, 204</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
fido: <entryFree id="n18139" type="main" key="fi_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fīdo</orth>, <itype>fīsus sum</itype> (ante-class. form of the <sense id="n18139.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fut.</hi> fidebo, Nov. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 509, 4</bibl>), <itype>3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>root in Sanscr. bandh, unite; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">pei/qw</foreign>, persuade, <foreign lang="greek">pei=sma</foreign>, cable; Lat. fidus, Deus Fidius, foedus; cf.: fascis, fascia; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:Gr. Etym. p. 262" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> Gr. Etym. p. 262</bibl>; but Fick refers fido to root bhidh; Goth. beidan; Engl. bide, to expect; Vergl. Wört. p. 380</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to trust</hi>, <hi rend="ital">confide</hi>, <hi rend="ital">put confidence in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rely upon</hi> a person or thing (rare; in the <hi rend="ital">verb. finit.</hi> mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>; but class. in the <hi rend="ital">part. praes.</hi> and <pos>P. a.</pos>). </sense><sense id="n18139.1" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fidere nocti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:378" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 378</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fugae fidens,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 351</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pestilentiae fidens (with societate fretus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:22:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 22, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">taedae non bene fisa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:827" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 827</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui sibi fidit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 19, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 2, 108</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">puer bene sibi fidens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 6, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18139.2" n="(b)" level="5"> With <case>abl.</case>: hac (Cynosurā) fidunt duce nocturnā Phoenices in alto, Cic. poët. N. D. 2, 41, 106; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 20, 66</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">arcu fisi Getae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:9:78" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 9, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cursu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:545" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 7, 545</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ope equinā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:9:125" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 125</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecuniā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,006:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Lys. 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prudentiā consilioque fidens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:23:81" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 23, 81</bibl></cit>.—Doubtful, whether <case>dat.</case> or <case>abl.</case> (v. Zumpt, Gr. § 413; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">confido): nec nitido fidit adultero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:24:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 24, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pictis puppibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 14, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Jugurtham) Mario parum fidere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 112:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 112, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:7:18" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 7, 18</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenio suo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 13 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suis rebus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 10, 8, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18139.3" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fidis enim manare poëtica mella Te solum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 19, 44</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:1:432" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 1, 432</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">parum fidens pedibus contingere matrem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:615" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 615</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fisus cuncta sibi cessura pericula, Caesar,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:5:577" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 577</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18139.4" n="(d)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: ubi fidentem fraudaveris, i. e. <hi rend="ital">who trusts</hi> (you), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 3, 2, 15</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">fīdens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <hi rend="ital">P.a.</hi> (lit., trusting to one's self, self-confident; hence), <hi rend="ital">confident</hi>, <hi rend="ital">courageous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bold</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui fortis est, idem est fidens, qui autem est fidens, is profecto non extimescit: discrepat enim a timendo confidere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:7:14" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 7, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fidenti animo gradietur ad mortem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 46, 110</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tum Calchas haec est fidenti voce locutus, id. poët. Div. 2, 30, 64: fidens animi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 61</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 59 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">fidens armorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:373" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 373</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Romanus, fidentior,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 16, 12 al.</bibl></cit>—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: fidentissimo <pb n="748" /> <cb n="FIDU" /> impetu acies motae, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 27, 10, 12</bibl>.— <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">fīdenter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">confidently</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fearlessly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">boldly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">timide fortasse signifer evellebat, quod fidenter infixerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:31:67" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 31, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 8, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">confirmare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:56:240" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 56, 240</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:8:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 8, 18</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">paulo vellem fidentius te illi respondisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 1, 21</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">accedere fidentissime,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 17, 1, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>August.</author> Ver. Rel. 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
fiducia: <entryFree id="n18140" type="main" key="fi_du_ci^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fīdūcĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>fido</etym>, <sense id="n18140.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">trust</hi>, <hi rend="ital">confidence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reliance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assurance</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n18140.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n18140.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">prope certam fiduciam salutis praebere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:8:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 8, 6</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">jam de te spem habeo, nondum fiduciam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 16" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spes atque fiducia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:20:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 20, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tyrannorum vita, nimirum in qua nulla fides, nulla stabilis benevolentiae potest esse fiducia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:15:52" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 15, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc se colle Galli fiduciā loci continebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:19:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 19, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantam habebat (Curio) suarum rerum fiduciam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:37:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 2, 37, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arcae nostrae fiduciam conturbare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:12:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 12, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitae nostrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:356" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 356</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">falsa'st ista tuae, mulier, fiducia formae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3</bibl></cit> (4), 24, 1; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:16:321" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 16, 321</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fiducia alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:14:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 14, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil est, quod in dextram aurem fiducia mei dormias,</quote> <trans><tr>by reason of any confidence you have in me</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:29:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 29, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantane vos generis tenuit fiducia vestri?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 132</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae sit fiducia capto,</quote> <trans><tr>on what the captive relied</tr>, <tr>hoped?</tr></trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">humanis quae sit fiducia rebus,</quote> <trans><tr>reliance</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 152</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mirabundi, unde tanta audacia, tanta fiducia sui victis ac fugatis,</quote> <trans><tr>self-confidence</tr>, <tr>confidence in themselves</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:37:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 37, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mei tergi facio haec, non tui fiducia,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>at my own peril</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Plaut.</author> Most, 1, 1, 37</bibl></cit>; for which, with the <hi rend="ital">pron. possess.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mea (instead of mei) fiducia opus conduxi et meo periculo rem gero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:4:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 4, 100</bibl></cit>: nunc propter te tuamque pravus factus est fiduciam, <hi rend="ital">reliance on you</hi> (for tuique), <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 3, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hanc fiduciam fuisse accusatoribus falsa obiciendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:2:30" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 2, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praestandi, quod exigebatur, fiducia, id. prooem. § 3: nec mihi fiducia est, ut ea sola esse contendam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:12:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 12, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18140.3" n="b" level="4"> Concr.: <cit><quote lang="la">spes et fiducia gentis Regulus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:2:342" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 2, 342</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:6:1" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 6, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n18140.4" n="B" level="2"> In partic., for fiducia sui, <hi rend="ital">self-confidence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">boldness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">courage</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes alacres et fiduciae pleni ad Alesiam proficiscuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:76:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 76, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">timorem suum sperabat fiduciam barbaris allaturum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:10:1" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 10, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consul ubi, quanta fiducia esset hosti sensit, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:46:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 46, 5</bibl></cit> and 8: <cit><quote lang="la">hostis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:29:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 30, 29, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nimia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,016:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Pel. 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fiduciam igitur orator prae se ferat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:13:51" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 13, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">simplicitate eorum et fiduciā motus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:25" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non quo fiducia desit (mihi),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:17:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 17, 37</bibl></cit>. —With a play in the meaning A. supra: <hi rend="ital">Pe.</hi> Qua fiducia ausus (es) filiam meam dicere esse? <hi rend="ital">Ep.</hi> Lubuit; <cit><quote lang="la">ea fiducia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:5:2:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 5, 2, 32</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18140.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> * </sense><sense id="n18140.6" n="A" level="2"> Objectively (synon. with fides, II. A.), <hi rend="ital">trustiness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fidelity</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut quod meae concreditum est Taciturnitati clam, fidei et fiduciae, Ne enuntiarem cuiquam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:2:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 1, 2, 105</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ibo ad te, fretus tua, Fides, fiducia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:6:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 3, 6, 50</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18140.7" n="B" level="2"> Jurid. t. t., that which is intrusted to another on condition of its being returned, <hi rend="ital">a deposit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pledge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">security</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pawn</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mortgage</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si tutor fidem praestare debet, si socius, si, cui mandaris, si qui fiduciam acceperit, debet etiam procurator,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:10:42" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Top. 10, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fiduciā acceptā ... fiduciam committere alicui,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 21, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per fiduciae rationem fraudare quempiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 3, 7</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">judicium fiduciae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:6:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Com. 6, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:30:74" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 30, 74</bibl>: reliquorum judiciorum haec verba maxime excellunt: in arbitrio rei uxoriae, MELIVS AEQVIVS; <cit><quote lang="la">in fiducia, VT INTER BONOS BENE AGIER, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:15:61" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 15, 61</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi porro illa formula fiduciae, VT INTER BONOS BENE AGIER OPORTET,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 12, 2</bibl></cit> (cf. also <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:17:66" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Top. 17, 66</bibl>); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 2:59 sq" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 2, 59 sq.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 2, 13, 1</bibl> sqq.; cf. Dict. of Antiq. p. 443.</sense></entryFree>
fiducialiter: <entryFree id="n18141" type="main" key="fi_du_ci^a_li^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fīdūcĭālĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>fiducia</etym>, <sense id="n18141.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">confidently</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">speramus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Conf. 9:13" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Conf. 9, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:11:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 11, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
fiduciarius: <entryFree id="n18142" type="main" key="fi_du_ci^a_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fīdūcĭārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id. II. B.</etym>. <sense id="n18142.0" n="I" level="1"> Jurid. t. t., <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">relating to a thing held in trust</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fiduciary</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">heres,</quote> <trans><tr>that receives any thing in trust</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:36:1:46" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 36, 1, 46</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3524</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tutela,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:Inst. 1:19" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> Inst. 1, 19</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 1:172" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 1, 172</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n18142.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> beyond the jurid. sphere, <hi rend="ital">intrusted</hi>, <hi rend="ital">given</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">held in trust</hi>: optimum ratus, eam urbem Nabidi veluti <cb n="FIGL" /> fiduciariam dare, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:38:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 38, 2</bibl>: opera, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:17:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 17, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">regnum, Auct. B. Alex. 23, 2: imperium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:9:8" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 9, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fiducio: <entryFree id="n18143" type="main" key="fi_du_ci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fīdūcĭo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>fiducia</etym>, <sense id="n18143.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to pledge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mortgage</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">EA CONDITIONE, NE FIDVCIENT, NE VENDANT, NEVE ALIO QVO GENERE ID SEPVLCRVM ALIENARE VLLA POTESTAS SIT,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 638, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Murat. 794, 1</bibl>; cf. FIDVCIAT, <foreign lang="greek">u(poti/qetai;</foreign> FIDVCIATVS, <foreign lang="greek">u(potiqe/menos,</foreign> Gloss. Philox.: <cit><quote lang="la">sub pignoribus fiduciati,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Idol. 23</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fidus: <entryFree id="n18144" type="main" key="fi_dus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fīdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>fido, that one may rely on</etym>, <sense id="n18144.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">trusty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">truslworthy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">faithful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sure</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n18144.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop., constr. <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>, with <case>dat.</case>, <usg type="style">poet.</usg> also with <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> </sense><sense id="n18144.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil est stabile quod infidum ... Neque enim fidum potest esse multiplex ingenium et tortuosum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:18:65" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 18, 65</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">(amico) probo et fideli et fido et cum magna fide,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 4, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tum se intellexisse, quos fidos amicos habuisset, quos infidos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:15:53" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 15, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amici,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 5, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sodales,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:1:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 1, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fidissima atque optima uxor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:14:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 14, 4, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conjux,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 142</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bonus atque fidus judex,</quote> <trans><tr>impartial</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:9:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 4, 9, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">medici,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 8, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">interpres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 133</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fidiora haec genera hominum fore ratus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil fidum, nihil exploratum habere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:26:97" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 26, 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">familiaritates fidae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:8:30" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 8, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">canum tam fida custodia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:63:158" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 63, 158</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vis canum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1222" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1222</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">pectus canum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:864" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 864</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:12:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 12, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fido animo,</quote> <trans><tr>firm</tr>, <tr>steadfast</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:15:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 15, 13</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n18144.3" n="B" level="2"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(servum) quem domino fidissimum credebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:28:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 28, 13</bibl></cit> (but cf.: fidus est amicus, fidelis servus, Don. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:2:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 1, 2, 26</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">quae fida fuit nulli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:6:77" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 6, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec tibi fidam promittis Lacaenam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:5:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 5, 99</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne quid usquam fidum proditori esset,</quote> <trans><tr>no faith should be kept with a traitor</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:11:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 11, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut eos sibi fidiores redderet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:16:5:2" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 16, 5, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18144.4" n="C" level="2"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg> with <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">regina tui fidissima,</quote> <trans><tr>most faithful towards you</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:659" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 659</bibl></cit>; and with <hi rend="ital">gen. partit.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">juvenum fidos, lectissima bello Corpora, sollicitat pretio,</quote> <trans><tr>the trusty ones</tr>, <tr>trustiest of the youth</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:2:483" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 2, 483</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18144.5" n="D" level="2"> With <hi rend="ital">in</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>, and <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in amicos fidissimus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 7, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fidi ad bella duces,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Nemes.</author> Cyn. 82</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18144.6" n="E" level="2"> With <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">sperabam te mihi fidum in hoc nostro amore fore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:91:1 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 91, 1 sq.</bibl></cit> —</sense><sense id="n18144.7" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, objectively of inanim. and abstr. things, <hi rend="ital">sure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">certain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">safe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">trustworthy</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose; in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:6:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 6, 10</bibl>, fuga fida is not critically certain; v. Orell. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi> ad loc.). </sense><sense id="n18144.8" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">aures,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:382" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 382</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spes fidissima Teucrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:281" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 281</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ensis,</quote> <trans><tr>trusty</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 524</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alii litora cursu fida petunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 400</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec unquam satis fida potentia, ubi nimia est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pons validus et fidus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 15, 15 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">male fidas provincias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 1, 52</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n18144.9" n="B" level="2"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(oppidum) naviganti celerrimum fidissimumque appulsu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">statio male fida carinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">montem tantos inter ardores opacum et fidum nivibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:5:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 5, 6</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nox arcanis fidissima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:192" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 192</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">camelino (genitali) arcus intendere, orientis populis fidissimum,</quote> <trans><tr>the surest</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:261" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 49, 109, § 261</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">refugium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:5:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 5, 8</bibl></cit>. — <itype>Hence</itype>, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">fīde</orth>, <hi rend="ital">faithfully</hi>, <hi rend="ital">trustily</hi> (perh. only in the <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">quae mihi a te ad timorem fidissime atque amantissime proponuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:16:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 16, 4</bibl></cit> (al. fidelissime): <cit><quote lang="la">fidissime amicissimeque vixerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:12:8:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 12, 8, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n18145" type="main" key="fi_dus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fīdus</orth> = foedus, <sense id="n18145.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a league</hi>, v. 2. foedus <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
fidusta: <entryFree id="n18146" type="gloss" key="fidusta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fidusta</orth>, <itype>a fide denominata, ea quae maximae fidei erant</itype>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=89" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 89</bibl> (cf. confoedusti).</entryFree>
figlinus: <entryFree id="n18147" type="main" key="fi_^gli_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fī^glīnus</orth>, <itype>or</itype>, in the uncontr. primary form, <orth extent="full" lang="la">fĭgŭlīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. figulus</etym>, <sense id="n18147.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a potter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">potter</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s</hi>- (cf. fictilis). </sense><sense id="n18147.1" n="I" level="1"> Form figlinus: <cit><quote lang="la">creta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:9:3" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 9, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 10, 36, § 66</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n18147.2" n="B" level="2"> <pos>Subst.</pos> </sense><sense id="n18147.3" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">figlīna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> </sense><sense id="n18147.4" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">The art</hi> or <hi rend="ital">trade of a potter</hi> (sc. ars), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:2:23" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 2, 23</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n18147.5" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">A potter</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s workshop</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pottery</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 6, 12, § 82</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:159" default="NO" valid="yes">35, 12, 46, § 159</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 1, p. 371 sq.</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">in the form FIGVLINA,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 935</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18147.6" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">figlīnum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">an earthen vessel</hi>, <hi rend="ital">crock</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 3, 27, § 46</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:170" default="NO" valid="yes">34, 18, 50, § 170</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">opus figulinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:189" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 36, 25, 64, § 189</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fabricae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:198" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 56, 57, § 198</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 5</bibl>, <cb n="FIGO" /> 10, 3.—</sense><sense id="n18147.7" n="II" level="1"> Form figulinus: <cit><quote lang="la">opus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 11, 47, § 130</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fornaces,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 6, 200</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
figmen: <entryFree id="n18148" type="main" key="figmen"><orth extent="full" lang="la">figmen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>FIG, fingo</etym>, <sense id="n18148.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">formation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">figure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">image</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Apoth. 798</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1035</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">figminis figura,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 3, § 222</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
figmentum: <entryFree id="n18149" type="main" key="figmentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">figmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym> (post-class.), <sense id="n18149.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">formation</hi> (cf. fictio). </sense><sense id="n18149.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n18149.2" n="A" level="2"> In abstr.: <cit><quote lang="la">verborum,</quote> <trans><tr>the forming of new words</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:20:9:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 20, 9, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18149.3" n="B" level="2"> In concr., <hi rend="ital">a figure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">image</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">animalis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:12:12" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 12, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">figmento deae caelitus lapso,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 22, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aerea figmenta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 14, 6, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18149.4" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Any thing made</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a production</hi>, <hi rend="ital">creation</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:29:16 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Isa. 29, 16 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n18149.5" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">a fiction</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">poëtarum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 7, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">somniorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 4, p. 155</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
figo: <entryFree id="n18150" type="main" key="fi_go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fīgo</orth>, <itype>xi, xum, 3</itype> (archaic <sense id="n18150.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">part. perf.</hi> ficta, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:7:4" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 7, 4</bibl>), <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>Gr. <foreign lang="greek">sfi/gg-w,</foreign> to bind fast; <foreign lang="greek">sfigmo/s, fi=mo/s,</foreign> muzzle; cf. fīlum, for figlum. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:Gr. Etym. p. 186" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> Gr. Etym. p. 186</bibl>; Germ. dick. dicht; Engl. thick. etc., Corss. Krit. Nachtr. p. 233</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to fix</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fasten</hi>, <hi rend="ital">drive</hi> or <hi rend="ital">thrust in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">attach</hi>, <hi rend="ital">affix</hi> (class.; cf.: pango, configo, defigo). </sense><sense id="n18150.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, constr. <hi rend="ital">aliquid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">aliquid in</hi> with <case>abl.</case> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> also <hi rend="ital">in</hi> with <case>acc.</case>, or <hi rend="ital">aliquid</hi> with <case>abl.</case> only): <cit><quote lang="la">imbrices medias clavulis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 21, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">palum in parietem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 4, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mucrones in cive an in hoste,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:14:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 14, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tabulam decreti Caesaris aut beneficii,</quote> <trans><tr>to post up</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 1, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 5</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Antonius accepta grandi pecunia fixit legem a dictatore comitiis latam,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>posted it up as having been carried</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:12:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 14, 12, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">adsentiri, ne qua tabula ullius decreti Caesaris figeretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 1, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fixit leges pretio atque refixit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:622" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 622</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quique aera legum vetustate delapsa, noscerent figerentque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec verba minacia aere fixo legebantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam damnatis crucem servis fixeras,</quote> <trans><tr>hadst fixed in the ground</tr>, <tr>erected</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:6:section=12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 6, § 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">feraces plantas humo,</quote> <trans><tr>to plant</tr>, <tr>set</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 115</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clavos verticibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:24:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 24, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cuneos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 14, 24, § 109</bibl></cit> (dub.): <cit><quote lang="la">veribus trementia (frusta),</quote> <trans><tr>to fix on spits</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:212" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 212</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spicula pectore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:13:2" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 13, 2</bibl></cit> (3, 4, 2 M.); <cit><quote lang="la">for which: harundo in vertice fixa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:8:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 8, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cristas vertice,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:701" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 701</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fumantes taedas sub pectore,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 457</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">notas in collo dente,</quote> <trans><tr>to impress</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:8:38" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 8, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virus in venas per vulnera,</quote> <trans><tr>injects</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,060:chapter=432" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Arat. 432</bibl></cit>: vestigia, <hi rend="ital">plants his steps</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">moves on</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:159" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 159</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">arma quae fixa in parietibus fuerant,</quote> <trans><tr>fastened up</tr>, <tr>hung up</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:34:74" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 34, 74</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">scuta sublime fixa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 31, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arma ad postem Herculis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arma thalamo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:495" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 495</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arma Troïa hic,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 248</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clipeum postibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 287</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dona Laurenti Divo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 768</bibl></cit>: ID AES AD STATVAM LORICATAM DIVI IVLII, S. C. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 6, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui spolia ex hoste fixa domi haberent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:23:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 23, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:43:11" default="NO" valid="yes">38, 43, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">navalem coronam fastigio Palatinae domus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:17" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">luteum opus celsā sub trabe (hirundo),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:158" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 158</bibl></cit>: ipse summis saxis fixus asperis, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:44:107" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 44, 107</bibl>, and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:19:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 19, 43</bibl> (Trag. v. 413 ed. Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem cruci,</quote> <trans><tr>nail</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:1:30" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 1, 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:10" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus lacerum in crucem (al. cruce),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:21:4" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 21, 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">figit in virgine vultus,</quote> <trans><tr>fixes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculos solo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 482</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculos in terram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 11" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 11</bibl></cit>: in <usg type="style">poet.</usg> transf.: <cit><quote lang="la">oculos horrenda in virgine fixus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:507" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 507</bibl></cit> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">defixus lumina vultu,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 156</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 1</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">Caesar in silentium fixus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 50</bibl></cit> (56): <cit><quote lang="la">obstipo capite et figentes lumine terram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:3:80" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 3, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">foribus miser oscula figit,</quote> <trans><tr>kisses</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1179" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1179</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oscula dulcia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:687" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 687</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sedem Cumis,</quote> <trans><tr>to fix his abode</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:2" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 54</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18150.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to fix by piercing through</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to transfix</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pierce</hi> (cf. configo, II.): <cit><quote lang="la">hunc intorto figit telo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:382" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 382</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hunc jaculo acuto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 131</bibl></cit>: hostes telis, Auct. B. Alex. 30 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fixisse puellas gestit (Cupido),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:1:71" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 1, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cervos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:2:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 2, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dammas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:308" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 1, 308</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:515" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 5, 515</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:1:305" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 1, 305</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cutem (clavi),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Prov. 3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Prov. 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">olli per galeam fixo stetit hasta cerebro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:537" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 537</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aprum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:23" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">figar a sagitta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:16:278" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 16, 278</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vulnus,</quote> <trans><tr>to inflict</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:61:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 61, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n18150.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n18150.4" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To fix</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fasten</hi>, <hi rend="ital">direct.</hi> </sense><sense id="n18150.5" n="1" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <case>abl.</case>: ego omnia mea studia, omnem operam, curam, industriam, cogitationem,<pb n="749" /> <cb n="FIGU" />  mentem denique omnem in Milonis
