consulatu fixi et locavi, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 6, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n18150.6" n="2" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <case>acc.</case> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">fixus in silentium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 50</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18150.7" n="3" level="3"> In other constructions: <cit><quote lang="la">beneficium, quemadmodum dicitur, trabali clavo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:21:section=53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 21, § 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nostras intra te fige querelas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:9:94" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 9, 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">penitus hoc se malum fixit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Tranq. 15" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Tranq. 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nequitiae fige modum tuae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:15:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 15, 2</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n18150.8" n="B" level="2"> (Acc. to I. B.) Of speech, <hi rend="ital">to sting; taunt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rally</hi> a person: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem maledictis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:34:93" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 34, 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adversarios,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:26:89" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 26, 89</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">fixus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">fixed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fast</hi>, <hi rend="ital">immovable.</hi> </sense><sense id="n18150.9" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">illud maneat et fixum sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:9:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Post. 9, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inque tuis nunc Fixa pedum pono pressis vestigia signis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>firmly fixed in</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">in the foll.: astra,</quote> <trans><tr>the fixed stars</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 2, 35</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">flammae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:3:15" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 4, 3, 15</bibl></cit>.— Far more freq., </sense><sense id="n18150.10" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestigia (integritatis) non pressa leviter, sed fixa ad memoriam illius provinciae sempiternam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 5, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non ita fixum, ut convelli non liceret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:45:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 45, 126</bibl></cit>: fixum et statutum, id. Mur., 30, 62; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">consilium fixum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:14:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 6, 14, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animo fixum immotumque sedere, ne, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> A, 4, 15</bibl></cit>: fixum est, with a <hi rend="ital">subj.-clause</hi>, <hi rend="ital">it is fixed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">determined</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:2:364" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 2, 364</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:114" default="NO">3, 114</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">decretum stabile, fixum, ratum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 9, 27</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ratum, fixum, firmum,</quote> <trans><tr>permanent</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 46, 141</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illud fixum in animis vestris tenetote,</quote> <trans><tr>fixed</tr>, <tr>impressed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:28:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Balb. 28, 64</bibl></cit>: quae perpetuo animo meo fixa manebunt, Lepid. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:34:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 34, 3</bibl>.— <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">fixe</orth>, <hi rend="ital">fixedly</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">ubi tenacius habitabit et fixius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 6" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
figularis: <entryFree id="n18151" type="main" key="fi^gu^la_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fĭgŭlāris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>figulus</etym>, <sense id="n18151.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a potter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">potter</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s-</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rota,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:3:2:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 3, 2, 35</bibl></cit>: creta, <hi rend="ital">potter</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s clay</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:2:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 2, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:17:6" default="NO">6, 17, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 3, 28, § 47</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
figularius: <entryFree id="n18152" type="main" key="fi^gu^la_rius"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fĭgŭlārius</orth>, <foreign lang="greek">kerameu/s,</foreign> Gloss. Lat. Gr.</entryFree>
figulatio: <entryFree id="n18153" type="main" key="fi^gu^la_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fĭgŭlātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>figulo</etym>, <sense id="n18153.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a forming</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fashioning</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">carnis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Resurr. Carn. 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
figulator: <entryFree id="n18154" type="gloss" key="fi^gu^la_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fĭgŭlātor</orth>, <itype>faber</itype>, <foreign lang="greek">kerameu/s,</foreign> Gloss. Vet.</entryFree>
figulatus: <entryFree id="n18155" type="hapax" key="Fi^gu^la_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Fĭgŭlātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. Figulus</etym>, <sense id="n18155.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">made a</hi> Figulus <hi rend="ital">of</hi>, Asin. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:32" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 32</bibl> Spald. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.;</hi> cf. 2. Fimbriatus.</sense></entryFree>
figulinus: <entryFree id="n18156" type="main" key="fi^gu^li_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fĭgŭlīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. figlinus.</entryFree>
figulo: <entryFree id="n18157" type="main" key="fi^gu^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fĭgŭlo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>figulus</etym>, <sense id="n18157.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to form</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fashion</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">figulat ita hominem Demiurgus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Val. 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus hoc nostrum de limo figulatum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Carn. Chr. 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
figulus: <entryFree id="n18158" type="main" key="fi^gu^lus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fĭgŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>v. fingo</etym>, <sense id="n18158.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a potter</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:15:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 15, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:159" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 12, 43, § 159</bibl>: <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:1:9" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 1, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4190</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">SIGILLATOR ( = sigillorum fictor),</quote> <trans><tr>a seal-maker</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 4191</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vas figuli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:2:9 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 2, 9 al.</bibl></cit>— <usg type="style">Poet.</usg> of the <hi rend="ital">builders</hi> of the brick walls of Babylon: <cit><quote lang="la">a figulis munita urbs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:171" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 171</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n18159" type="main" key="Fi^gu^lus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Fĭgŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n18159.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman surname in the</hi> gens Marcia <hi rend="ital">and</hi> Nigidia. So esp. P. Nigidius Figulus, <hi rend="ital">a learned contemporary of Cicero</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=1" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Univ. 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 4, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:94" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 94</bibl>. — <cit><quote lang="la">Marcius Figulus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:25" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
figura: <entryFree id="n18160" type="main" key="fi^gu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fĭgūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>v. fingo</etym>, <sense id="n18160.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a form</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shape</hi>, <hi rend="ital">figure</hi> (syn.: forma, species; tropus). </sense><sense id="n18160.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n18160.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">corporis nostri partes totaque figura et forma et statura quam apta ad naturam sit, apparet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:12:35" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 12, 35</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">hominum, vel etiam ceterarum animantium forma et figura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:45:179" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 45, 179</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">quae figura, quae species humanā potest esse pulchrior? ... Quod si omnium animantium formam vincit hominis figura, deus autem animans est: ea figura profecto est, quae pulcherrima sit omnium, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:18:47 sq" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 18, 47 sq.</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">with this cf.: esse aliquem humana specie et figura, qui, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:22:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 22, 63</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:17:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 17, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">uri sunt specie et colore et figura tauri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:28:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 28, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gemina tauri juvenisque,</quote> <trans><tr>the Minotaur</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:169" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 169</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Himera in muliebrem figuram habitumque formata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:35:section=87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 35, § 87</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">figura et lineamenta hospitae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 36</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">89: conformatio quaedam et figura totius oris et corporis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:25:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 25, 114</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pulmonum vis et figura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:16:37" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 16, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">formae figura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:32:90" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 32, 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">formaï servare figuram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">navium figura (shortly before: navium species),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:25:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 25, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lapidis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:399" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 399</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dohorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 25, 22, § 90</bibl></cit>: lenticulae<cb n="FIGU" />  dimidiae, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 27, 12, 98, § 124</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quadriangula grani,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 13, 22, 38, § 118</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">triquetra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 16, 20, § 121</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rotunditatis aut proceritatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 13, 4, 9, § 49</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n18160.3" n="2" level="3"> Concr., <hi rend="ital">a sketch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">figure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">drawing</hi> (lat. Lat.): figurae quae <foreign lang="greek">sxhmata</foreign> vocant, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:20:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 20, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:21:10" default="NO">2, 21, 10</bibl>: <foreign lang="greek">ku/bos</foreign> est figura ex omni latere quadrata, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:20:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 20, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n18160.4" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n18160.5" n="1" level="3"> In the lang. of the Epicurean philosophy applied to <hi rend="ital">the atoms</hi> or <hi rend="ital">molecular parts</hi> of bodies: <cit><quote lang="la">caelestem fulminis ignem Subtilem magis e parvis constare figuris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:385" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 385</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:682" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 682</bibl> sq.; 778; 3, 190 al.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">illas figuras Epicuri, quas e summis corporibus dicit effluere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:2:15" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 2, 15</bibl></cit> Spald.— </sense><sense id="n18160.6" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a form</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shade</hi>, <hi rend="ital">phantom</hi> of the dead: <cit><quote lang="la">in somnis, cum saepe figuras Contuimur miras simulacraque luce carentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">morte obita quales fama est volitare figuras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:641" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 641</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">CVM VITA FVNCTVS IVNGAR TIS (i. e. tuis) VMBRA FIGVRIS,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4847</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n18160.7" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">quality</hi>, <hi rend="ital">kind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">form</hi>, <hi rend="ital">species</hi>, <hi rend="ital">nature</hi>, <hi rend="ital">manner.</hi> </sense><sense id="n18160.8" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">de figura vocis satis dictum est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 3, 15, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">majus et minus et aeque magnum ex vi et ex numero et ex figura negotii consideratur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:28:41" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 28, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">figura orationis plenioris et tenuioris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:55:212" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 55, 212</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">suam quandam expressit quasi formam figuramque dicendi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 23, 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">occurrunt animo pereundi mille figurae,</quote> <trans><tr>kinds</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:10:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 10, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">edidit innumeras species, partimque figuras rettulit antiquas, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:436" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 1, 436</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">capiendi figurae (for which, shortly after: species capiendi),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:39:6:31" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 39, 6, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">condicionis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:35:2:30" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 35, 2, 30</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n18160.9" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n18160.10" n="1" level="3"> Gram. t. t., <hi rend="ital">form</hi> of a word, <hi rend="ital">inflection</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">alia nomina, quod quinque habent figuras, habere quinque casus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 9:section=52" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 9, § 52</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">non debuisse ex singulis vocibus ternas vocabulorum figuras fieri, ut albus, alba, album,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. 9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">55: quaedam (verba) tertiae demum personae figura dicuntur, ut licet, piget,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:4:29" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 4, 29</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:2:15" default="NO">8, 2, 15</bibl> Spald.—</sense><sense id="n18160.11" n="2" level="3"> Rhet. t. t., <hi rend="ital">a figure of speech</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">sxh=ma,</foreign> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:53 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 53 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:39 sq" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 39 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:1 sq" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 1 sq.</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n18160.12" n="b" level="4"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">one which contains hints</hi> or <hi rend="ital">allusions</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:13" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Dom. 10</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:82" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 82</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
figuralitas: <entryFree id="n18161" type="main" key="fi^gu_ra_li^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fĭgūrālĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>figura</etym>, <sense id="n18161.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a figurative mode of speaking</hi> (late Lat.): Fulg. de Contin. Verg. <hi rend="ital">med.</hi> p. 147 Munk.</sense></entryFree>
figuraliter: <entryFree id="n18162" type="main" key="fi^gu_ra_li^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fĭgūrālĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n18162.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">figuratively</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Testim. Anim. 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 8, 14 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
figurate: <entryFree id="n18163" type="main" key="fi^gu_ra_te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fĭgūrātē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <sense id="n18163.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">figuratively</hi>, v. figuro, <hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
figuraticius: <entryFree id="n18164" type="main" key="fi^gu_ra_ti_ci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fĭgūrātīcĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>figura</etym>, = figurativus (very rare): quatenus a figuraticiis transirent ad veritatem, Primas. in Epist. ad Hebr. c. 10.</entryFree>
figuratio: <entryFree id="n18165" type="main" key="fi^gu_ra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fĭgūrātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>figuro</etym> (post-Aug.). <sense id="n18165.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A forming</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fashioning; shape</hi>, <hi rend="ital">form</hi>, <hi rend="ital">figure</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nervi hic teretes, illic lati, ut in uno quoque poscit figuratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:217" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 88, § 217</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">zona duodecim signis conformata exprimit depictam a natura figurationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:9:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 9, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Apollinis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Dogm. Plat. 1</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n18165.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n18165.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Imagination</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fancy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si spei figuratione tardius cadit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Decl. 12:27" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> Decl. 12, 27</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">vanae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:ib. 6:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 4</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n18165.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Form</hi> of a word: <cit><quote lang="la">(diurnare) ex ea figuratione est, qua dicimus perennare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:2:16" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 2, 16</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18165.4" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Figurative mode of speaking</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quisquam illorum his figurationibus uteretur, quae Graeci schemata vocant?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1248,001:, Ep. ad Anton. 1:2" default="NO"><author>Fronto</author>, Ep. ad Anton. 1, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 11, 24</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">30</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
figurativus: <entryFree id="n18166" type="main" key="fi^gu_ra_ti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fĭgūrātīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n18166.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pertaining to the figurative mode of speaking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">figurative</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Varr. 8, 31</bibl>. — Hence, </sense><sense id="n18166.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">figurativa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">figurative mode of speaking</hi>, Myth. Vatic. Fab. 127 ap. Mai. Auct. Class. 1, 3, p. 46.</sense></entryFree>
figurato: <entryFree id="n18167" type="main" key="fi^gu_ra_to_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fĭgūrātō</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. figuro, <sense id="n18167.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
figurator: <entryFree id="n18168" type="main" key="fi^gu_ra_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fĭgūrātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>figuro</etym>, <sense id="n18168.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who forms</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fashions</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 6, 196</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
figuratus: <entryFree id="n18169" type="main" key="fi^gu_ra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fĭgūrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, v. figuro.</entryFree>
figuro: <entryFree id="n18170" type="main" key="fi^gu_ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fĭgūro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>figura</etym>, <sense id="n18170.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to form</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fashion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shape</hi> (rare but class.). </sense><sense id="n18170.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">mundum ea forma figuravit, qua una omnes reliquae formae concluduntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=6" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Univ. 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aes in habitum statuae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 65" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">medullas in lapidis naturam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:161" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 22, 45, § 161</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caseos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:181" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 16, 38, 72, § 181</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">barbam peregrina ratione,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 102</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:39:110" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 39, 110</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n18170.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> <cb n="FILI" /> </sense><sense id="n18170.3" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">voces lingua,</quote> <trans><tr>to pronounce</tr>, <tr>utter</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:550" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 550</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:413" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 413</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">os tenerum pueri balbumque poëta figurat,</quote> <trans><tr>forms</tr>, <tr>trains</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 126</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum tempora nostra figurat,</quote> <trans><tr>represents</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Psych. 66</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n18170.4" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n18170.5" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To imagine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fancy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">picture</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui in crepidine viderat Marium in sella figuravit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 3:17" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 3, 17 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quales ad bella excitanda exeunt Furiae, talem nobis iram figuremus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 2:35" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 2, 35 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inanes species anxio animo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:1" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n18170.6" n="2" level="3"> In rhet. lang., <hi rend="ital">to adorn with figures</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tam translatis verbis quam propriis figuratur oratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:1:9" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 1, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plurima mutatione figuramus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 1, 12</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">affectus efficaciter movit, figurabat egregie,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 3 praef" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 3 praef.</bibl></cit>—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">fĭgū-rātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> </sense><sense id="n18170.7" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">formed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fashioned</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shaped</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">boum ipsa terga declarant non esse se ad onus accipiendum figurata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:63:159" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 63, 159</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(hominis) ita figuratum corpus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:12:34" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 12, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">signum in modum Liburnae figuratum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venter ei, qui a periculo tutus est, reddit mollia, figurata,</quote> <trans><tr>well-formed stools</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 8</bibl> <hi rend="ital">med.</hi>—Of a word, <hi rend="ital">derived</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicatur a Graeca voce figurata esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 3:93" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 3, 93 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>— </sense><sense id="n18170.8" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, of speech, <hi rend="ital">figurative</hi> (not in Cic., but very freq. in Quint.): oratio <foreign lang="greek">e)sxhmatisme/nh,</foreign> id est figurata (opp. <foreign lang="greek">a)sxhma/tistos,</foreign> figuris carens), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:1:13" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 1, 13</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:59" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 3, 59</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:1:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 1, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:7" default="NO">9, 2, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">controversiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:65" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 2, 65</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:88" default="NO">88</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:1:14" default="NO">9, 1, 14</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi> (acc. to B.), <hi rend="ital">figuratively;</hi> in two forms: <orth extent="full" lang="la">fĭgūrāto</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 3, 14 al.</bibl>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">fĭgūrāte</orth>, Ascon. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:chapter=6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">figuratius,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 5, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
filatim: <entryFree id="n18171" type="hapax" key="fi_la_tim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fīlātim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>filum</etym>, <sense id="n18171.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">thread by thread</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">filatim distrahere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:831" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 831</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
filectum: <entryFree id="n18172" type="main" key="fi^lectum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fĭlectum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, v. filictum.</entryFree>
filia: <entryFree id="n18173" type="main" key="fi_li^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fīlĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype> (<sense id="n18173.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> filiāi, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:4:16 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 4, 16 al.</bibl>; <case>dat.</case> and <hi rend="ital">abl. plur.</hi> filiabus, Cato ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 733</bibl> P.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:26:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 26, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 1:17" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 1, 17 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 750, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>August.</author> C. D. 3, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">15, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:30:15:section=1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 30, 15, § 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:40:12:3:section=2" default="NO">40, 12, 3, § 2</bibl>; cf. Plin. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 103 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> P.; and filiis, Enn. ap. Prisc. l. l.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:4:1:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 4, 1, 61</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 5, 3, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Strat. 4:3:5" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Strat. 4, 3, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:57:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 57, 2</bibl> Drak.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:7:3:3" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 7, 3, 3</bibl>; Auct. B. Alex. 33, 2; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Vir. Ill. 22" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Vir. Ill. 22</bibl>), <gen>f.</gen> <etym>filius</etym>, <hi rend="ital">a daughter</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tua reconcilietur uxor, mea necetur filia, Enn. ap. Ruf. § 37 (Trag. v. 267 ed. Vahl.): Numae Pompilii nepos ex filia rex a populo est Ancus Marcius constitutus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:18" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">o matre pulchra filia pulchrior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:16:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 16, 1</bibl></cit>.—In apposition: <cit><quote lang="la">cum Decimus quidam Verginius virginem filiam ... in foro sua manu interemisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:37" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virgo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:4:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 3, 4, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:70" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 70</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">eam quae nobis adoptione filiae loco esse coeperit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 1:59" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 1, 59</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18173.1" n="A" level="2"> In partic.: filia familias, or, in one word, filiafamilias, v. familia. — </sense><sense id="n18173.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">female offspring</hi>, <hi rend="ital">offshoot</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">Pontica pinus, Silvae filia nobilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:14:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 14, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:90" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 90</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">filiae Picenae porcae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:35" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 13, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Massilia Graium filia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Carm. 21, 305</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
filialis: <entryFree id="n18174" type="main" key="fi_li^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fīlĭālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>filius</etym>, <sense id="n18174.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">filial</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">amor,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>August.</author> Serm. 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
filiaster: <entryFree id="n18175" type="gloss" key="fi_li^aster"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fīlĭaster</orth>, <itype>tri</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = privignus, <sense id="n18175.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a stepson</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2617 al.</bibl>; cf. the foll. art.</sense></entryFree>
filiastra: <entryFree id="n18176" type="gloss" key="fi_li^astra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fīlĭastra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = privigna, <sense id="n18176.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a stepdaughter</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Fabr.</author> p. 202</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">503 al.</bibl>; cf. the prec. art.</sense></entryFree>
filicatus: <entryFree id="n18177" type="main" key="fi^li^ca_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fĭlĭcātus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">felic-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>filix</etym>, <sense id="n18177.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adorned with fern</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">paterae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>on which fern-leaves are engraved</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:1:2:11" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Par. 1, 2, 11</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">lances,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 6, 1, 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
filicina: <entryFree id="n18178" type="main" key="filicina"><orth extent="full" lang="la">filicina</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <sense id="n18178.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">also called</hi> radiolus, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 83</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
filicones: <entryFree id="n18179" type="gloss" key="filicones"><orth extent="full" lang="la">filicones</orth> (al. ‡ felicones), mali et nullius usus, a felice dicti, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=86:10" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 86, 10</bibl> Müll. <sense id="n18179.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi></sense></entryFree>
filictum: <entryFree id="n18180" type="main" key="fi^lictum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fĭlictum</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">fĭlectum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>filix</etym>, <sense id="n18180.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a place abounding in ferns</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:2:8" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 2, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 9, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
filicula: <entryFree id="n18181" type="main" key="fi^li^cu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fĭlĭcŭla</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">felic-</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n18181.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">also called</hi> polypodion, <hi rend="ital">rock-fern</hi>, <hi rend="ital">polypody</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 8, 3</bibl> 7, § 58; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 158, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:27:11" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 27, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
filietas: <entryFree id="n18182" type="main" key="fi_li^e^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fīlĭĕtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>filius</etym>, <sense id="n18182.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sonship</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the descent of the son from the father</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Hist. Eccl. 1, 14</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Did. de Spir. 31 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
filiola: <entryFree id="n18183" type="main" key="fi_li^o^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fīlĭŏla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>filia</etym>, <sense id="n18183.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little daughter.</hi> </sense><sense id="n18183.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: educare aliquam pro filiola <pb n="750" /> <cb n="FILU" /> sua, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:2:3:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 2, 3, 29</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">L. Paullus filiolam suam Tertiam animadvertit tristiculam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:46:103" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 46, 103</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:4:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 4, 1, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:prol. 39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. prol. 39</bibl>; M. Aurel. in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1248,001:, Ep. 5:53" default="NO"><author>Fronto</author>, Ep. 5, 53</bibl> ed. Mai.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:241" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 241</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quoniam mihi videris hanc scientiam juris tamquam filiolam osculari tuam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:10:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 10, 23</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18183.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, sarcastically of an effeminate person: <cit><quote lang="la">duce filiola Curionis, i. e. C. Curione C. F.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:14:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 14, 5</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, of the letters of Cadmus: <cit><quote lang="la">Cadmi filiolae atricolores,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 7, 25</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
filiolus: <entryFree id="n18184" type="main" key="fi_li^o^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fīlĭŏlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>filius</etym>, <sense id="n18184.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little son</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">filiolo me auctum scito salva Terentia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 2, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:2:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 4, 2, 96</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:8:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 2, 8, 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 3, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:390 al" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 390 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
filius: <entryFree id="n18185" type="main" key="fi_li^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fīlĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype> (<case>voc.</case> filie, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:Andr. in Prisc. p. 741" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> Andr. in Prisc. p. 741</bibl> P., <sense id="n18185.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">dat. plur.</hi> FILIBVS, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 553, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">554, 4</bibl>, like DIIBVS from deus), <gen>m.</gen> <etym>root fev-o, to give birth to (fe-o), whence: fecundus, femina, felix, etc., lit., he who is born</etym>, <hi rend="ital">a son</hi> (syn. <number>plur.</number>: nati, liberi). </sense><sense id="n18185.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n18185.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: Marci filius, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:15:58" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 15, 58</bibl> (Ann. v. 306 Vahl.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:1:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 1, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Venus et remisso filius arcu, i. e. Cupido,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:27:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 27, 68</bibl></cit> et saep. —</sense><sense id="n18185.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic.: filius familias, or, in one word, filiusfamilias, v. familia.—</sense><sense id="n18185.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n18185.5" n="A" level="2"> With terra, fortuna, etc.: terrae filius, <hi rend="ital">a son of mother earth</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">a man of unknown origin</hi> (opp.: <cit><quote lang="la">nobilis, honesto genere natus): et huic terrae filio nescio cui committere epistolam tantis de rebus non audeo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:13:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 13, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 9, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:6:59" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 6, 59</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Saturnum Caeli filium dictum, quod soleamus eos, quorum virtutem miremur aut repentino advenerint, decaelo cecidisse dicere: terrae autem, quos ignotis parentibus natos terrae filios nominemus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 11</bibl></cit>: fortunae filius, a <hi rend="ital">child of fortune</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fortune's favorite</hi> (Gr. <foreign lang="greek">pai=s th=s *tu/xhs</foreign>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:6:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 6, 49</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">called also: gallinae albae filius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:141" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 13, 141</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Celtiberiae filius,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>an inhabitant of Celtiberia</tr>, <tr>a Celtiberian</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:37:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 37, 18</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18185.6" n="B" level="2"> Filii, in gen., <hi rend="ital">children</hi>: <foreign lang="greek">*sunezeugme/non</foreign> jungit et diversos sexus, ut cum marem feminamque filios dicimus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:63" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 3, 63</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,059:1:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> ad Brut. 1, 12, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:12:1:21" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 12, 1, 21</bibl>; cf. <number>sing.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut condemnaretur filius aut nepos, si pater aut avus deliquisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:38:90" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 38, 90</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18185.7" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Descendants</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">natura docet parentes pios, filiorum appellatione omnes, quiex nobis descendunt, contineri: nec enim dulciore nomine possumus nepotes nostros, quam filii, appellare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:16:220:section=3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 16, 220, § 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18185.8" n="C" level="2"> Of animals, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:37:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 37, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
filix: <entryFree id="n18186" type="main" key="fi^lix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fĭlix</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">felix</orth>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=86" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 86</bibl> Müll. <sense id="n18186.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>), <itype>ĭcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">fern</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">pte/ris</foreign>. </sense><sense id="n18186.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 9, 55, § 78</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:29" default="NO" valid="yes">17, 4, 3, § 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:189" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 189</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 297</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:2:13" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 2, 13</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n18186.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the hair of the pubes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:4:41" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 4, 41</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
filum: <entryFree id="n18187" type="main" key="fi_lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fīlum</orth>, i. <gen>n.</gen> (also <itype>filus, i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 1, 36</bibl> dub., plur. <sense id="n18187.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">heterocl.</hi>, fili, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:460" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 460</bibl>) [for figlum, v. figo], <hi rend="ital">a thread</hi> of any thing woven (of linen or woolen cloth, a cobweb, etc.). </sense><sense id="n18187.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=113" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 113</bibl> Müll.; Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 116, 6</bibl> (Ann. v. 259 ed. Vahl.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:445" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 445</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 4, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:6:3:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 6, 3, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lumen candelae cujus tempero filum,</quote> <trans><tr>wick</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:287" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 287</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tenuia aranei,</quote> <trans><tr>a web</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:383" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 383</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tineae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:372" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 372</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, of <hi rend="ital">the thread of life</hi> spun by the Fates: <cit><quote lang="la">sororum fila trium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:3:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 3, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:815" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 815</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:654" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 654</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:10:45" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 5, 10, 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4:28" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 4, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:5:10 al" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 5, 10 al.</bibl>— Prov.: pendere filo (tenui), <hi rend="ital">to hang by a thread</hi>, for <hi rend="ital">to be in great danger</hi>: hac noctu filo pendebit Etruria tota, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 4, § 18</bibl> (Ann. v. 153 ed. Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">omnia sunt hominum tenui pendentia filo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:3:35" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 3, 35</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:6:4:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 6, 4, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n18187.2" n="2" level="3"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">the fillet of wool</hi> wound round the upper part of the flamen's cap, similar to the <foreign lang="greek">ste/mma</foreign> of the Greeks; hence, in gen., <hi rend="ital">a priest's fillet</hi>: APICVLVM, filum, quo flamines velatum apicem gerunt, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=23" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 23</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">legatus capite velato filo (lanae velamen est), Audi, Juppiter, inquit, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:32:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 32, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">filo velatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:5:15" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 5, 15</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18187.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose). </sense><sense id="n18187.4" n="1" level="3"> Of any thing slender and drawn out like a thread, <hi rend="ital">a string</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cord</hi>, <hi rend="ital">filament</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fibre</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tractat inauratae consona fila lyrae,</quote> <trans><tr>the strings</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:8:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 8, 60</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">lyrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 5, 118</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sonantia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:10:89" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">croci,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the stamen</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:342" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 1, 342</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">foliorum exilitas usque in fila attenuata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 6, 16, § 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:39" default="NO" valid="yes">11, 15, 15, § 39</bibl>. <cb n="FIND" /> —</sense><sense id="n18187.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shreds</hi>, <hi rend="ital">slices</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remnants</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fila sectivi porri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:133" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 133</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">porris fila resecta suis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:52" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fila Tarentini graviter redolentia porri edisti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 13, 18</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n18187.6" n="3" level="3"> I. q. crassitudo, <hi rend="ital">the density</hi>, <hi rend="ital">compactness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">compact shape</hi>, or, in gen., <hi rend="ital">contour</hi>, <hi rend="ital">form</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shape</hi> of an object: <cit><quote lang="la">forma quoque hinc solis debet filumque videri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:571" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 571</bibl></cit>, v. Lachm. ad h. 1.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:581" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 581</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:341" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 341</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:88" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 88</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mulieris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:4:4:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 4, 4, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corporis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 10:section=4" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 10, § 4</bibl></cit> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:9:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 9, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 11, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">forma atque filo virginali,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 14, 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingeniosus est et bono filo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 46</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18187.7" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> (cf. the preced. <hi rend="ital">no.</hi>), of speech, <hi rend="ital">texture</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sort</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quality</hi>, <hi rend="ital">nature</hi>, <hi rend="ital">style</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">ego hospiti veteri et amico munusculum mittere (volui) levidense, crasso filo, cujusmodi ipsius solent esse munera,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>of coarse texture</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 12, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">argumentandi tenue filum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:36:124" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 36, 124</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tenui deducta poëmata filo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 225</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">gracili connectere carmina filo, Col. poët. 10, 227: paulo uberiore filo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:22:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 22, 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orationis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 26, 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliud quoddam filum orationis tuae (= oratio uberior),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:7:25" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 7, 25</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fimbria: <entryFree id="n18188" type="main" key="fimbri^a1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fimbrĭa</orth>, v. fimbriae <sense id="n18188.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n18189" type="main" key="Fimbri^a2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Fimbrĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>fimbriae</etym>. <sense id="n18189.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A Roman surname in the</hi> gens Flavia. </sense><sense id="n18189.1" n="A" level="2"> C. Flavius Fimbria, <hi rend="ital">consul</hi> A. U. C. 650; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:70:section=181" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 70, § 181</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:21:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 21, 52</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:22:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 22, 91</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n18189.2" n="B" level="2"> Another of the same name, <hi rend="ital">an enemy of M. Crassus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:66:233" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 66, 233</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:12:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 12, 33</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n18189.3" n="II" level="1"> Deriv.: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Fimbrĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>: seditio, Sall. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 215, 32</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
fimbriae: <entryFree id="n18190" type="main" key="fimbri^ae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fimbrĭae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>cf.: fibra, filum</etym>, <sense id="n18190.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fibres</hi>, <hi rend="ital">threads</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shreds</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fibrous part</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fringe</hi> (for syn. cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">limbus, ora, instita, patagium): antiqui FIBRVM dicebant extremum, a quo in sagis fimbriae et in jecore extremum fibra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=79" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 79</bibl></cit> Müll.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Paul. ex Fest. s. v. FIBER, p. 90 Müll.: si quis in febre aut acuto morbo ... in veste floccos legit fimbriasve diducit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 6</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:171" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 51, 52, § 171</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 11, p. 258</bibl>: madentes cincinnorum fimbriae, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the outer curled ends</hi>, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:11:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 11, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mappa laticlavia, fimbriis hinc atque illic pendentibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 32</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi> (late Lat.), <hi rend="ital">a border</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fringe</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestimenti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:9:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 9, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">14, 36 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
fimbriatus: <entryFree id="n18191" type="main" key="fimbri^a_tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fimbrĭātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>fimbriae</etym>, <sense id="n18191.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fibrous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fringed</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">folia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 15, 55, § 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">capillus (milii),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 18, 7, 10, § 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">usus est lato clavo ad manus fimbriato,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:45" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flagrum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 8, p. 214</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n18192" type="main" key="Fimbri^a_tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Fimbrĭātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>Fimbria</etym>, <sense id="n18192.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">made a</hi> Fimbria <hi rend="ital">of</hi>, Asin. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:32" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 32</bibl> Spald. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.;</hi> cf. Figulatus.</sense></entryFree>
fimetum: <entryFree id="n18193" type="main" key="fi^me_tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fĭmētum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>fimus</etym>, <sense id="n18193.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a dung-hill</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:153" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 54, 75, § 153</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:57" default="NO" valid="yes">17, 9, 8, § 57</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:171" default="NO" valid="yes">24, 19, 110, § 171</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
fimus: <entryFree id="n18194" type="main" key="fi^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fĭmus</orth>, <itype>i</itype> (also <orth extent="full" lang="la">fĭmum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:234 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 17, 70, § 234 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:101" default="NO" valid="yes">29, 5, 32, § 101</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:76" default="NO" valid="yes">30, 9, 23, § 76</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> Opif. D. 11, 20</bibl>: fimo, <sense id="n18194.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">abl. fem.</hi>, Apul. Met. 7, p. 200 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>), <gen>m.</gen> <etym>Sanscr. dhūmas, smoke; dhū-lis, dust; cf. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">qu-, qu/nw, qu=ma, qu/os</foreign>; Lat. sub-fīo, sub-fimen; Germ. Dunst; Engl. dust</etym>, <hi rend="ital">that which fertilizes</hi> or <hi rend="ital">manures</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dung</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ordure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excrement</hi> (only in the <number>sing.</number>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 314</bibl> P.; for syn. cf.: stercus, merda, quisquiliae). </sense><sense id="n18194.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 80</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:14:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 14, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:11:4" default="NO">3, 11, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:235" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 17, 71, § 235</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:76" default="NO" valid="yes">30, 9, 23, § 76</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">caballinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 29, 5, 32, § 102</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:18:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 18, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fimo si quis aliquem perfuderit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 5, 4, 13</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n18194.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg> transf. for lutum, <hi rend="ital">dirt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mire</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:333" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 333</bibl> and 358.</sense></entryFree>
finalis: <entryFree id="n18195" type="main" key="fi_na_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fīnālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>finis</etym> (post-class.). <sense id="n18195.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">relating to boundaries</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaestiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:10:1:11" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 10, 1, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:47:21:3" default="NO">47, 21, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 8, 14</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n18195.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">relating to the end</hi>, <hi rend="ital">final</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">horizon, id est finalis circulus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Somn. Scip. 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">beatitudo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Civ. D. 19:4" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Civ. D. 19, 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: causa, Don. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:5:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 5, 18</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">fī-nālĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">at last</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to the very end</hi> (late Lat.). <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Amic. 19, 3</bibl>; Ven. Fort. Vit. Mauteil. 25.</sense></entryFree>
finalitas: <entryFree id="n18196" type="main" key="fi_na_li^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fīnālĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>finalis</etym>, <sense id="n18196.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the being last</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 1, 120</bibl>; Eutych. Disc. Conj. proem. 2143 P.</sense></entryFree>
findo: <entryFree id="n18197" type="main" key="findo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">findo</orth>, <itype>fĭdi, fissum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>root Sanscr. bhid-, to cleave; Germ. beissen; Engl. bite</etym>, <sense id="n18197.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to cleave</hi>, <hi rend="ital">split</hi>, <hi rend="ital">part</hi>, <hi rend="ital">separate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">divide</hi> (class.; cf.: scindo, seco, caedo). </sense><sense id="n18197.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: hoc <cb n="FING" /> enim quasi rostro finditur Fibrenus et divisus aequaliter in duas partes latera haec alluit, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:3:6" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 3, 6</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">inimicam findite rostris Hanc terram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:295" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 295</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patrios findere sarculo agros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 1, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terras vomere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:671" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 671</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mare carinā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:9" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 9</bibl></cit> (4, 8), 35: <cit><quote lang="la">Assaraci tellus, quam ... Findunt Scamandri flumina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:13:14" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 13, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hiulca siti findit Canis aestifer arva,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:353" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 353</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">arentes cum findit Sirius agros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:7:21" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 7, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rubra Canicula findet Statuas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:5:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 5, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">os,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 8, 4 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">specularis lapis finditur in quamlibet tenues crustas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:160" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 22, 45, § 160</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:21" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic locus est, partes ubi se via findit in ambas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:540" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 540</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 2, 78</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 65</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n18197.2" n="b" level="4"> In <hi rend="ital">part. perf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fissa ferarum ungula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:680" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 680</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ungulae equi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:61" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lingua in partes duas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:585" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 585</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lignum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:413" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 413</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferulae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 8, 10</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n18197.3" n="B" level="2"> Mid., <hi rend="ital">to split</hi>, <hi rend="ital">burst</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">turgescit bilis: findor,</quote> <trans><tr>I am ready to burst with rage</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:3:8" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cor meum et cerebrum finditur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:2:4:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 2, 4, 17</bibl></cit>: Marsis finduntur cantibus angues, Ov. Med. fac. 39.—</sense><sense id="n18197.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to divide</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and very seldom): <cit><quote lang="la">Idus sunt agendae, Qui dies mensem Veneris marinae Findit Aprilem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:11:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 11, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fissa voluntas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Psych. 760</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">fissum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a cleft</hi>, <hi rend="ital">slit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fissure.</hi> </sense><sense id="n18197.5" n="A" level="2"> In gen. (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">postquam implevisti fusti fissorum caput,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 3, 4, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad ani fissa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:20:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 20, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18197.6" n="B" level="2"> Esp., in the lang. of augurs, of the divided liver: <cit><quote lang="la">jecorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:52:118" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 52, 118</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">fissum in exitis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 10, 16</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">jecoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:6:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 6, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">familiare et vitale,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:13:32" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 13, 32</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fingibilis: <entryFree id="n18198" type="main" key="fingi^bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fingĭbĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>fingo</etym>, <sense id="n18198.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">imaginary</hi>, <hi rend="ital">seeming</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">prae oculis scintillarum fingibilis visus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 1:4:104" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 1, 4, 104</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fingo: <entryFree id="n18199" type="main" key="fingo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fingo</orth>, <itype>finxi, fictum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>Sanscr. dih-, dēhmi, smear; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">qig, qigga/nw</foreign>, touch; whence figulus, figura, etc.; prop., to handle</etym>. <sense id="n18199.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n18199.1" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To touch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">handle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stroke</hi>, <hi rend="ital">touch gently</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">mulcere alternos, et corpora fingere lingua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:634" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 634</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saepe manus aegras manibus fingebat amicis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:409" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 409</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18199.2" n="B" level="2"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">to form</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shape</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fashion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">frame</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make</hi> (class.), whence also figulus: <cit><quote lang="la">esse aliquam vim, quae finxerit, vel, ut tuo verbo utar, quae fabricata sit hominem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 27, 87</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ab aliquo deo ficti esse videantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:25:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 25, 115</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fingere et construere nidos,</quote> <trans><tr>build</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 6, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">favos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:44:157" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 44, 157</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut illa bestia fetum ederet informem, lambendo postgea fingeret, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:10:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 10, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18199.3" n="C" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n18199.4" n="1" level="3"> Of the plastic art, <hi rend="ital">to form</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fashion by art</hi> (in wax, clay, stone, etc.), <hi rend="ital">to mould</hi> or <hi rend="ital">model</hi>, as a statuary: <cit><quote lang="la">quorum alterum fingere opinor e cera solitum esse, alterum esse pictorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:13:section=30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 13, § 30</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in ceris aut fictilibus figuris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:26:71" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 26, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">similitudines ex argilla,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:151" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 12, 43, § 151</bibl></cit>; cf.<cit><quote lang="la">, sarcastically: hic homullus, ex argilla et luto fictus Epicurus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:25:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 25, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pocula de humo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:489" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 2, 489</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Alexander ab Apelle potissimum pingi et a Lysippo fingi volebat ... qui neque pictam neque fictam imaginem suam passus est esse, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:12:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 12, 7</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">fingendi ars,</quote> <trans><tr>of making statues</tr>, <tr>statuary</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:7:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 7, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpora fingendo pingendove efficere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:12:21" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 12, 21</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18199.5" n="2" level="3"> With the access. notion of arranging, adorning, etc., <hi rend="ital">to set to rights</hi>, <hi rend="ital">arrange; to adorn</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dress</hi>, <hi rend="ital">trim</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">componere, excolere, ornare): Bene cum lauta est (mulier), tersa, ornata, ficta est: infecta est tamen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:5:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 5, 5, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum se non finxerit ulli,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> R. Am. 341</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">isti ficti, compositi, crispi cincinni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:2:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 2, 32</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">canas fingere comas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:2:92" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 2, 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">comas presso pollice,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:10" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 10</bibl></cit> (4, 9), 14; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:306" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 306</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:6:57" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 6, 57</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">comas auro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:5:228" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 5, 228</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crinem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:148" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 148</bibl></cit>; cf. also <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:2:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 2, 2, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitem putando,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:407" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 407</bibl></cit> Forbig.—</sense><sense id="n18199.6" n="3" level="3"> With the access. notion of untruth, <hi rend="ital">to alter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">change</hi>, for the purpose of dissembling: <cit><quote lang="la">hi neque vultum fingere, neque interdum lacrimas tenere poterant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:39:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B.
