G. 1, 39, 4</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vultus quoque hominum fingit scelus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>makes men change countenance</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 5, 1, 14</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n18199.7" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n18199.8" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to form</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fashion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make: Ly.</hi> multa eveniunt homini quae <pb n="751" /> <cb n="FING" /> volt, quae nevolt. <hi rend="ital">Ph.</hi> Mentire, gnate, nam sapiens quidem pol ipsus fingit fortunam sibi, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:2:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 2, 84</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">the vv. foll.: natura fingit homines et creat imitatores et narratores facetos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:54:219" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 54, 219</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animos fingere, formare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:38:142" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 38, 142</bibl></cit>: cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">moderari et fingere mentem ac voluntates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:18:40" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 3, 18, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea quae nobis non possumus fingere, vultus, facies, sonus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:28:127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 28, 127</bibl></cit>: formam totius rei publicae velim mittas, ex qua me fingere possim, <hi rend="ital">regulate myself</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">proceed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">act</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 6, 3, 4</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ad eorum (qui audiunt) arbitrium et nutum totos se fingunt et accommodant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:8:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 8, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea (verba) nos sicut mollissimam ceram ad nostrum arbitrium formamus et fingimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:45:177" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 45, 177</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also: arbitrio fingere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:79:274" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 79, 274</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortuna humana fingit artatque ut lubet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:2:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2, 2, 54</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vitam subito flecti fingique posse,</quote> <trans><tr>shaped</tr>, <tr>directed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:28:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 28, 79</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 25, 69</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">jure erat semper idem voltus, cum mentis, a qua is fingitur, nulla fieret mutatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:15:31" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 15, 31</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">circumspexit amictus et finxit vultum,</quote> <trans><tr>composed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:318" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 318</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lingua vocem immoderate profusam fingit et terminat,</quote> <trans><tr>forms</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:59:149" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 59, 149</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Peripateticorum institutis commodius fingeretur oratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:31:119" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 31, 119</bibl></cit>: ego apis Matinae more modoque operosa parvus carmina fingo (like the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">pla/ttw</foreign>), <hi rend="ital">make</hi>, <hi rend="ital">compose</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:2:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 2, 32</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">carmina,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 227</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:331" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 331</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">240</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">versus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 382</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">poëmata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tit.:3" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tit. 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opprobria in quemvis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 15, 30</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18199.9" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n18199.10" n="1" level="3"> With a double predicate, <hi rend="ital">to form</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make</hi> into something or in a certain manner: <cit><quote lang="la">finxit te ipsa natura ad honestatem, gravitatem ... ad omnes denique virtutes magnum hominem et excelsum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:29:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 29, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec, si miserum fortuna Sinonem Finxit, vanum etiam mendacemque improba finget,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(illum) spissae nemorum comae Fingent Aeolio carmine nobilem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:3:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 3, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">di bene fecerunt, inopis me quodque pusilli Finxerunt animi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:4:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 4, 18</bibl></cit>: timui, mea me finxisse minora putarer Dissimulator opis propriae, <hi rend="ital">to have lessened</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">purposely disparaged it</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 9, 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n18199.11" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To form by instruction</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to instruct</hi>, <hi rend="ital">teach</hi>, <hi rend="ital">train</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">idem mire finxit filium,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>caused him to play his part</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 5, 1, 25</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">voce paterna Fingeris ad rectum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:367" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 367</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fingitur artibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:6:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 3, 6, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fingit equum tenera docilem cervice magister Ire viam, qua monstret eques,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 64</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18199.12" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To form mentally</hi> or <hi rend="ital">in speech</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to represent in thought</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to imagine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conceive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">think</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suppose; to sketch out</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fingite animis ... fingite cogitatione imaginem hujus condicionis meae, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:29:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 29, 79</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia quae cogitatione nobismet ipsi possumus fingere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:18:47" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 18, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fingere animo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Sen. 12, 41</bibl></cit>: cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also: animo et cogitatione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:24:68" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 24, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex sua natura ceteros,</quote> <trans><tr>to conceive of</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:9:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 9, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid magis exercitum dici aut fingi potest?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maleficium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:40:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 40, 116</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu, stulta, deos, tu fingis inania vera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:20" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 20</bibl></cit> (4, 19), 5: <cit><quote lang="la">qui utilitatum causa fingunt amicitias,</quote> <trans><tr>suppose</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:14:51" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 14, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">principatum sibi ipse opinionis errore finxerat,</quote> <trans><tr>had imagined to himself</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:8:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 8, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in summo oratore fingendo,</quote> <trans><tr>in representing</tr>, <tr>sketching out</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:2:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">finge tamen te improbulum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:5:72" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 5, 72</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18199.13" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">double acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod si qui me astutiorem fingit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:8:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 3, 8, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tiresiam sapientem fingunt poetae ... at vero Polyphemum Homerus immanem finxit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:39:115" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 39, 115</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18199.14" n="(g)" level="5"> With an <hi rend="ital">object-clause</hi>, and in <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>, with a <hi rend="ital">subject-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">finge, aliquem nunc fierisapientem, nondum esse,</quote> <trans><tr>suppose</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 36, 117</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">finge solum natum nothum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:100" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 6, 100</bibl></cit>.—Ellipt.: interfecti aliqui sunt; <cit><quote lang="la">finge a nobis,</quote> <trans><tr>assume</tr>, <tr>grant</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:37:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 37, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fingamus Alexandrum dari nobis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:1:24" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 1, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non omnia corpora fingunt in medium niti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:1083" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 1083</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:175" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 175</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui naufragus fingitur se suspendisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:5:22" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 5, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui suos artus morsu lacerasset, fingitur in scholis supra se cubasse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:2:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 2, 20</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18199.15" n="b" level="4"> Pregn., with the access. notion of creating by thinking, <hi rend="ital">to contrive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">devise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">invent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">feign</hi> something (esp. untrue): <cit><quote lang="la">argento comparando fingere fallaciam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 1, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fallacias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 3, 2, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fallaciam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:3:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> And. 1, 3, 15</bibl></cit>; cf.: nonne ad senem aliquam fabricam<cb n="FINI" />  fingit? <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:2:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 3, 2, 34</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fingit causas, ne det, sedulo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:2:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 1, 2, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">falsas causas ad discordiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:4:4:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. 4, 4, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si mihi aliquam (rem publicam), ut apud Platonem Socrates, ipse finxero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:1" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex eventis fingere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 6, 6, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(crimina) in istum fingere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 1, 5, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea quae sunt in usu vitaque communi, non ea, quae finguntur aut optantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:5:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 5, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in faciem moresque meos nova crimina fingis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:12:177" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 12, 177</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fingere qui non visa potest, commissa tacere Qui nequit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:4:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 4, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaelibet in quemvis opprobria fingere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 15, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">finguntur et testamenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:4:39" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 4, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nemo dolorem fingit in hoc casu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:132" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 13, 132</bibl></cit>: qui sub obtentu monituum deorum scientes eos fingunt, Mos. et Rom. Leg. Coll. 15, 2, 6. —With <hi rend="ital">double acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">bonois se ac liberales,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 4:17:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 4, 17, 3</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignorare fingit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> in Eutrop. 2, 306</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">fic-tus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">feigned</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fictitious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">false</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in amicitia nihil fictum est, nihil simulatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:8:26" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 8, 26</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 18, 65</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ficto officio et simulata sedultiate conjunctus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:5:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 5, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in re ficta (opp. in vera),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:7:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 7, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">falsum est id totum neque solum fictum, sed etiam imperite absurdeque fictum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">commenticii et ficti dii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:28:70" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 28, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fabula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:9:39" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 9, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in rebus fictis et adumbratis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:26:97" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 26, 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1192" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1192</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gemitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:565" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 565</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cunctatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ficto pectore fatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 107</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose also, of persons: <cit><quote lang="la">pro bene sano Ac non incauto fictum astutumque vocamus,</quote> <trans><tr>dissembling</tr>, <tr>false</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alii fictum (eum), ingratum, immemorem loquuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:18:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 18, 3</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">but: ficta pellice plorat,</quote> <trans><tr>imaginary</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:272" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 272</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">fictum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">deception</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fiction</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ficti pravique tenax,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:188" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 188</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam consumpserat omnem Materiam ficti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:767" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 767</bibl></cit>.—Adverb.: <cit><quote lang="la">fictumque in colla minatus, Crura subit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:6:876" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 6, 876</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ficte</orth>, <hi rend="ital">feignedly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fictitiously</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ficte et simulate quaestus causa insusurrare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:4:section=13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 4, § 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ficte reconciliata gratia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:12:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 3, 12, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
finiens: <entryFree id="n18200" type="main" key="fi_ni^ens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fīnĭens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, v. finio, I. B.</entryFree>
finio: <entryFree id="n18201" type="main" key="fi_ni^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fīnĭo</orth>, <itype>īvi or ĭi, ītum, 4</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>finis</etym>, <sense id="n18201.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to limit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bound</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enclose within boundaries</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n18201.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n18201.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">populi Romani imperium Rhenum finire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:16:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 16, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo (jugo) Cappadocia finitur ab Armenia, Auct. B. Alex. 35, 5: Tmolus Sardibus hinc, illinc parvis finitur Hypaepis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:152" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 152</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:126:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 126, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem res finire videtur (followed by terminare),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:998" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 998</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">riparum clausas margine finit aquas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:222" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 222</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">signum animo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:18:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 18, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in ore sita lingua est, finita dentibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:59:149" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 59, 149</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18201.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic.: finiens orbis or circulus, <hi rend="ital">the horizon</hi>: illi orbes, qui aspectum nostrum definiunt, qui a Graecis <foreign lang="greek">o(ri/zontes</foreign> nominantur, a nobis finientes rectissime nominari possunt, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:44:92" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 44, 92</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">circulus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 5:17:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 5, 17, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n18201.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n18201.5" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To set bounds to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">restrain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">check</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">equidem illud ipsum non nimium probo, philosophum loqui de cupiditatibus finiendis: an potest cupiditas finiri?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:9:27" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 9, 27</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cupiditates satietate,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 20, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deliberativas miror a quibusdam sola utilitate finitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:8:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 8, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18201.6" n="B" level="2"> For definio, <hi rend="ital">to prescribe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">determine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fix</hi>, <hi rend="ital">appoint</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assign</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sepulcris novis finivit modum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg, 2, 26, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">AD EAM REM RATIONE CVRSVS ANNVOS SACERDOTES FINIVNTO,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 8, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spatia omnis temporis numero noctium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:18:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 18, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: Hercyniae silvae latitudo novem dierum iter patet; <cit><quote lang="la">non enim aliter finiri potest,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>its extent cannot be described more accurately</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 25, 1</bibl></cit>; so too is to be explained the disputed passage: hoc autem sphaerae genus, in quo solis et lunae motus inessent ... in illa sphaera solida non potuisse finiri, <hi rend="ital">this sort of</hi> (movable) <hi rend="ital">celestial globe ... could not be defined</hi>, <hi rend="ital">marked out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on that solid globe</hi> (of Thales), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:14" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">locum, in quo dimicaturi essent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:47:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 47, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut si finias equum, genus est animal, species mortale, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:3:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 3, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">rhetorice finitur varie,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:15:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 15, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sit nobis orator is, qui a M. Catone finitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:1:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 1, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:3:40" default="NO">12, 3, 40</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass. impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">de pecunia finitur, Ne major causa ludorum consumeretur quam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:44:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 44, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18201.7" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To</hi> <cb n="FINI" /> <hi rend="ital">put an end to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to finish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">terminate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:51:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 51, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:1:9" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 1, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:16:2:8" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 16, 2, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:17:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 17, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">prandia nigris moris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:4:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 4, 23</bibl></cit>: graves labores morte, Poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:48:115" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 48, 115</bibl> (transl. from Eurip. <foreign lang="greek">po/nwn pepaume/non</foreign>): <cit><quote lang="la">dolores morte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:15:49" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 15, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tristitiam vitaeque labores molli mero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:7:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 7, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">labores,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 4, 39</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 1, 93</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dolores,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 263</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">studia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 104</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:19:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 1, 19, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sitim,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 146</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">honores aequo animo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:33:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 33, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitam mihi ense,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:7:49" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 7, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitam voluntariā morte, inediā, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 19, 22, § 66</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:157" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 42, 64, § 157</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">so very rarely of a natural death: Valerianus in illo dedecore vitam finivit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> Mort. Pers. 5, 6</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 66:43" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 66, 43</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">praecipitare te et finire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Cons. ad Marc. 3:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Cons. ad Marc. 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Burrus) impedito meatu spiritum finiebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:591" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 591</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(distinctiones) interest sermonem finiant an sensum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:37" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 37</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut verbum acuto sono finiant,</quote> <trans><tr>to pronounce with the accent on the last syllable</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:25" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 5, 25</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to come to an end</hi>, <hi rend="ital">close</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be ended</hi>, <hi rend="ital">terminate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut senten tiae verbis finiantur,</quote> <trans><tr>end</tr>, <tr>close with verbs</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:49:191" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 49, 191</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nec solum componentur verba ratione, sed etiam finientur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:49:164" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 49, 164</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Latinum (verbum), quod o et n litteris finiretur, non reperiebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:60" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 60</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:6:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 6, 14</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n18201.8" n="2" level="3"> In partic. (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose), <hi rend="ital">to come to an end</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to cease.</hi> </sense><sense id="n18201.9" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To finish speaking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">draw to a close</hi>, <hi rend="ital">end</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">finierat Paean,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:566" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 566</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">13, 123</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">14, 441</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">finiturus eram, sed, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:755" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 1, 755</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut semel finiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:12:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 12, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:55" default="NO">8, 3, 55</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">denique, ut semel finiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:138" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 4, 138</bibl></cit>: 5, 13, 3; 11, 3, 59.—</sense><sense id="n18201.10" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To come to one's end</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to die</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic fuit utilius finiri ipsi, Cic. poët. Tusc. 1, 48, 115: sic Tiberius finivit octavo et septuagesimo aetatis anno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 50 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; for which, in <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui morbo finiuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 12, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Seleucus quoque iisdem ferme diebus finitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:27:3:12" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 27, 3, 12</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">finita Juliorum domo,</quote> <trans><tr>become extinct</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 16</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">fīnītus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> In rhetor., of words, <hi rend="ital">that terminate properly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">well-rounded</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rhythmical</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">et ipsi infracta et amputata loquuntur et eos vituperant, qui apta et finita pronuntiant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:51:170" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 51, 170</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">finitissimus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> 1076</bibl></cit> P.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">fīnītē</orth>. * </sense><sense id="n18201.11" n="1" level="3"> (Acc. to II. A.) <hi rend="ital">To a certain extent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">within limits</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">avarus erit, sed finite,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:9:27" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 9, 27</bibl></cit>.— * </sense><sense id="n18201.12" n="2" level="3"> (Acc. to II. B.) <hi rend="ital">Definitely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">specifically</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">referri oportere ad senatum aut infinite de re publica, aut de singulis rebus finite,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:14:7:9" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 14, 7, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
finis: <entryFree id="n18202" type="main" key="fi_nis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fīnis</orth>, <itype>is</itype> (<case>abl.</case> regularly fine; <sense id="n18202.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">fini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:978" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 978</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">also fine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:976" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> 976</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and adverb. fini, ea fini, qua fini,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 21, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">28, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">154</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:3:30" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 3, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:3:29" default="NO">7, 3, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:16:2:19" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 16, 2, 19</bibl>), <gen>m.</gen> (<gen>f.</gen> mostly ante- and post-class. and <usg type="style">poet.</usg>, and only in <number>sing.</number>, Att., Caecil., Varr., Sisenn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 205, 6 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 107</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:551" default="NO" valid="yes">551</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:555" default="NO" valid="yes">555</bibl>; 561 sq.; cf. Lachm. p. 43; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:554" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 554</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 328</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">384</bibl>; 12, 793 al.; <cit><quote lang="la">rarely in class. prose,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:22:55" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 22, 55</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 12, 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:10:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 9, 10, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 2, 4</bibl> Weissenb. ad loc.; 9, 26, 9; 22, 57, 5; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 30, 10, 24, § 82</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:3" default="NO" valid="yes">33, 1, 1, § 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:98 al" default="NO" valid="yes">33, 6, 31, § 98 al.</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">plur. f.</hi> only <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:1:13" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, 1, 13</bibl>; v. Neue, Formenl. 1, 703) [for fidnis, root bhid-, fid-, v. findo; for the suffix, cf.: pa-nis, ig-nis, etc.], <hi rend="ital">a boundary</hi>, <hi rend="ital">limit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">border</hi>, = terminus, <foreign lang="greek">o(/ros</foreign>. </sense><sense id="n18202.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">accessit propius et jam ingrediens intra finem ejus loci, quem oleae terminabant, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:8:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 8, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fere ad extremum finem provinciae Galliae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:16:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 16, 5</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:37:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 33, 37, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Philaenōn arae, quem locum Aegyptum vorsus finem imperii habuere Carthaginienses,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 19:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 19, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem ad finem porrecta ac loca aperta pertinebant, cedentes (hostes) insequi,</quote> <trans><tr>as far as</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:19:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 19, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus venientibus ad finem legatio Veientium obviam fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:58:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 58, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nulla legatio ad finem praesto fuerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:15:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 38, 15, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:35:1" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 35, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">haud procul Argivorum fine positis castris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 5, 5</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:27:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 35, 27, 9</bibl> Drak.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">vicini nostri hic ambigunt de finibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:1:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 3, 1, 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec Mamilia lege singuli, sed ex his tres arbitri fines regemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:21:55" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 21, 55</bibl></cit> (v. rego, I. B.): <cit><quote lang="la">in finibus Lycaoniae, mihi litterae redditae sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 15, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: Q. Fabius Labeo arbiter Nolanis et Neapolitanis de finibus a senatu datus ... fines <pb n="752" /> <cb n="FINI" /> terminare, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:10:33" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 10, 33</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">SEX. ATILIVS INTER ATESTINOS ET VEICETINOS FINIS TERMINOSQVE STATVI IVSIT,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3110</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fines proferre, propagare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:12" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 3, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:9:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 9, 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter eos fines, quos feci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:18:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 18, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">atque hominum finem Gades Calpenque secutus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:1:141" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 1, 141</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18202.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n18202.3" n="1" level="3"> In <number>plur.</number>, <hi rend="ital">borders</hi>, and hence <hi rend="ital">territory</hi>, <hi rend="ital">land</hi>, <hi rend="ital">country</hi> enclosed within boundaries: <cit><quote lang="la">propere de finibus suis exercitus deducerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per agrum Sequanorum iter in Santonum fines facere, qui non longe a Tolosatium finibus absunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 10, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">si suas copias Aedui in fines Bellovacorum introduxerint,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 5, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">civitatum fines incolere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego his finibus ejectus sum, quos, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 14:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 14, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque flumen neque mons erat, qui fines eorum discerneret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 79:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 79, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Multum interest, alienos populare fines an tuos uri exscindive videas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:44:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 44, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">veteres nullum animal sacrum in finibus suis esse patiebantur, sed abigebant ad fines deorum, quibus sacrum esset,</quote> <trans><tr>where these gods were worshipped</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 3, 7, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18202.4" n="2" level="3"> Fine or fini alicujus rei, <hi rend="ital">up to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">as far as</hi>, a certain point (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">matresfamiliae de muro pectoris fine prominentes passis manibus obtestabantur Romanos, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:47:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 47, 5</bibl></cit> Oud. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi> (al. pectore nudo); so, <cit><quote lang="la">fine inguinum ingrediuntur mare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. Fragm. 3:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. Fragm. 3, 38</bibl></cit> Gerl. (in Arus. Mess. p. 231 ed. Lind.): <cit><quote lang="la">fine genūs vestem ritu succincta Dianae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:536" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 536</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per mare umbilici fine ingressi, Auct. B. Afr. 85, 1: amphoras nolito implere nimium ansarum infimarum fini,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 113, 2</bibl></cit>: Asiam orientis fine a Macedonibus perdomitam, Justin. 30, 4.</sense><sense id="n18202.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a limit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bound</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Crassus mihi visus est oratoris facultatem non illius artis terminis, sed ingenii sui finibus, immensis paene, describere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:49:214" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 49, 214</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">certos mihi fines terminosque constituam, extra quos egredi non possim,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 10, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">finem et modum transire,</quote> <trans><tr>to go beyond all bounds and measure</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:29:102" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 29, 102</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">transcendere fines Juris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">modum aliquem et finem orationi facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:48:section=118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 48, § 118</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">est modus in rebus, sunt certi denique fines, Quos ultraque citraque nequit consistere rectum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 1, 106</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intra Naturae fines vivere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(dixit) mulierem quinque pueros enixam ... eumque esse finem multijugae hominum partionis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:2:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consulta, quibus sedecim stipendiorum finem expresserant,</quote> <trans><tr>term</tr>, <tr>limit</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">his finibus luxuriam coercere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:24:15" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 24, 15</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">the starting-point in a race</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Inde, ubi clara dedit sonitum tuba, finibus omnes Prosiluere suis (of vessels),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 139</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18202.6" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, like <foreign lang="greek">te/los</foreign>. </sense><sense id="n18202.7" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">An end</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in hoc (aequo judicio) uno denique falsae infamiae finis aliquis atque exitus reperiatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicendi finem facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:65:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 65, 136</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">si placet, in hunc diem hactenus ... finem disputandi facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:44" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 44 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scribendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:55:224" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 55, 224</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maledictis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:prol. 34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. prol. 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">injuriis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:33:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 33, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitae finem afferre alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:6:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 6, 1, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quando finem habet motus, vivendi finem habeat necesse est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:25" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 6, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">finem judiciariae controversiae constituere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:2:section=5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 2, § 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratio lecta ad eum finem, quem, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>as far as</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:34:154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 34, 154</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ludus repertus, et longorum operum finis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:406" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 406</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperium sine fine,</quote> <trans><tr>everlasting</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:279" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 279</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pigetque actorum sine fine mihi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:387" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 387</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">poscens sine fine oscula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:334" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 334</bibl></cit> al.—Adverb.: ad eum finem, <hi rend="ital">until that</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">amor bestiarum in educandis custodiendisque iis, quae procreaverunt, usque ad eum finem, dum possint se ipsa defendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:51:129" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 51, 129</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mansit in condicione usque ad eum finem, dum judices rejecti sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:6:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 1, 6, 16</bibl></cit>: quem ad finem, <hi rend="ital">till when? how long?</hi> quamdiu furor iste tuus eludet? quem ad finem sese effrenata jactabit audacia? <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 1, 1, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">piratam vivum tenuisti: quem ad finem? dum cum imperio fuisti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:29:section=75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 29, § 75</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 5, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:26:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 26, 1</bibl>; cf.: <hi rend="ital">Lu.</hi> Sequere... <hi rend="ital">In.</hi> Sequor: <cit><quote lang="la">sed finem fore quem dicam nescio (i. e. sequendi),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:prol. 2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. prol. 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18202.8" n="b" level="4"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n18202.9" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">The end of life</hi>, <hi rend="ital">latter end</hi>, <hi rend="ital">death</hi> (not till after the Aug. per.): <cit><quote lang="la">comperit invidiam supremo fine domari,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>after death</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 11, 12</bibl></cit>: tu <cb n="FINI" /> ne quaesieris, quem mihi, quem tibi Finem di dederint, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:11:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 1, 11, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec quicquam jam de fine, si fata poscerent, recusans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:123:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 123, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 30:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 30, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:3:3:4" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 3, 3, 4</bibl> <hi rend="ital">ext.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">septem a Neronis fine menses sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Augusti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 1, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 16</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 39</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">voluntarius,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 19</bibl></cit>; 15, 63 et saep.—</sense><sense id="n18202.10" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">The end</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extremity</hi> of an ascending series, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the highest point</hi>, <hi rend="ital">greatest degree</hi>, <hi rend="ital">summit</hi>: sentis credo, me jam diu, quod <foreign lang="greek">te/los</foreign> Graeci dicunt, id dicere tum extremum, tum ultimum, tum summum: <cit><quote lang="la">licebit etiam finem pro extremo aut ultimo dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:7:26" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 7, 26</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 4, 11</bibl>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">ad finem bonorum, quo referuntur et cujus causa sunt facienda omnia,</quote> <trans><tr>the chief good</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:20:52" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 20, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fines bonorum et malorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:17:55" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 17, 55</bibl></cit>; hence the title of Cicero's treatise De Finibus, analog. to the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">peri\ telw=n</foreign>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:21:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 13, 21, 4</bibl>, with <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 19, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">honorum populi finis est consulatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:25:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 25, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quemque sperandi sibi, eundem bene dicendi finem proponerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:1:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 2, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">duodecim tabulae, finis aequi juris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 27</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n18202.11" n="(g)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">An end</hi>, <hi rend="ital">purpose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">aim</hi>, <hi rend="ital">object</hi> (but <hi rend="ital">an end</hi> subjectively regarded, as an intention, or design, is propositum, consilium, mens, etc.): <cit><quote lang="la">omnes artes habere finem aliquem propositum, ad quem tendunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:17:22" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 17, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laudis et gloriae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 3, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domus finis est usus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:39:138" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 39, 138</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">officium ejus facultatis videtur esse, dicere apposite ad persuasionem: finis, persuadere dictione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:5:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 1, 5, 6</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 51, 156</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,038:4:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Part. Or. 4, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:42:188" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 42, 188</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 34, 145</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:15:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 15, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem finem vel quid summum et ultimum habeat rhetorice,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:ib. 38" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">volgaris liberalitas referenda est ad illum Ennii finem, Nihilo minus ipsi lucet, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:16:52" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 16, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad finem vitae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:17:41" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 17, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">medicinae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:ib. 25" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 25</bibl></cit>; 2, 21, 3.—</sense><sense id="n18202.12" n="(d)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">An intention</hi>, <hi rend="ital">design</hi>, <hi rend="ital">end in view</hi> (very rare; cf. <foreign lang="greek">g</foreign> supra): <cit><quote lang="la">quod ad eum finem memoravimus, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 64</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18202.13" n="2" level="3"> In rhet. lang., i. q. finitio and definitio, qs. an explanatory limiting, <hi rend="ital">a definition</hi>, <hi rend="ital">explanation</hi> (perh. not in Cic., but repeatedly in Quint.): <cit><quote lang="la">dicuntur argumenta ex finitione seu fine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:54" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">est frequentissimus finis, rhetoricen esse vim persuadendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:15:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 15, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:ib. 11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11</bibl> sq.; 4, 4, 3 Spald. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n18202.14" n="3" level="3"> In the later jurid. Lat., <hi rend="ital">a measure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">amount</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">placuit, ut fructus hypothecarum usuris compensaret, fini legitimae usurae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:20:1:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 20, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">finem pretii, deminuere vel excedere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:21:2:66" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 21, 2, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad finem peculii legata praestare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:49:17:17" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 49, 17, 17</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
finite: <entryFree id="n18203" type="main" key="Fi_ni_te"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Fīnīte</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. finio <sense id="n18203.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
finitimus: <entryFree id="n18204" type="main" key="fi_ni^ti^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fīnĭtĭmus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">fīnĭtŭmus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>finis; cf. maritimus</etym>, <sense id="n18204.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">bordering upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">adjoining</hi>, <hi rend="ital">neighboring</hi> (class.; syn.: vicinus, confinis, conterminus, contiguus, continens). </sense><sense id="n18204.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n18204.2" n="A" level="2"> <pos>Adj.</pos> </sense><sense id="n18204.3" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sumus enim finitimi Atinatibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:9:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 9, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Galli Belgis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homines bellicosi locis patentibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 10, 2</bibl></cit>: regnum Ariobarzanis vestris vectigalibus, Cic. de lmp. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1321,001:2:5" default="NO"><author>Pomp.</author> 2, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aër mari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1321,001:N. D. 2:39:101" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 39, 101</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">latus Boreae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>bordering upon the north</tr>, <tr>northern</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:24:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 24, 38</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18204.4" n="(b)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">Romanos ea loca finitimae provinciae adjungere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Marsi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:16:3" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 16, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:38:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 38, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:10:111" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 4, 10, 111</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">civitates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:32:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 32, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18204.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">fīnĭtĭmi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">neighbors</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">bella cum finitimis felicissime multa gessit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:9" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 9</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">finitimi ac vicini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:20:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 20, 58</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Imp. Pomp. 4, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 2, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 5, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 16, 2</bibl> et saep. —</sense><sense id="n18204.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">bordering upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">adjoining</hi>, <hi rend="ital">nearly related</hi>, <hi rend="ital">like.</hi> </sense><sense id="n18204.7" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">unicuique virtuti finitimum vitium reperietur, ut audacia, quae fidentiae finitima est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:54:165" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 54, 165</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:44:185" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 44, 185</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">metus aegritudini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:30:64" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 4, 30, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">falsa veris,</quote> <trans><tr>closely allied</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 21, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deterrimum genus optimo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:42" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consensus principum administrationi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">poëta oratori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:chapter=1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1</bibl></cit>. 16, 70; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">historia huic generi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:20:66" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 20, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Autronii nomen finitimum maxime est hujus periculo et crimini,</quote> <trans><tr>is very closely connected with</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:25:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 25, 71</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18204.8" n="(b)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">illa, quae propinqua videntur et finitima esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:54:165" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 54, 165</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">artium studiorumque quasi finitima vicinitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:42:156" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 42, 156</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">finitimum malum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:28" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 28</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
finitio: <entryFree id="n18205" type="main" key="fi_ni_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fīnītĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>finio</etym> (post-Aug.). <sense id="n18205.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A</hi> <cb n="FIRM" /> <hi rend="ital">limiting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">limit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">boundary</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 4</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; 8, 1.—</sense><sense id="n18205.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A determining</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assigning</hi>, viz., </sense><sense id="n18205.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a division</hi>, <hi rend="ital">part</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Astr. 1:6" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Astr. 1, 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n18205.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n18205.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A definition</hi>, <hi rend="ital">explanation</hi> (esp. freq. in Quint.): <cit><quote lang="la">finitio est rei propositae propria et dilucida et breviter comprehensa verbis enunciatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:3:2 sq" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 3, 2 sq.</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:15:34" default="NO">2, 15, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:49" default="NO">3, 6, 49</bibl>; 5, 10, 63 et saep.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:9:11" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 9, 11</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n18205.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A rule</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">illam quasi finitionem veluti quandam legem sanxerunt, eos tantum surculos posse coalescere, qui, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:11:12" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 11, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18205.6" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An end;</hi> esp., </sense><sense id="n18205.7" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The end of life</hi>, <hi rend="ital">death</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 810, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">FATI,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4776</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18205.8" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Completeness</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">progressum esse ad hanc finitionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 1, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
finitivus: <entryFree id="n18206" type="main" key="fi_ni_ti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fīnītīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>finio</etym> (post-Aug.), rhet. and gram. t. t. <sense id="n18206.0" n="I" level="1"> In rhetoric, <hi rend="ital">defining</hi>, <hi rend="ital">explaining</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">status,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 6, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:26" default="NO">26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">causa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:3:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 3, 26</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18206.1" n="II" level="1"> In gram. </sense><sense id="n18206.2" n="A" level="2"> Modus, <hi rend="ital">definite</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the indicative</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 328</bibl> P.—</sense><sense id="n18206.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Final</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">litterae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 3, § 240</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaestio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, § 466</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
finitor: <entryFree id="n18207" type="main" key="fi_ni_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fīnītor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n18207.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">One who determines boundaries</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a surveyor</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">decempedator, metator): quaestori permittant, finitorem mittant: ratum sit, quod finitor uni illi, a quo missus erit, renuntiaverit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:13:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 13, 34</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 17, 45</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 20, 53</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 1, 37</bibl>.—Comically: <cit><quote lang="la">ejus (argumenti) nunc regiones, limites, confinia Determinabo: ei rei ego sum factus finitor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:prol. 49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. prol. 49</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18207.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">circulus,</quote> <trans><tr>the horizon</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 5:17:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 5, 17, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:496" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 496</bibl>.—*</sense><sense id="n18207.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">One who ends</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">o cunctis finitor maxime rerum (Pluto),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:8:91" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 8, 91</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
finitus: <entryFree id="n18208" type="main" key="fi_ni_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fīnītus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from finio.</entryFree>
fio: <entryFree id="n18209" type="main" key="fi_o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fīo</orth>, <itype>fĭĕri</itype>, <sense id="n18209.0" n="I" level="1"><xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref targOrder="U">facio</ref></xr> <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
fircus: <entryFree id="n18210" type="gloss" key="fircus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fircus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, v. hircus <sense id="n18210.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
firmamen: <entryFree id="n18211" type="main" key="firma_men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">firmāmen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>firmo</etym>, <usg type="style">poet.</usg> for firmamentum, <sense id="n18211.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a prop</hi>, <hi rend="ital">support</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">trunci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:491" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 491</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Fur. 1251" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Fur. 1251</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
firmamentum: <entryFree id="n18212" type="main" key="firma_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">firmāmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n18212.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a strengthening</hi>, <hi rend="ital">support</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prop</hi> (class.; esp. freq. in the trop. sense and in Cic.). </sense><sense id="n18212.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">transversaria tigna iniciuntur, quae firmamento esse possint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:15:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 15, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ossa nervique et articuli, firmamenta totius corporis, Sen. de Ira, 2, 1, 2: vincula et firmamenta membrorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:22:9" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 22, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18212.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the sky fixed above the earth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the firmament</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Bapt. 3</bibl>; Aug. de Genes. ad lit. 2 et saep.—</sense><sense id="n18212.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n18212.4" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a support</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prop</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stay</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">eum ordinem, qui exercet vectigalia, firmamentum ceterorum ordinum recte esse dicemus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Imp. Pomp. 7, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">firmamentum ac robur totius accusationis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:28:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 28, 58</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">multo plus firmamenti ac roboris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Imp. Pomp. 4, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parum firmamenti et parum virium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rei publicae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:9:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 9, 23</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">imperii populi Romani,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 3, 5, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stabilitatis constantiaeque fides est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:18:65" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 18, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dignitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:3:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 4, 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">honor sacerdotii firmamentum, potentiae adsumebatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:5:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 5, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si ullum firmamentum in illo teste posuisses,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 37, 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legionem ex subsidiis in primam aciem firmamentum ducit,</quote> <trans><tr>as a support</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 2, 9</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">Romulus cum haec egregia duo firmamenta rei publicae peperisset, auspicia et senatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18212.5" n="B" level="2"> In partic., rhet. t. t., <hi rend="ital">the chief support</hi> of an argument, <hi rend="ital">the main point</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">to\ sune/xon</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:14:19" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 14, 19</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Part. 29, 103</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 1, 16, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:11:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 11, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9" default="NO">9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12" default="NO">12</bibl> sq.</sense></entryFree>
firmani: <entryFree id="n18213" type="main" key="Firma_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Firmāni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, v. Firmum, II.</entryFree>
firmanus: <entryFree id="n18214" type="main" key="Firma_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Firmānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Firmum, II.</entryFree>
firmator: <entryFree id="n18215" type="main" key="firma_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">firmātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>firmo</etym>, <sense id="n18215.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a confirmer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">establisher</hi> (post-Aug. and very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">missus Drusus paci firmator (so acc. to Cod. Med., not pacis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">disciplinae militaris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:38:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 38, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
firme: <entryFree id="n18216" type="main" key="firme_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">firmē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. firmus <sense id="n18216.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
firmianus: <entryFree id="n18217" type="main" key="Firmi^a_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Firmĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Firmius.</entryFree>
firmicus: <entryFree id="n18218" type="main" key="Firmi^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Firmĭcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, Julius F. Maternus, <sense id="n18218.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman mathematician in the time of Constantine the Great</hi>, <hi rend="ital">author of a work entitled</hi> Matheseos libri octo; cf. Bernhardy, Rom. <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> pp. 645, 648.</sense></entryFree>
firmitas: <entryFree id="n18219" type="main" key="firmi^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">firmĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>firmus</etym>, <sense id="n18219.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">firmness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">durability</hi>, <hi rend="ital">strength</hi> (class.; syn.: constantia, firmitudo, perseverantia). </sense><sense id="n18219.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: ea, quae ille (Epicurus) propter firmitatem <foreign lang="greek">stere/mnia</foreign> appellat, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:19:49" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 19, 49</bibl>: age specta, <pb n="753" /> <cb n="FIRM" /> postes cujusmodi! Quanta firmitate facti, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:2:134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 2, 134</bibl>: materiae, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 11, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">amphorarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:161" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 12, 46, § 161</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aegyptii lini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 19, 1, 2, § 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fastigiorum templorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:158" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 35, 12, 46, § 158</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uvae contra frigora, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 14, 3, 4, § 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 14, 2, 4, § 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gladiatoria totius corporis,</quote> <trans><tr>vigor</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:25:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 25, 63</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:4:16" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 4, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">corporis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:16:13" default="NO">2, 16, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:4:7" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 4, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:1" default="NO" valid="yes">15, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">capitis, lateris pecorisve,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:16" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:40" default="NO">40</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">firmitas et vigor vocis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:3:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">valetudinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 5, 20, § 42</bibl></cit>. —In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">pulvis Puteolanus aedificiis praestat firmitates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18219.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">firmness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">steadfastness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stability</hi>, <hi rend="ital">endurance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">constancy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">power</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">firmitas et constantia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 11, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:44:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 44, 95</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:38:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 12, 38, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:26:74" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 26, 74</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sapientis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 20, 66</bibl></cit>: exercitus numero amplissimus, firmitate exiguus, Planc. in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:24:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 24, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut quisque minimum firmitatis haberet minimumque virium, ita amicitias appetere maxime,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:13:46" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 13, 46</bibl></cit>;
