cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ea (amicitia) non satis habet firmitatis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si aliquid firmitatis nactus sit Antonius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:12:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 11, 12, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:7" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
firmiter: <entryFree id="n18220" type="main" key="firmi^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">firmĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. firmus <sense id="n18220.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
firmitudo: <entryFree id="n18221" type="main" key="firmi^tu_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">firmĭtūdo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>firmus</etym>, <sense id="n18221.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">firmness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">durability</hi>, <hi rend="ital">strength</hi> (less freq. than firmitas, but class.). </sense><sense id="n18221.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">tanta in eis (navibus) erat firmitudo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:13:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 13, 8</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tanta erat operis (i. e. pontis) firmitudo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 17, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vocis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 3, 11, 20</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n18221.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">firmness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">constancy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stability</hi>, <hi rend="ital">strength of mind</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">animi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:2:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 2, 54</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quod firmitudinem gravitatemque animi tui perspexi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:13:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 13, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quantum esset hominibus praesidii in animi firmitudine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:28:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 28, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in patientia firmitudinem simulans,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 46</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 15, 62</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non quod salus ab isto data quicquam habitura sit firmitudinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:11:14:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 11, 14, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec constitutio habet firmitudinem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:45" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(translationes) per se minus habeant firmitudinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:19:58" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 19, 58</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
firmius: <entryFree id="n18222" type="main" key="Firmi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Firmĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n18222.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman proper name</hi>, e. g. Firmius Catus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 27</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 31</bibl>.— Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Firmĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Firmius</hi>, an unknown silver-worker of that name: <cit><quote lang="la">Firmiana vasa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 11, 49, § 139</bibl></cit> (Jan. Furniana).</sense></entryFree>
firmo: <entryFree id="n18223" type="main" key="firmo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">firmo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>firmus</etym>, <sense id="n18223.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make firm</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fast</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to strengthen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fortify</hi>, <hi rend="ital">support</hi> (freq. and class.). </sense><sense id="n18223.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacertos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:397" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 397</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpora juvenum firmari labore voluerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:15:36" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 15, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpora cibo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 13 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vexatos milites quiete,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:10" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praegnantes largo pascuo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:27:10" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 27, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bitumen aeramentis illinitur firmatque ea contra ignes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:182" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 15, 51, § 182</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">remedium ad dentium mobilĭs firmandos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:180" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 31, 105, § 180</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aestuaria aggeribus et pontibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestigia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:659" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 659</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gradum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:129" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 129</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alvum solutam,</quote> <trans><tr>to bind</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 1, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 18, 22, § 117</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n18223.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n18223.3" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to fortify</hi>, <hi rend="ital">strengthen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">secure; to make lasting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">durable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">permanent</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Romulus) urbem auspicato condere, et firmare dicitur primum cogitavisse rem publicam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:3" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">urbem colonis firmare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 18</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">novam civitatem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">provinciam pace praesidiisque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 7, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">locum magnis munitionibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:29:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 29, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">turres praesidiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 23:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 23, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aditum urbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:466" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 466</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aciem subsidiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:17:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 17, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">latronum opes firmare atque augere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:11:40" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 11, 40</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">in aliquos imperium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:11:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 11, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vocem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:61:227" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 61, 227</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">firmari consuetudine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:24" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quorum (hominum) cum adolescentiae cupiditates defervissent, eximiae virtutes firmata jam aetate exstiterunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:18:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 18, 43</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">animus adolescentis nondum consilio ac ratione firmatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 6, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">firmata stirpe virtutis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:32:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 32, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pacem amicitiamque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 3, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">memoria praecipue firmatur atque alitur exercitatione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:1:36" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 1, 36</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">memoriam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:4:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 4, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opinio omnium gentium firmata consensu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:1:1" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non tamen pro firmato stetit magistratus ejus jus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 7, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18223.4" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n18223.5" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To strengthen in resolution</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to encourage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">animate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus adventus Pompeianos compressit nostrosque firmavit, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:65:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 65, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">donec firmaret consilio patres auctor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:5:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 5, 46</bibl></cit>: suos, <cb n="FIRM" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:11" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">plebem hinc provocatione, hinc tribunicio auxilio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cunctos alloquio et cura sibique et proelio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animum exemplis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 16, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animum praesenti pignore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:611" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 611</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">firmatus animi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:Hist. Fragm. 3:24, p. 236" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> Hist. Fragm. 3, 24, p. 236</bibl></cit> ed. Gerl. (ap. Arus. Mess. p. 232 ed. Lindem.).— </sense><sense id="n18223.6" n="2" level="3"> In fidelity, <hi rend="ital">to make sure of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">secure</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">civitates obsidibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:27" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 27</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18223.7" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">to confirm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">show</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prove; to affirm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assert</hi>, <hi rend="ital">declare</hi>, <hi rend="ital">promise</hi> the correctness or truth of a circumstance, statement, etc. (less freq. than confirmo, affirmo): <cit><quote lang="la">cum intelligat, quam multa firmentur jure jurando,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:7:16" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 7, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si vis et natura fati ex divinationis ratione firmabitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:5:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fat. 5, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">firmatam dare fidem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:5:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 5, 45</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">fidem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 3, 1, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:4:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. 4, 2, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vix quidquam firmare ausim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 81</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">6, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 2, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc genus in rebus firmandum est multa prius quam Ipsius rei rationem reddere possis,</quote> <trans><tr>to prove</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:917" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 917</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">da augurium, atque haec omina firma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:691" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 691</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">numina,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 78</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18223.8" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">object-clauses</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">seque et ibi futurum, ubi praescripserit et ea facturum, quae imperarit obsidibus datis firmat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:48:9" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 48, 9</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">paratis omnium animis reversuros firmaverunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">firmare necesse est, nil esse in promptu, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:940" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 940</bibl></cit>.—In <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi> with a <hi rend="ital">subject-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sata bene provenire firmantur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 11, 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
firmum: <entryFree id="n18224" type="main" key="Firmum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Firmum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n18224.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fortified sea-port of Picenum</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Fermo</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:4:6" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 4, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:14:8" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 14, 8</bibl>; Pompei. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 12</bibl>, B. 1.—</sense><sense id="n18224.1" n="II" level="1"> Deriv.: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Firmānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Firmum</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Firmian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cohors,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">L. Tarutius Firmanus,</quote> <trans><tr>of Firmum</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:47:98" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 47, 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">audivi ex Gavio hoc Firmano,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 4, 8</bibl></cit>, b, 3: <cit><quote lang="la">fratres,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>— <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Firmāni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Firmum</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Firmians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:7:9:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 7, 9, 23</bibl>.—<orth extent="full" lang="la">Castellum Firmānōrum</orth>, <hi rend="ital">the port of Firmum</hi>, regarded as a separate place, now <hi rend="ital">Porto di Fermo</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 13, 18, § 111</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
firmus: <entryFree id="n18225" type="main" key="firmus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">firmus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>Sanscr. dhar-, dharā-mi, hold, support; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">qra=-, qrh/-sasqai</foreign>, to sit down, <foreign lang="greek">qrh=nus, qro/nos</foreign>; cf.: frētus, frēnum</etym>, <sense id="n18225.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">firm</hi> (in opp. to frail, destructible), <hi rend="ital">steadfast</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">strong</hi>, <hi rend="ital">powerful</hi> (freq. and class.; esp. in the trop. sense; syn.: constans, stabilis, solidus). </sense><sense id="n18225.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">nos fragili vastum ligno sulcavimus aequor: Quae tulit Aesoniden, firma carina fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:4:35" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 1, 4, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">robora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:481" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 481</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:652" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 652</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vincula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:370" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 1, 370</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">janua,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>shut fast</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 2, 12, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">sera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:2:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 1, 2, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:1" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">firmioris testae murices,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 33, 52, § 102</bibl></cit>: sunt et Amineae vites, firmissima vina. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 97</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">firmo cibo pasta pecus,</quote> <trans><tr>strengthening</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:11:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 11, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">firmius est triticum quam milium: id ipsum quam hordeum: ex tritico firmissima siligo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">effice ut valeas, et ut ad nos firmus ac valens quam primum venias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 16, 8, 1</bibl></cit> and 2; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi placebat, si firmior esses, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 16, 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nondum satis firmo corpore,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 27, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hinc remiges firmissimi, illinc inopia affectissimi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:84:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 84, 2</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">area firma templis sustinendis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 5, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">testa in structura oneri ferendo firma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:8:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 8, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adversis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 35 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense><sense id="n18225.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">firm</hi> in strength or durability, also in opinion, affection, etc., <hi rend="ital">fast</hi>, <hi rend="ital">constant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">steadfast</hi>, <hi rend="ital">immovable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">powerful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">strong</hi>, <hi rend="ital">true</hi>, <hi rend="ital">faithful</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae enim domus tam stabilis, quae tam firma civitas est, quae non odiis et discidiis funditus possit everti?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:7:23" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 7, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res publica firma atque robusta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">civitas imprimis firma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:54:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 54, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Trinobantes prope firmissima earum regionum civitas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 20, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also: Mutina firmissima et splendidissima colonia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:9:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 5, 9, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tres potentissimi ac firmissimi populi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 3</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">evocatorum firma manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 15, 4, 3</bibl></cit>: Antonius ab equitatu firmus esse dicebatur, <hi rend="ital">strong in cavalry</hi>, Planc. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:15:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 15, 2</bibl>.— With <hi rend="ital">ad</hi> and <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: satis firmus ad castra facienda, Pomp. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 12</bibl>, A, 1: <cit><quote lang="la">Chrysippi consolatio ad veritatem firmissima est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:33:79" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 33, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitus satis firmus ad tantum bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:25:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 25, 6</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cohortes minime firmae ad dimicandum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:60:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 60, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 4:62:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 4, 62, 16</bibl>.— With <hi rend="ital">contra</hi>: Jugurtha nihil satis firmum <cb n="FISC" /> contra Metellum putat, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 80:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 80, 1</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">adversus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">firmus adversus militarem largitionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">firmior adversus fortuita,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adversus convicia malosque rumores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:28" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 28</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum neque magnas copias neque firmas haberet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Eum. 3, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 3, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 56:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 56, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">concordi populo nihil esse immutabilius, nihil firmius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:32" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praesidia firmissima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:10:35" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 10, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fundamenta defensionis firmissima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">firmior fortuna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">constitutio Romuli,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 31</bibl></cit> (ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 526, 10</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">illud ratum, firmum, fixum fuisse vis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 46, 141</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">officii praecepta firma, stabilia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:2:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 2, 6</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">opinio, firma et stabilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:30:114" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 30, 114</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">firma et constans assensio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 1, 11, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne in maximis quidem rebus quicquam adhuc inveni firmius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:71:237" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 71, 237</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spem firmissimam habere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 6, 5, 4</bibl></cit>; cf.<cit><quote lang="la">, transf.: firmior candidatus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>who has stronger</tr>, <tr>greater hopes of being elected</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litterae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>containing news that may be relied upon</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 25</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 16, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">senatum sua sponte bene firmum firmiorem vestra auctoritate fecistis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:6:7:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 6, 7, 18</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vir in suscepta causa firmissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:33:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 33, 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">accusator firmus verusque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:9:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecil. 9, 29</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">with this cf.: vir pro veritate firmissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:11:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 11, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sunt fortasse in sententia firmiores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:Balb. 27:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Balb. 27, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">firmus in hoc,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:2:5" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 3, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non firmus rectum defendis et haeres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:7:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 7, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">firmus proposito,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:63" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 63 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">firmissimus irā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:457" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 457</bibl></cit>: firmo id constantique animo facias licet, Cic. Fil. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:21:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 16, 21, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc opus pectore firmo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:261" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 261</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">firmi amici sunt (opp.: amici collabascunt),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:4:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 4, 1, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">firmi et stabiles et constantes (amici),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:17:62" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 17, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex infidelissimis sociis firmissimos reddere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:4:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 15, 4, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non brevis et suffragatoria, sed firma et perpetua amicitia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0478,001:Petit. Cons. 7:26" default="NO"><author>Q. Cic.</author> Petit. Cons. 7, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">firmissimae amicitiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:2:20" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 2, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fides firma nobis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:5:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 5, 1, 6</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n18225.3" n="(b)" level="5"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg> with <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fundus nec vendibilis nec pascere firmus,</quote> <trans><tr>able</tr>, <tr>capable</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 17, 47</bibl></cit>. —Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">firmly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">steadily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lastingly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">powerfully;</hi> in two (equally common) forms: <orth extent="full" lang="la">firme</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">firmĭter</orth>. </sense><sense id="n18225.4" n="(a)" level="5"> Form firme, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 2, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:2:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 2, 2, 54</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">insistere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:26" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">firme graviterque aliquid comprehendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:21:71" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 21, 71</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">satis firme aliquid concipere animo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">continere multa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:2:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sustinere assensus suos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:9:31" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 9, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">graviter et firme respondere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:13:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 13, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18225.5" n="(b)" level="5"> Form firmiter: firmiter hoc tuo sit pectore fixum, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 512, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nisi suffulcis firmiter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:1:1:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insistere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:26:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 26, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in suo gradu collocari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:45" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 45 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: stabilita matrimonia, Cic. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 512, 23</bibl> (Rep. 6, 2 ed. Mos.): <cit><quote lang="la">promisisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 3, 2</bibl></cit> 111: <cit><quote lang="la">meminisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:8:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 8, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18225.6" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">firmius durare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:165" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 12, 46, § 165</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">firmius coire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:19:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 19, 67</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18225.7" n="c" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">asseverare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 10, 14 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pulvinus quam firmissime statuatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 5, 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fiscalis: <entryFree id="n18226" type="main" key="fisca_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fiscālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>fiscus, II. B.</etym>, <sense id="n18226.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">relating to the public</hi> or <hi rend="ital">the imperial treasury</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fiscal</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">res fiscales quasi propriae et privatae principis sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:43:8:2:section=4" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 43, 8, 2, § 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:14:42" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 2, 14, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">debitores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:49:14:45:section=10" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 49, 14, 45, § 10</bibl></cit>: calumniae, <hi rend="ital">complaints made for the advantage of the revenue</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the fines resulting from which were to go into the treasury</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:9" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">molestiae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>exactions for the treasury</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Caes. 41" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Caes. 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gladiatores,</quote> <trans><tr>maintained out of the emperor's revenue</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Gord. 3, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cursus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Hadr. 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vina,</quote> <trans><tr>given at the expense of the treasury</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Aur. 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecunia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 5, 27, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">servi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 13, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18226.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: ‡ <orth extent="full" lang="la">fiscālĭa</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">moneys for the treasury</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3351</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
fiscarius: <entryFree id="n18227" type="main" key="fisca_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fiscārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n18227.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a debtor to the treasury</hi> (post-class.): annuae fiscariorum praestationes, Firm. Math. 3, 13 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></sense></entryFree>
fiscella: <entryFree id="n18228" type="main" key="fiscella"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fiscella</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (also <orth extent="full" lang="la">fiscellus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:38:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 38, 6</bibl>, v. fiscellus), <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>fiscina</etym>, <sense id="n18228.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small basket for fruit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cheese-forms</hi>, etc., <hi rend="ital">woven of slender twigs</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rushes</hi>, etc. (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">fscina, qualus, canistrum, calathus, sporta, corbis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:3:15" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 3, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:10:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 10, 71</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:743" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 743</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:18:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 18, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:2:14" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 2, 14</bibl>.— As a <hi rend="ital">muzzle</hi> for cattle, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 54, 5</bibl>; <pb n="754" /> <cb n="FIST" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:177" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 19, 49, § 177</bibl>.—As a <hi rend="ital">form</hi> for cheese: fiscella = forma, ubi casei exprimuntur, Gloss. Isid.</sense></entryFree>
fiscellus: <entryFree id="n18229" type="main" key="fiscellus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fiscellus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>fiscina</etym>. <sense id="n18229.0" n="I" level="1"> I. q. fiscella, q. v.—</sense><sense id="n18229.1" n="II" level="1"> FISCELLUS casei mollis appetitor, ut catillones catillorum liguritores, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=90:2" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 90, 2</bibl> (acc. to Müll. we should perh. read FISCELLO; see his note ad loc.).</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n18230" type="main" key="Fiscellus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Fiscellus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n18230.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a chain of mountains in the Sabine territory</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in which the river Nar takes its rise</hi>, now called <hi rend="ital">Monte Fiscello</hi> or <hi rend="ital">Monti della Sibilla</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 12, 17, § 109</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:1:5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 1, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:519" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 519</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
fiscina: <entryFree id="n18231" type="main" key="fisci^na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fiscĭna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>fiscus</etym>, <sense id="n18231.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small basket for fruit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wine</hi>, etc., <hi rend="ital">made of slender twigs</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rushes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">broom</hi>, etc. (for syn. v. fiscella), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:5:4:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 5, 4, 29</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ficorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 17, 41</bibl></cit>; Naev. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. G. 1, 266</bibl>; Verg. l. l.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:39:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 39, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:50:10" default="NO">50, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 8, 19, § 66</bibl> Sillig <hi rend="ital">N. cr.;</hi> for leaves, browse, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:754" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 754</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:233" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 31, 74, § 233</bibl>; a <hi rend="ital">muzzle</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 34, 8, 19, § 66</bibl> (in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:44:7" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 44, 7</bibl> read Sassina).</sense></entryFree>
fiscus: <entryFree id="n18232" type="main" key="fiscus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fiscus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n18232.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a basket</hi> or <hi rend="ital">frail woven of slender twigs</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rushes</hi>, etc. (like fiscina, fiscella, q. v.); used, </sense><sense id="n18232.1" n="I" level="1"> For olives in the oilpress, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:52:22" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 52, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:54:2" default="NO">54, 2</bibl>.—Far more freq., </sense><sense id="n18232.2" n="II" level="1"> For keeping money in, <hi rend="ital">a money-basket</hi>, or, as we say, <hi rend="ital">a money-bag</hi>, <hi rend="ital">purse</hi> (cf. aerarium): <cit><quote lang="la">fiscos complures cum pecunia Siciliensi a quodam senatore ad equitem Romanum esse translatos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:8:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 8, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mulus ferebat fiscos cum pecunia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:2:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 2, 7, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:18" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 18</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">aerata multus in arca Fiscus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>much money</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:259" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 259</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18232.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n18232.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The public chest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">state treasury</hi>, <hi rend="ital">public revenues</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaternos HS, quos mihi senatus decrevit et ex aerario dedit, ego habebo et in cistam transferam de fisco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:85:section=197" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 85, § 197</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui fiscum sustulit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 79</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">183: de fisco quid egerit Scipio, quaeram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 4, 5</bibl></cit> Manut.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 2, 16</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> 1</bibl> Esdr. 7, 20. —</sense><sense id="n18232.5" n="2" level="3"> In the times of the emperors, <hi rend="ital">the imperial treasury</hi>, <hi rend="ital">imperial revenues</hi>, <hi rend="ital">emperor's privy purse</hi> (opp. aerarium, the public chest or treasury): <cit><quote lang="la">quantum pecuniae in aerario et fiscis et vectigalibus residuis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:101" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 101</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:28" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Claud. 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:32" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 7:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 7, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fisci de imperatore rapti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bona in fiscum cogere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:39:4:9" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 39, 4, 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortasse non eadem severitate fiscum quam aerarium cohibes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:36" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 36</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">Judaicus,</quote> <trans><tr>the tax paid by the Jews into the imperial treasury</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:12" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quidquid conspicuum pulchrumque est aequore toto res fisci est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:4:55" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 4, 55</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fissiculo: <entryFree id="n18233" type="main" key="fissi^cu^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fissĭcŭlo</orth>, no <sense id="n18233.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>fissum, from findo</etym>, in the lang. of the haruspices, <hi rend="ital">to divide the entrails</hi> (post - class.): <cit><quote lang="la">extis fissiculandis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> de Deo Socr. p. 45</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 2, § 151</bibl>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">fissiculatis extorum prosiciis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, § 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fissilis: <entryFree id="n18234" type="main" key="fissi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fissĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>findo</etym>. <sense id="n18234.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">That may be cleft</hi> or <hi rend="ital">split</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fissile</hi> (rare; <cit><quote lang="la">not in Cic. or Caes.): robur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:181" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 181</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">lignum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 1, 144</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:187" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 39, 73, § 187</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">arundo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:157" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 16, 36, 64, § 157</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vena lapidis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 36, 17, 27, § 131</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18234.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Cleft</hi>, <hi rend="ital">split</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">stipes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:1:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 1, 3</bibl></cit>. —Comically transf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ad focum si adesses, Non fissile haberes caput,</quote> <trans><tr>you would not have had your crown cracked</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:2:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 3, 2, 26</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fissio: <entryFree id="n18235" type="hapax" key="fissi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fissĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n18235.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a cleaving</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dividing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">glebarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:63:159" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 63, 159</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fissipes: <entryFree id="n18236" type="main" key="fissi^pes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fissĭ-pes</orth>, <itype>pĕdis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>fissus, from findo</etym>, <sense id="n18236.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">cloven-footed.</hi> </sense><sense id="n18236.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">juvencae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 5, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18236.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">split</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">calamus,</quote> <trans><tr>a pen for writing</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 7, 49</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fissum: <entryFree id="n18237" type="main" key="fissum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fissum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, v. findo <sense id="n18237.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
fissura: <entryFree id="n18238" type="main" key="fissu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fissūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>findo</etym>; <sense id="n18238.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a cleft</hi>, <hi rend="ital">chink</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fissure</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">quorum in digitos pedum fissura divisa est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:176" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 63, 83, § 176</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:29:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 29, 4</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 6, 33, § 101</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">efficax asini sevum labrorum fissuris,</quote> <trans><tr>chapped lips</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:188" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 12, 50, § 188</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fissus: <entryFree id="n18239" type="main" key="fissus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fissus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, v. findo.</entryFree>
fistella: <entryFree id="n18240" type="main" key="fistella"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fistella</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>fistula</etym>, <sense id="n18240.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little pipe</hi>, Pelagon. Art. Vet. 24.</sense></entryFree>
fistuca: <entryFree id="n18241" type="main" key="fistu_ca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fistūca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n18241.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an instrument for ramming down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a rammer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beetle</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:17:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 17, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 28, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:185" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 25, 61, § 185</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
fistucatio: <entryFree id="n18242" type="main" key="fistu_ca_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fistūcātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>fistuco</etym>, <sense id="n18242.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a ramming down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ramming fast</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
fistuco: <entryFree id="n18243" type="main" key="fistu_co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fistūco</orth>, no <sense id="n18243.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>fistuca</etym>,<cb n="FIXU" />  <hi rend="ital">to ram down</hi> or <hi rend="ital">in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to ram fast</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fundamenta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 18, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:188" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 25, 63, § 188</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7, 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rudus pedali crassitudine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:186" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 25, 62, § 186</bibl></cit>.—In the <hi rend="ital">part. perf. absol.</hi>: terram circa radices fistucato spissandam, <hi rend="ital">by ramming down</hi>, i. q. fistucatione, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 11, 16, § 87</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
fistula: <entryFree id="n18244" type="main" key="fistu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fistŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>findo, fis-sum</etym>. <sense id="n18244.0" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a pipe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tube</hi>, e. g. <hi rend="ital">a water-pipe</hi> (usually of lead; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: tubus, canalis, sypho),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,012:11:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Perd. 11, 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Aquaed. 25 sq" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Aquaed. 25 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:224" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 103, 106, § 224</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:58" default="NO" valid="yes">31, 6, 31, § 58</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 122</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3322</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3324</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3892</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">the wind-pipe and gullet</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:175" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 66, § 175</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:11:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 11, 4</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">the tubular vessels in the lungs</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:188" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 72, § 188</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">in the teeth</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:163" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 11, 37, 62, § 163</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">a hole in a sponge</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:123 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 31, 11, 47, § 123 al.</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">the blow-hole</hi> of the whale, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 7, 6, § 19</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n18244.1" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n18244.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A hollow reed-stalk</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a reed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cane</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 22, 48, § 106</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:66" default="NO" valid="yes">19, 5, 23, § 66</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n18244.3" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n18244.4" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">A reed-pipe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shepherd's pipe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pipes of Pan</hi> (made of several reeds gradually decreasing in length and calibre), <hi rend="ital">the Greek</hi> <foreign lang="greek">su/rigc</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">invented by Pan</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">tibia, sura): fistula, cui semper decrescit arundinis ordo: Nam calamus cerā jungitur usque minor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:5:31" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 5, 31</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:2:32 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 2, 32 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:688 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 688 sq.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 682</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">13, 784</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:204" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 56, 57, § 204</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:1:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 1, 24</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 12, 10</bibl> et al.: eburneola, <hi rend="ital">a pitch-pipe</hi>, for giving the tone in which an orator should speak, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:60:225 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 60, 225 sq.</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:27" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 10, 27</bibl>.— In comic transf.: itaque et ludis et gladiatoribus mirandas <foreign lang="greek">e)pishmasi/as</foreign> sine ulla pastoricia fistula auferebamus, i. e. <hi rend="ital">without being hissed off</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:16:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 16, 11</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n18244.5" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">A writing-reed</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:3:14" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 3, 14</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n18244.6" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A sort of ulcer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a fistula</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 8 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 9, 33, § 55</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:88" default="NO" valid="yes">24, 11, 51, § 88</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 157, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:21:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 21, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n18244.7" n="C" level="2"> Fistula sutoria, <hi rend="ital">a shoemaker's punch</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 14, 23, § 100</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n18244.8" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A catheter</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aeneae fistulae fiunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:26:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 26, 1 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n18244.9" n="E" level="2"> Fistula farraria, <hi rend="ital">a sort of hand-mill for grinding corn</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 10, 3</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">also called fistula serrata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 10, 23, § 97</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fistularis: <entryFree id="n18245" type="main" key="fistu^la_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fistŭlāris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>fistula</etym> (post-class.). <sense id="n18245.0" n="I" level="1"> (Acc. to fistula, II. A. 2. a.) <hi rend="ital">Like a shepherd's pipe</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">versus,</quote> <trans><tr>which gradually increase by a syllable</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 498</bibl></cit> P.—</sense><sense id="n18245.1" n="II" level="1"> (Acc. to fistula, II. B.) <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">for a fistula</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">medicamentum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 2, 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fistularius: <entryFree id="n18246" type="gloss" key="fistu^la_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fistŭlārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n18246.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a player on the shepherd's pipe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a piper</hi> (in Cic. fistulator), <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Fabr.</author> p. 625</bibl>, <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> 218.</sense></entryFree>
fistulatim: <entryFree id="n18247" type="main" key="fistu^la_tim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fistŭlātim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n18247.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">in the shape of pipes</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">excussus fimus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 4, p. 144, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fistulator: <entryFree id="n18248" type="main" key="fistu^la_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fistŭlātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n18248.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a player on the shepherd's pipe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a piper</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fistulatorem domi relinquetis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:61:227" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 61, 227</bibl></cit> (see the passage in connection); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 5:1:22" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 5, 1, 22</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
fistulatorius: <entryFree id="n18249" type="main" key="fistu^la_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fistŭlātōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>fistulator</etym>, <sense id="n18249.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a player on the pipes</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">artes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2, 73</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fistulatus: <entryFree id="n18250" type="main" key="fistu^la_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fistŭlātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>fistula</etym> (postAug.). <sense id="n18250.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Furnished with pipes</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tabulae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:31" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 31</bibl></cit> Oud. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n18250.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Pipe-shaped</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">venae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aera,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 9, 13</bibl></cit> Carm. 4.</sense></entryFree>
fistulesco: <entryFree id="n18251" type="main" key="fistu^lesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fistŭlesco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n18251.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [id.], <hi rend="ital">to become full of holes</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">ligna fistulescunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> Myth. 2, 19</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fistulosus: <entryFree id="n18252" type="main" key="fistu^lo_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fistŭlōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n18252.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Pipeshaped</hi>, <hi rend="ital">full of holes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">porous</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">terra bibula et pumicis vice fistulosa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 11, 29, § 110</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">terra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 17, 5, 3, § 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">telum culicis sorbendo fistulosum,</quote> <trans><tr>hollow</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 11, 2, 1, § 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aculeus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:173" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 11, 37, 65, § 173</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lapis,</quote> <trans><tr>porous</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:174" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 36, 23, 53, § 174</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">densitas spongiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 27, 8, 45, § 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caseus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:8:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 8, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18252.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Having fistulas</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fistulous</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cancer,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 157, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
fisus: <entryFree id="n18253" type="main" key="fi_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fīsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from fido.</entryFree>
fitilla: <entryFree id="n18254" type="main" key="fitilla"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fitilla</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">fritilla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n18254.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a gruel used at sacrifices</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 1:6:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 1, 6, 3</bibl> Fickert <hi rend="ital">N. cr.;</hi> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 8, 19, § 84</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2, 58</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 230</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
fivere: <entryFree id="n18255" type="main" key="fivere"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fivere</orth> <itype>item</itype> (apud Catonem) pro figere, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=92:8" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 92, 8</bibl> Müll.</entryFree>
fixe: <entryFree id="n18256" type="main" key="fixe_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fixē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. figo, <sense id="n18256.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
fixulas: <entryFree id="n18257" type="gloss" key="fixulas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fixulas</orth>, <itype>fibulas</itype>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=90:1" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 90, 1</bibl> Müll.</entryFree>
fixura: <entryFree id="n18258" type="main" key="fixu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fixūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>figo</etym>, <sense id="n18258.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fastening</hi>, <hi rend="ital">driving in</hi> of nails (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Gnost. 1</bibl> <hi rend="ital">med.; the print of nails</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Johann. 20, 25</bibl>. <cb n="FLAG" /></sense></entryFree>
fixus: <entryFree id="n18259" type="main" key="fixus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">fixus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from figo.</entryFree>
flabellifera: <entryFree id="n18260" type="main" key="fla_belli^fe^ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">flābellĭfĕra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>flabellum-fero</etym>, <sense id="n18260.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fan-bearer</hi>, a female slave, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:1:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 1, 22</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
flabello: <entryFree id="n18261" type="main" key="fla_bello"><orth extent="full" lang="la">flābello</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>flabellum</etym>, <sense id="n18261.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to fan</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">cum calor in affectationem flabellatur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pall. 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
flabellulum: <entryFree id="n18262" type="main" key="fla_bellu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">flābellŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n18262.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little fan</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:5:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 5, 50</bibl> (Bentl., Fleck., Umpfenb.; dub.; al. flabellum).</sense></entryFree>
flabellum: <entryFree id="n18263" type="main" key="fla_bellum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">flābellum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>flabrum</etym>, <sense id="n18263.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a smali fan</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fly-flap.</hi> </sense><sense id="n18263.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">cape hoc flabellum, et ventulum huic sic facito,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:5:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 5, 47</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">50</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:82:10" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 82, 10</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">for this a peacock's tail was used,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:24" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 24</bibl></cit> (3, 18), 11; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 27, 13</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n18263.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus lingua quasi flabello seditionis, illa tum est egentium concio ventilata,</quote> <trans><tr>an exciter</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 23, 54</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
flabilis: <entryFree id="n18264" type="main" key="fla_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">flābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>flo</etym>, <sense id="n18264.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">airy.</hi> * </sense><sense id="n18264.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil est in animis mixtum atque concretum ... nihil ne aut humidum quidem aut flabile aut igneum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:27:66" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 27, 66</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18264.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">spiritual</hi> (eccl. Lat.): aedes, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 10, 347 al.</sense></entryFree>
flabra: <entryFree id="n18265" type="main" key="fla_bra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">flābra</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n18265.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">blasts</hi>, esp. of wind; or, concr., <hi rend="ital">breezes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">winds</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">flabraque ventorum violento turbine vexant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:217" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 217</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Etesia Aquilonum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:742" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 742</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:730" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 730</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Boreae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:27:12" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 27, 12</bibl></cit> (3, 23, 12 M.): <cit><quote lang="la">lenia Austri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:665" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 6, 665</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">freta spirantibus incita flabris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:428" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 428</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:719" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 719</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non hiemes illam, non flabra neque imbres Convellunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:293" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 293</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
flabralis: <entryFree id="n18266" type="main" key="fla_bra_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">flābrālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>flabra</etym>, <sense id="n18266.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">breezy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">airy</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">frigus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Apoth. 841</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
flabrarius: <entryFree id="n18267" type="gloss" key="fla_bra_rius"><orth extent="full" lang="la">flābrārius</orth> = custos corporum, Isid. Gloss.</entryFree>
flacceo: <entryFree id="n18268" type="main" key="flacce^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">flaccĕo</orth>, <itype>ēre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>flaccus</etym>, <sense id="n18268.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to be flabby</hi> or <hi rend="ital">flaccid.</hi> </sense><sense id="n18268.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">aures pendulae atque flaccentes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> Opif. D. 8, 8</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n18268.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to be faint</hi>, <hi rend="ital">languid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">weak; to flag</hi>, <hi rend="ital">droop</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">flaccet, languet, deficit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 110, 10</bibl></cit> (mostly ante- and post-class.): sceptra flaccent, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 110, 12</bibl>: flaccet fortitudo. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0404,001:ib. 13" default="NO"><author>Afran.</author> ib. 13</bibl>: sin flaccebunt condiciones, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 110, 14</bibl> (Trag. v. 401 ed. Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">oratio vestra rebus flaccet, spiritu viget,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Apol. p. 290</bibl></cit>: Messala flaccet, <hi rend="ital">flags</hi>, <hi rend="ital">loses courage</hi>, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:14:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 14, 4</bibl> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Messala languet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:15:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 4, 15, 7</bibl></cit>): <cit><quote lang="la">erunt irrigua ejus flaccentia,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>dried up</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:19:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Isa. 19, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
flaccesco: <entryFree id="n18269" type="main" key="flaccesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">flaccesco</orth> (ante-class. also <orth extent="full" lang="la">flaccisco</orth>), <itype>flaccŭi, 3</itype>, <sense id="n18269.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to wilt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wither</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dry up</hi> (cf. tabesco). </sense><sense id="n18269.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">faeniculum cum legeris, sub tecto exponito, dum flaccescat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:7:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 7, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flaccescente fronde,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 9, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stercus cum flaccuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:13:4" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 13, 4</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n18269.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to become faint</hi> or <hi rend="ital">feeble</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to droop</hi>, <hi rend="ital">languish</hi>: flucti flacciscunt, silescunt venti, Pac. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 488, 15</bibl> (Trag. Rel. v. 77 ed. Rib.): flaccescebat oratio, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:24:93" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 24, 93</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">flaccescentes voluptates,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 4, 142</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad numerum cymbalorum mollita indignatione flaccescunt,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>become mild</tr>, <tr>softened</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 237</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
flaccianus: <entryFree id="n18270" type="main" key="Flacci^a_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Flaccĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. 2. Flaccus, II.</entryFree>
flaccidus: <entryFree id="n18271" type="main" key="flacci^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">flaccĭdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>flaccus</etym>, <sense id="n18271.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">flabby</hi>, <hi rend="ital">flaccid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pendulous</hi> (cf. marcidus). </sense><sense id="n18271.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">aures,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:6:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 6, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:205" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 51, 77, § 205</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">folium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 15, 30, 39, § 127</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vela (with pendula),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. p. 365</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18271.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">languid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">feeble</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">flaccidiore turbine fertur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:632" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 632</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">argumentatio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 7, 251</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
flaccus: <entryFree id="n18272" type="main" key="flaccus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">flaccus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>etym. dub.</etym>, <sense id="n18272.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">flabby</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hanging down.</hi> </sense><sense id="n18272.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">auriculae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:9:4" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 9, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18272.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of persons, <hi rend="ital">flap-eared</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ecquos deos paetulos esse arbitramur? ecquos silos, flaccos, frontones, capitones, quae sunt in nobis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:29:80" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 29, 80</bibl></cit>.—Hence,</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n18273" type="main" key="Flaccus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Flaccus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n18273.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman surname;</hi> cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aures homini tantum immobiles: ab iis Flaccorum cognomina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 50, § 136</bibl></cit>; esp. freq. in the gens Valeria, Cornelia, and Horatia; <cit><quote lang="la">e. g. si quid in Flacco viri est, i. e. in Q. Horatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:15:12" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 15, 12</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n18273.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the writings of Horace</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">stabunt pueri, cum totus decolor esset Flaccus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:227" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 227</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n18273.2" n="II" level="1"> Deriv.: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Flaccĭā-nus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a Flaccus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Flaccian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">area,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:6:3:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 6, 3, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
